items.title: 75 Potluck Side Dishes to Feed a Crowd
items.abstract: Need a dish to pass? Hosting a large party? This collection includes crowd-pleasing side dish recipes for all kinds of gatherings. Find recipes for make-ahead potatoes, baked beans, potato salad, veggie side dishes and more.
items.author: Caroline Stanko

images.title: You're-Bacon-Me-Crazy Potato Salad
images.description: The stuff from the deli just isn't our thing, but for us it isn't a summer cookout without potato salad! I toyed with many recipes until I developed this one. Now if I even mention grilling or barbecuing, this side dish is my family's top request. —Paul Cogswell, League City, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Tangy Bacon Green Beans
images.description: My grandmother’s Pennsylvania Dutch-style recipe turns plain old green beans into a tangy cross between three-bean and German potato salad. —Sharon Tipton, Casselberry, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Summer Orzo
images.description: I’m always looking for fun ways to use the fresh veggies that come in my Community Supported Agriculture box, and this salad is one of my favorite creations. I like to improvise with whatever I have on hand, feel free to do the same here! —Shayna Marmar, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cumin-Roasted Carrots
images.description: Carrots make a super side—big on flavor and a breeze to cook. Plus, I can actually get my husband to eat these fragrant, deeply spiced veggies. —Taylor Kiser, Brandon, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Loaded Baked Potato Casserole
images.description: When I bake this for my family, any leftovers are always gone by morning. In the night, people sneak downstairs for a little snack! Stir in broccoli, asparagus or peas if you've got 'em. —Colleen Trenholm, Dartmouth, Nova Scotia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fresh Artichokes with Lemon-Yogurt Dip
images.description: Artichokes are at their best when you prepare them simply, without a lot of fuss or seasonings to overdress them. Many people dip the petals in melted butter or mayonnaise, but I think you'll love my tangy lemon-yogurt dip. —Jill Haapaniemi, Brooklyn, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Greek-Style Stuffed Acorn Squash
images.description: With a truckload of acorn squash in my pantry, I wanted to make stuffed squash in lots of different ways. A bottle of Greek seasoning got my creativity flowing. —Teri Rasey, Cadillac, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Crispy Mashed Potato Cakes
images.description: I love finding ways to use holiday leftovers. These potato cakes use the mashed potatoes, stuffing and breadcrumbs. To go all out, add meat and cheese. —Jeri Psikal, Norman, Oklahoma Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Festive Fall Tortellini Toss
images.description: Fall is my favorite season and I love the foods of autumn, such as mushrooms, squash, apples and walnuts. I combined these all with pasta to make a delicious side dish perfect for sharing at a potluck; the recipe can easily be doubled and can be served either warm or at room temperature. —Roxanne Chan, Albany, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pesto Pasta & Potatoes
images.description: Although this healthy pasta dish is pretty simple to begin with, it's made even easier because you can throw the green beans and pasta into one big pot to cook. —Laura Flowers, Moscow, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Scalloped Taters
images.description: This creamy and comforting slow-cooked side tastes great with almost any main dish and is a snap to assemble with convenient frozen hash browns. It's a good way to make potatoes when your oven is busy with other dishes. —Lucinda Wolker, Somerset, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Cranberries
images.description: There’s nothing to this recipe—the preparation and cooking are so quick. I throw in dried cranberries, but you can let your imagination take over. Add a handful of raisins or walnuts at the end...even sliced oranges. If your Brussels sprouts are large, cut them in half. —Ellen Ruzinsky, Yorktown Heights, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roasted Balsamic Sweet Potatoes
images.description: By the end of summer, I’m done with the usual potato salad. This warm, spicy side kicks off cozy season. —Karen Vande Slunt, Watertown, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cottage Potatoes
images.description: I often make this crunchy and colorful potato dish for our family reunions. It's my cousin's recipe, and we always know we'll never have any leftovers. —Mary C. Sholtis, Ashtabula, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow-Simmered Kidney Beans
images.description: My husband always puts us down for a side dish when we're invited to a potluck. Canned beans cut down on prep time yet get plenty of zip from bacon, apple, red pepper and onion. I like simmering this mixture in the slow cooker because it blends the flavors and I don't have to stand over the stove. —Sheila Vail, Long Beach, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Baked Parmesan Broccoli
images.description: I began making this creamy side dish years ago as a way to get my kids to eat broccoli. They've since grown up, but still request this satisfying dish. It's truly a family favorite. —Barbara Uhl, Wesley Chapel, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spicy Sweet Potato Chips & Cilantro Dip
images.description: This cool, creamy dip is a great partner for the spicy sweet potato chips. They're made for each other! —Elizabeth Godecke, Chicago, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Partytime Beans
images.description: A friend brought this colorful bean dish to my house for a church circle potluck dinner. As soon as I tasted the slightly sweet slow-cooked beans, I had to have the recipe. I've served the beans and shared the recipe many times since. —Jean Cantner, Boston, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Baked Two-Cheese & Bacon Grits
images.description: In the South, everyone loves three things: bacon, cheese and grits! After playing around with this recipe, I took it to my first family party as a newlywed and it was a huge hit. This recipe has become a family tradition that will hopefully be passed down for generations. —Melissa Rogers, Tuscaloosa, Alabama Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Sweet Potatoes
images.description: I took my mother's delicious sweet potato casserole recipe and gave it a new twist by adding the tempting taste of orange-a fruit very abundant in our state. The flavors are wonderful together and make this dish a family favorite. —Norma Poole, Auburndale, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cheesy Slow-Cooked Corn
images.description: My family really likes this creamy, cheesy side dish—and it's so easy to make. Even those who usually don't eat much corn will ask for a second helping. —Mary Ann Truitt, Wichita, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Colcannon Potatoes
images.description: Every Irish family has its own version or this classic dish. My recipe comes from my father's family in Ireland. It's part of my St. Pat's menu, along with lamb chops, carrots and soda bread. —Marilou Robinson, Portland, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cheesy Corn Spoon Bread
images.description: Homey and comforting, this custard-like side dish is a much-requested recipe at potlucks and holiday dinners. The jalapeno pepper adds just the right bite. Seconds helpings of this tasty casserole are common—leftovers aren't. —Katherine Franklin, Carbondale, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Potato, Orange & Pineapple Crunch
images.description: I combined my two absolute favorite sweet potato casseroles in the world to create my own version for the holiday table. —Lisa Varner, El Paso, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Parmesan Spinach Bake
images.description: This creamy, comforting side dish wonderfully rounds out any holiday dinner. Just a little of this rich casserole goes a long way. —Jennifer Bley, Austin, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Loaded Mashed Potatoes
images.description: Tired of the same old mashed potatoes, I whipped up this new family favorite. We can't get enough of them at our house. Often, I'll prepare this dish ahead and refrigerate it. Then I bake it just before serving. —Dawn Reuter, Oxford, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Potluck Macaroni and Cheese
images.description: This is a great way to make America's most popular comfort food. The dish turns out cheesy, rich and creamy. —Jennifer Babcock, Chicopee, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Coconut-Bourbon Sweet Potatoes
images.description: What is it about sweet potatoes that unnerve some people? For those who firmly state they hate a yam because of the color or texture, the rich addition of coconut, bourbon and spices might just win them over. —Rebecca Anderson, Driftwood, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Parmesan Asparagus
images.description: Nothing could be more simple than this side dish. Since it has just four ingredients, I assemble it in no time, then pop it into the oven for about 15 minutes. It turns out perfect every time. —Mary Ann Marino, West Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Black-Eyed Peas & Ham
images.description: Every New Year's Day we have these slow-cooked black-eyed peas to bring good luck for the coming year. —Dawn Frihauf, Fort Morgan, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sausage Bread Dressing
images.description: My husband and father go crazy for this dressing. Although leftovers are rare, it freezes quite well. To save time, chop the veggies and prepare the stuffing mix ahead of time. —Bette Votral, Bethlehem, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sausage Spinach Bake
images.description: This delicious recipe using a packaged stuffing mix was given to me some years ago by a friend. A salad and bread of your choice is all you’ll need for a filling lunch or dinner. It’s so versatile, you can even serve it at brunch. –Kathleen Grant, Swan Lake, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Bacon & Broccoli Salad
images.description: You'll want to serve this family-friendly side dish year-round. The broccoli gets a big-time flavor boost from bacon, toasted pecans, dried berries and a mayo dressing. —Cindi Read, Hendersonville, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pretzel-Topped Sweet Potatoes
images.description: Friends with whom I've shared this recipe say it's their favorite way to serve sweet potatoes. I like to make it for brunch as a colorful go-with dish. The mingled sweet, tart and salty tastes are an unusual treat. —Sue Mallory, Lancaster, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Beans, Bacon & Tomato Bake
images.description: Bacon, tomatoes and lima beans combine for a nutrient-packed side dish that makes the perfect accompaniment to turkey. —Karen Kumpulainen, Forest City, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Apple-Cranberry Stuffing
images.description: I leave out the giblets my mom used in stuffing and bump up the apples, wild rice and cranberries instead. —Miranda Allison, Simpsonville, SC Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Twice-Baked Cheddar Potato Casserole
images.description: Bacon, cheddar and sour cream turn ordinary potatoes into an extraordinary casserole. It's one of our family's beloved standards for the holidays. —Kyle Cox, Scottsdale, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sausage & Rice Stuffed Pumpkins
images.description: My children often request this dish. It also adds a great "wow" factor to a festive buffet table.—Andria Peckham, Lowell, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Artichoke Spinach Casserole
images.description: Although he isn't a fan of spinach, my husband loves this dish. The combination of ingredients may sound unusual, but the flavors meld well. It's an excellent side vegetable for a formal dinner. Our two children are both grown. -Judy Johnson, Missoula, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brussels Sprouts & Kale Saute
images.description: In an effort to add more greens to our meals, I created this dish—and my kids eat it up. The crispy salami is the "hook." —Jennifer Mcnabb, Brentwood, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Traditional Holiday Stuffing
images.description: Sausage and sage add a gourmet taste to this stuffing. It's perfect for large family gatherings, but you can also save some for later. —Lorraine Brauckhoff, Zolfo Springs, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Citrus Sweet Potatoes
images.description: A mild orange glaze lets the taste of sweet potatoes shine through in this nut-topped side dish. When I was dating my husband, my mother would make this whenever he'd come over for Sunday dinner. We've been married more than 40 years, and he thinks I can make it almost as good as Mom did. —Pauline Kelley of St. Peters, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Bacon Mac & Cheese
images.description: I’m all about easy slow-cooker meals. Using more cheese than ever, I’ve developed an addictive spin on this casserole favorite. —Kristen Heigl, Staten Island, NY Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Honey-Butter Peas and Carrots
images.description: This classic combination of peas and carrots is enriched with a handful of flavor enhancers. Slow cooking allows the ingredients to meld for maximum richness. —Theresa Kreyche, Tustin, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry & Fontina Stuffed Portobellos
images.description: I developed this hearty appetizer for my mushroom-lovin’ kids. They’re grown now with families of their own, but they still lobby for these when they come home. —Wendy Rusch, Trego, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Butternut Squash with Whole Grains
images.description: Fresh thyme really shines in this hearty slow-cooked side dish featuring tender butternut squash, nutritious whole grain pilaf and vitamin-packed baby spinach. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mushroom Wild Rice
images.description: This is one of my favorite recipes from my mother. With only seven ingredients, it's quick to assemble in the morning before I leave for work. By the time I get home, mouthwatering aromas have filled the house. —Bob Malchow, Monon, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Winter Squash Casserole
images.description: Years ago, our vegetable garden kept us well supplied all year long. Dad stored huge piles of potatoes and squash in the coldest part of the basement. In winter the squash was so hard. Mother sometimes used an ax to cut it into small pieces for cooking! Her hard work was worth it, because we really enjoyed this wonderful casserole! —Glendora Hauger, Siren, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Loaded Smashed Potatoes
images.description: If mashed potatoes are a must at your family Thanksgiving, then why not go all out with the works? I love garlic, onions and bacon, and this dish has all three! —Kathy Harding, Richmond, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Buttery Horseradish Corn on the Cob
images.description: For a July Fourth barbecue, I whipped up a butter and horseradish topping for grilled corn. People actually formed a line to get seconds. —Trish Loewen, Bakersfield, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Zucchini Stuffing
images.description: I've been serving this dish for years and always receive compliments on it. If you don't have day-old bread in your pantry, simply slice fresh bread and bake it at 300° for 10 minutes. —Mary Ann Dell, Phoenixville, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Thyme-Roasted Carrots
images.description: Cutting the carrots lengthwise makes this dish look extra pretty. For even more elegance, garnish with sprigs of fresh thyme or parsley. —Deirdre Cox, Kansas City, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Special Herb Dressing
images.description: Our budget was tight when our children were small, so I cooked with ground beef often. Nowadays, I make this creative casserole simply because we love it! —Trudy Williams, Shannonville, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Tangy Baked Seven Beans
images.description: Everyone needs a go-to side dish for school events, picnics and potlucks. Here's mine. Freeze leftovers for future outings. —Rod Lundwall, Tooele, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brussels Sprouts with Bacon & Garlic
images.description: When we have company, these sprouts are my go-to side dish because they look and taste fantastic. Fancy them up a notch with pancetta instead of bacon. —Mandy Rivers, Lexington, South Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Favorite Cheesy Potatoes
images.description: My kids, husband and nephews love these potatoes. I make a large batch in disposable pans and serve them at get-togethers— the holidays aren't the same without them. It's also a great recipe for brunch or a ham dinner.—Brenda Smith, Curran, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Garlic-Sesame Green Beans
images.description: Sauteed bits of garlic and shallot, plus a sprinkling of toasted sesame seeds, turn ordinary beans into something special. Keep the recipe in mind for your garden crop in summer, too. —Deirdre Cox, Kansas City, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow-Cooked Beans
images.description: This flavorful bean dish adds nice variety to any buffet, because it’s a bit different from traditional baked beans. It’s a snap to prepare, too, since it uses convenient canned beans, barbecue sauce and salsa. —Joy Beck, Cincinnati, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Triple Mash with Horseradish Bread Crumbs
images.description: Why settle for traditional mashed potatoes when you can enjoy three times the flavor? Combine spuds with rutabaga and parsnips, along with the zip of horseradish, for a taste treat. —Lily Julow, Lawrenceville, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Savory Sausage Stuffing
images.description: I used to make the same old dressing every year for Thanksgiving. About 10 years ago, I decided to jazz up my recipe by adding pork sausage. Now everyone requests it for all our holiday meals. —Ursula Hernandez, Waltham, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Three-Bean Baked Beans
images.description: I got this recipe from an aunt and made a couple of changes to suit our tastes. With ground beef and bacon mixed in, these satisfying beans are a big hit at backyard barbecues and church picnics. I'm always asked to bring my "special" beans. —Julie Currington, Gahanna, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Veggie Macaroni & Cheese
images.description: This creamy mac 'n' cheese definitely doesn't come from a box! Fresh veggies add crunch and color and will leave everyone saying, "More, please!" —Marsha Morril, Harrisburg, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Homemade Pierogies
images.description: Pierogies are dumplings stuffed with a filling, often potatoes and cheese, and boiled, then sizzled with butter. Our friends always ask us to bring them to potlucks. —Diane Gawrys, Manchester, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Party Potatoes
images.description: These creamy tasty potatoes can be made the day before and stored in the refrigerator until you're ready to pop them in the oven (I often do that). The garlic powder and chives add zip, and the shredded cheese adds color. —Sharon Mensing, Greenfield, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Holiday Green Bean Casserole
images.description: Try this green bean casserole this year, and you'll never go back to the old stuff. — Laura Fall-Sutton, Buhl, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brandy-Glazed Carrots
images.description: Carrots sport a light brandy sauce for a beautiful side with mass appeal. —Tammy Landry, Saucier, Mississippi Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Deluxe Hash Brown Casserole
images.description: My son-in-law gave me the recipe for this hash brown casserole, which my kids say is addictive. It's an amazing make-ahead dish.—Amy Oswalt, Burr, Nebraska Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Green Bean-Cherry Tomato Salad
images.description: My grandmother made a cold green bean salad with potatoes for every family barbecue. Now I bring my own version of the recipes to parties. With added color and taste from the cherry tomatoes, this classic favorite is even better. —Angela Lemoine, Howell, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon Mushroom Orzo
images.description: Sometimes I serve this side dish chilled; sometimes I serve it hot. It has a very lovely appearance and goes well with almost any entree. —Shelly Nelson, Akeley, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Broccoli Cheddar Squares
images.description: For many years, I’ve made these cheesy broccoli squares for tailgate parties, book club and other events. They’re excellent served warm or hot, but we enjoy them cold, too. —Veronica Downen, Crystal Beach, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Garlic Roasted Brussels Sprouts
images.description: My roommate and I used to make garlicky Brussels sprouts at least twice a week. Now I make them as a healthy side for all sorts of occasions. —Katherine Moore-Colasurd, Cincinnati, OH Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Country Potato Pancakes
images.description: Potato pancakes are really versatile. They can be a side dish for just about any meal or the main course for a light meal. Potato pancakes go particularly well with pork. We have them often at our house. —Lydia Robotewskyj, Franklin, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet N Sour Beans
images.description: This recipe is popular on both sides of the border. It came from a friend in Alaska, then traveled with me to old Mexico, where I lived for 5 years, and is now a potluck favorite in my Arkansas community. It's easy to keep the beans warm and serve from a slow cooker. -Barbara Short, Mena, Arkansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Green Beans with Yellow-Pepper Butter
images.description: Colorful, crunchy and buttery, this bean dish comes together quickly and will be a hit at your holiday table. For variation, sprinkle toasted pine nuts over the top just before serving. —Judie White, Florien, Louisiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fourth of July Bean Casserole
images.description: The outstanding barbecue taste of these beans makes them a favorite for cookouts all summer and into the fall. It's a popular dish with everyone—even kids. The beef makes it so much better than plain pork and beans. —Donna Fancher, Lawrence, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 75 Potluck Side Dishes to Feed a Crowd

items.title: 33 Ways to Use Up Leftover Mashed Potatoes
items.abstract: You'll want to make extra mashed potatoes just for these recipes! From potato pancakes and shepherd's pie to doughnuts, dumplings and breads, here's what to do with leftover mashed potatoes.
items.author: Caroline Stanko

images.title: Delicious Potato Doughnuts
images.description: I first tried these tasty treats at my sister's house and thought they were the best I'd ever had. They're easy to make, and the fudge frosting tops them off well. When I make them for friends, the recipe is always requested. —Pat Davis, Beulah, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Meat Shell Potato Pie
images.description: Guests always comment on the presentation and flavor of this delightfully different dish. —Julie Sterchi, Flora, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Bacon-Cheddar Potato Croquettes
images.description: Instead of throwing out leftover mashed potatoes, use them to make croquettes. The little baked balls are yummy with ranch dressing, barbecue sauce or Dijon mayonnaise for dipping. —Pamela Shank, Parkersburg, West Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Bacon Potato Waffles
images.description: I like to garnish these great waffles with sour cream and chives, or even a simple cheese sauce. My mother used to sprinkle them with a touch of sugar. —Laura Fall-Sutton, Buhl, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pork Shepherd's Pie
images.description: Of all the shepherd's pie recipes I've tried through the years, this version is my favorite. Although I live alone, I enjoy cooking and baking for friends and family. —Mary Arthurs, Etobicoke, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Potato Rolls
images.description: After I discovered this recipe, it became a mainstay for me. I make the dough ahead of time when company is coming, and I try to keep some in the refrigerator to bake for our ranch hands. Leftover mashed potatoes are almost sure to go into these rolls. —Jeanette McKinney, Belleview, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Broccoli Potato Supreme
images.description: My family insists that this two-in-one casserole makes an appearance at all of our special meals. Every bite is doubly delicious! —Jane Birch, Edison, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Holiday Stromboli
images.description: At our house, we wrap holiday leftovers in pizza crust as a yummy way to finish them off. Here’s to getting the flavor, without the all-day cooking. —Alia Slatton, Boulder, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Doughnuts
images.description: The coffee-flavored glaze on these moist and tasty doughnuts makes them a perfect way to start off the morning...on Christmas Day or any day. You'll find this recipe is a great way to use up leftover potatoes. —Pat Siebenaler, Random Lake, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Skillet Shepherd's Pie
images.description: This is the best shepherd's pie I've ever tasted. It's very quick to make, and I usually have most—if not all—of the ingredients already on hand. —Tirzah Sandt, San Diego, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cinnamon-Walnut Sticky Buns
images.description: The sweet honey-walnut topping and tender texture make these sticky rolls a surefire crowd-pleaser. —Debbie Broeker, Rocky Mount, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spinach Quiche with Potato Crust
images.description: I love this recipe because it is great to use up leftover mashed potatoes and vegetables, especially the day after a big meal. You can substitute sweet Italian sausage for the bacon if you want a heartier quiche. —Heather King, Frostburg, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Breaded Sea Scallops
images.description: I never liked seafood until my husband urged me to try scallops, and now I love them. He says my breaded version is the best he's ever had. A tip I learned was to put them on a paper-towel-topped plate to soak up excess oil. —Martina Preston, Willow Grove, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grandma's Potato Dumplings
images.description: Don't be surprised if you make too many mashed potatoes on purpose. Day-old rolls and leftover spuds are scrumptious the second time around, turned into buttery potato dumplings. —Wendy Stenman, Germantown, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Crispy Mashed Potato Cakes
images.description: I love finding ways to use holiday leftovers. These potato cakes use the mashed potatoes, stuffing and breadcrumbs. To go all out, add meat and cheese. —Jeri Psikal, Norman, Oklahoma Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pierogi Quesadillas
images.description: When I had hungry children in the kitchen and nothing but leftovers, I invented Pierogi Quesadillas. Now it's how we always use up our potatoes, meats and sometimes veggies. —Andrea Dibble, Solon, IA Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grandma Russell's Bread
images.description: I remember as a child always smelling fresh homemade bread and rolls whenever I walked into Grandma's house. The warm slices were delicious and melted in my mouth! —Janet Polito, Nampa, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Skillet Shepherd's Pie For 2
images.description: Leftover mashed potatoes? Add them to a few pantry staples and you'll have warm comfort food in no time! —Sharon Tipton, Orlando, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chive Pinwheel Rolls
images.description: These light pleasant-tasting rolls complement almost any entree. With the chive filling swirled through the golden bread, they're attractive enough for special occasions. -Ann Niemela, Ely, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Stuffin' Muffins
images.description: If you love stuffing, you won’t be able to get enough of these fun muffin cups that not only make use of leftover stuffing but also green beans, turkey, mashed potatoes, cheddar and gravy. It’s a taste of Thanksgiving in every bite! —Pauline Porterfield, Roxboro, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: A Christmas Story Meat Loaf
images.description: I've watched the film “A Christmas Story” so many times since I was a kid. Now I have a family of my own, so I re-created the mom’s meatloaf and mashed potatoes. —Christina Addison, Blanchester, OH Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mashed Potato Beef Casserole
images.description: This recipe came out of my mother's cookbook. The smudges and splatters show that Mom used it extensively to feed our large family. The tarragon really comes through to make a flavorful main dish. Now I prepare this recipe for our four children and six grandchildren. —Helen McGeorge, Abbotsford, British Columbia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Super Spud Brownies
images.description: These moist and cakey brownies came from my mom’s old cookbook. Mashed potatoes may seem like an unusual ingredient, but this recipe took first place at a local festival. —Marlene Gerer, Denton, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Miniature Shepherd's Pies
images.description: These mini pies are ideal for nibbling at holiday parties. If ground beef isn't your preference, change up the flavor with ground lamb and a teaspoon of dried rosemary instead. —Suzanne Banfield, Basking Ridge, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Potato Pan Rolls
images.description: My family loves these rolls, which is why they're requested often. They don't take long to make because quick-rise yeast is used. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Swedish Doughnuts
images.description: One day, my father got a hankering for doughnuts and asked me to make him some. I ended up trying these. Dad—and everyone else—loved the results. They come out so golden and plump. —Lisa Bates, Dunham, Quebec Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Iced Cinnamon Potato Rolls
images.description: This recipe comes from my mother-in-law, who remembers making these rolls often. Now I make them often. Maybe they'll be a hit with your family, too!—Mrs. Jonas Schwartz, Berne, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Corn Potato Pancakes
images.description: "I love combining different foods to see what I can come up with," writes Carolyn Wilson from Lyndon, Kansas. She puts last night's mashed potatoes to delicious use in these slightly crisp golden brown cakes. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Potato Puffs
images.description: I give this recipe out often. It's suitable for any meal, and a terrific use of leftover potatoes. They're great alongside sandwiches or hamburgers. —June Mullins, Livonia, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Speedy Shepherd's Pie
images.description: Turn mashed potatoes and a few pantry staples into cozy comfort food. This recipe is really flexible, so if you have extra veggies on hand, stir them into the beef mixture for even more goodness. —Sharon Tipton, Winter Garden, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Loaded Stuffed Potato Pancakes
images.description: When I make mashed potatoes, I always cook extra so I can prepare these over-the-top potato pancakes. Fill them with sour cream, ranch dressing, melted cheese—or all three. —Jane Whittaker, Pensacola, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Whole Wheat Potato Rolls
images.description: My cousin’s classic-with-a-twist recipe is truly delish. Extra rolls freeze well. — Devon Vickers, Goddard, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Individual Shepherd's Pies
images.description: These comforting little pies make a fun St. Patrick's Day surprise for the family. Extras are easy to freeze and eat later on busy weeknights.—Ellen Osborne, Clarksville, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 33 Ways to Use Up Leftover Mashed Potatoes

items.title: Our Best Fudge Recipes
items.abstract: For all you fudge lovers out there, this one's for you. We've rounded up our top-rated fudge recipes, made with all kinds of chocolate and mix-ins galore.
items.author: Nicole Doster

images.title: Almond Cherry Fudge
images.description: Cooked in the microwave, this fast fudge is a sweet addition to any holiday gathering. I make this when I need a quick treat for a school party or to take to a neighbor. —Shellie Tucker, Hendersonvlle, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Butter Pecan Fudge
images.description: Toasted pecans add a nutty crunch to this creamy buttery fudge. I have given this candy with its wonderful caramel flavor, as gifts at Christmastime and people always rave about it! —Pam Smith, Alta Loma, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: 5-Ingredient Fudge
images.description: You’re moments away from a pan of creamy fudge. Just microwave, stir and spread. —Sue Tucker, Edgemoor, South Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Peanut Butter Fudge
images.description: This peanut butter fudge is a favorite "never fail" quickie recipe. —Eleanore Peterson, Fort Atkinson, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Microwave Mint Fudge
images.description: I make these creamy, smooth squares not only for Christmas, but also for Valentine's Day. This easy microwave fudge is just as good as any you'd buy in a confectionery. —Donna Roberts, Manhattan, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Swirl Fudge
images.description: For festive fudge with a new "twist," give this confection a whirl! We used vanilla chips instead of chocolate ones and added sweet cherry flavoring. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cookies 'n' Cream Fudge
images.description: I invented this confection for a bake sale at our children's school. Boy, was it a hit! The crunchy chunks of sandwich cookie soften a bit as the mixture mellows. It's so sweet that one panful serves a crowd. —Laura Lane, Richmond, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: White Pecan Fudge
images.description: Each Christmas, I package batches of this rich fudge to send to family and friends. It's just delicious! —Marie Draper, Price, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Dark Chocolate Raspberry Fudge
images.description: Something about the combination of dark chocolate and raspberry is just so addicting. This fudge makes a heartfelt homemade gift, or just a treat that's worth sharing. —Barbara Lento, Houston, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Microwave Marshmallow Fudge
images.description: A batch of this smooth fudge can be made in minutes, so it’s perfect for a bake sale when time is short. But it’s so easy, you can fix it anytime you're craving a sweet treat. Use different flavors of frosting and chips for variety.—Sue Ross, Casa Grande, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Candy Bar Fudge
images.description: My manager at work, who knows I like to try new treat recipes, shared this one with me. I've made this chewy and chocolaty fudge many times since. Packed with nuts and caramel, it's like a candy bar. Everyone who's tried it loves it. -Lois Freeman, Oxford, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Kahlua Fudge
images.description: “This is a tasty variation on fudge.” Indeed, it is! This five-ingredient recipe makes serving up treats easy and scrumptious. —Laura Hanks, Harleysville, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: My Christmas Fudge
images.description: This fudge is virtually foolproof and so creamy you won't believe it. I've searched for years for the richest fudge, and this one does it for me. You can add just about anything you like to customize it.—Barbara Miller, Oakdale, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Neapolitan Fudge
images.description: If you like Neapolitan ice cream, you will devour my fudge version of the vanilla, strawberry and chocolate favorite. It makes a great addition to any candy platter. —Faith Leonard, Delbarton, West Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Simple Macadamia Nut Fudge
images.description: My aunt now lives in Hawaii, and she keeps our family supplied with fresh pineapples, mangos and macadamia nuts...along with recipes like this one. Here on our Mississippi Delta family farm, we grow rice, soybeans and Southern pecans. When I run out of macadamias for candy-making, I substitute pecans. Whichever nuts I use, neighbors like this fudge so much that they have started to call me the "Candy Lady of Cleveland". Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Peanut Butter Fudge
images.description: My sister shared this recipe for this unbelievably easy confection. I prefer using creamy peanut butter for the mouthwatering fudge, but the chunky style works just as well. —Mary Jane Rummel, Linglestown, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Fudge
images.description: This creamy, crunchy fudge is packed with walnuts and cranberries to satisfy all who try it. Though they may seem decadent, each little bite is filled with tons of fabulous, guilt-free flavor.—Delia R. Kennedy, Deer Park, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Three-Chocolate Fudge
images.description: I make this fudge at Christmastime to give to friends and neighbors. That tradition started years ago when I made more candy than my husband, three sons and I could eat, so we shared it. It's a tasty tradition I'm glad to continue. —Betty Grantham, Hanceville, Alabama Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Root Beer Float Fudge
images.description: My children have always loved root beer floats so I came up with this fudgy treat just for them. Sweet and creamy with that familiar root beer flavor, it's always a best seller at school bake sales. —Jennifer Fisher, Austin, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Peppermint Swirl Fudge
images.description: Indulge in candy-shop flavor with these rich swirled squares. For Christmasy color, I add crushed peppermint candies and red food coloring. —Suzette Jury, Keene, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gumdrop Fudge
images.description: "Making candy is one of my favorite things to do during the holidays," pens Jennifer Short from her home in Omaha, Nebraska. "This sweet white fudge is as easy to put together as it is beautiful to serve." Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mamie Eisenhower's Fudge
images.description: My mother came across this recipe in a newspaper some 40 years ago. One taste and you'll see why it doesn't take long for a big batch to disappear. —Linda First, Hinsdale, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Maple-Bacon White Chocolate Fudge
images.description: Bored with the same old fudge? Prepare it with white chips, add maple flavoring and load it up with bacon. Then be prepared to share the recipe! —Mindie Hilton, Susanville, CA Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fudge-Topped Brownies
images.description: If you love brownies and fudge, why not combine the two? Mix up a pan of these exquisite brownies for any holiday or special gatherings...or just when you want to treat yourself to the ultimate chocolate dessert. —Judy Olson, Whitecourt, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.title: Our Best-Ever Chocolate Cakes
items.abstract: From tall, frosted layer cakes to simple and delicious Bundts, our top-rated chocolate cakes are all here. Grab a glass of milk and get ready to meet (and eat!) your new favorite recipe.
items.author: Ellie Martin Cliffe

images.title: Ganache-Topped Chocolate Cake
images.description: Although this cake looks very elegant and like something you'd only serve at special occasions, it's really, really easy. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sandy's Chocolate Cake
images.description: Years ago, I drove 4-1/2 hours to a cake contest, holding my entry on my lap the whole way. But it paid off. One bite and you'll see why this velvety beauty won first prize. —Sandra Johnson, Tioga, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate-Peanut Butter Sheet Cake
images.description: I love peanut butter and chocolate, so I combined recipes to blend the two. This cake is heavenly served plain or topped with ice cream. —Lisa Varner, El Paso, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Flourless Dark Chocolate Cake
images.description: Here’s a simple cake that’s rich, elegant and over-the-top chocolaty. For finishing touches, add powdered sugar, cocoa or liqueur-flavored whipped cream. —Marie Parker, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Moist Chocolate Cake
images.description: The cake reminds me of my grandmother, because it was one of her specialties. I bake it often for family parties, and it always brings back fond memories. The cake is light and airy with a delicious chocolate taste. This recipe is a keeper! —Patricia Kreitz, Richland, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: One-Bowl Chocolate Cake
images.description: This cake mixes up quickly and bakes while we enjoy our dinner. My son, David, loves to help decorate it. —Coleen Martin, Brookfield, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Bavarian Torte
images.description: Whenever I take this eye-catching torte to a potluck, I get so many requests for the recipe. —Edith Holmstrom, Madison, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Pudding Cake
images.description: This rich, fudgy dessert is a cross between pudding and cake. I like to serve it warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Whenever I take it to parties, everybody wants the recipe. —Paige Arnette, Lawrenceville, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Cannoli Cake Roll
images.description: Creamy ricotta cheese filling with a hint of cinnamon rolls up beautifully in this fluffy chocolate cake. —Tammy Rex, New Tripoli, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Banana Chocolate Cake
images.description: This light-as-air chocolate cake from our Test Kitchen has a yummy banana flavor. It’s scrumptious as is, but you can also dress it up with nuts or light frostings. —Tina Bellows, Racine, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Chocolate Lava Cake
images.description: Everyone who tries this dessert falls in love with it. Using a slow cooker liner makes cleanup a breeze. —Latona Dwyer, Palm Beach Gardens, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Reese's Chocolate Snack Cake
images.description: This cake is constantly requested by my family. Its yellow and orange toppings make it the perfect dessert for a Halloween party. —Eileen Travis, Ukiah, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Angel Cake
images.description: When I was married in 1944, I could barely boil water. My dear mother-in-law taught me her specialty—making the lightest angel food cakes ever. This chocolate version is an easy, impressive treat. —Joyce Shiffler, Colorado Springs, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Guinness Cake
images.description: One bite and everyone will propose a toast to this silky-smooth chocolate cake. The cream cheese frosting reminds us of the foamy head on a perfectly poured pint. —Marjorie Hennig, Seymour, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Almond Cake
images.description: Fluffy white homemade frosting tops this rich chocolate almond cake. Sliced toasted almonds on top add a little crunch. —Sherri Gentry, Dallas, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Yummy Zucchini Chocolate Cake
images.description: As a confirmed chocoholic, this is my all-time favorite treat. I found the original recipe more than 20 years ago, but have lightened it up quite a bit. Everyone asks for the recipe, and no one suspects that it's lighter than most chocolate cakes. —Carleta Foltz, Sunrise Beach, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Chiffon Cake
images.description: If you want to offer family and friends a dessert that really stands out from the rest, this is the cake to make. Beautiful high layers of rich sponge cake are drizzled with a succulent chocolate glaze. —Erma Fox, Memphis, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mint-Chocolate Ice Cream Cake
images.description: Frosty and impressive, this versatile ice cream cake is pretty enough for company, simple enough for a weeknight treat. Kathy Morrow in Hubbard, Ohio suggests you try food coloring to tint the whipped topping or use different flavors of ice cream, extracts and cookie or candy crumbs to suit different holidays or occasions! Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Contest-Winning Moist Chocolate Cake
images.description: You don't have to spend a lot of time to serve an elegant and delicious dessert. Just mix up the batter in one bowl, bake your cake and get ready for compliments. —Christa Hageman, Telford, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: German Chocolate Cake
images.description: This cake is my husband's favorite! Every bite has a light crunch from the pecans, a sweet taste of coconut and a drizzle of chocolate. —Joyce Platfoot, Wapakoneta, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Marvelous Cannoli Cake
images.description: A luscious, chocolate-studded cannoli filling separates the tender vanilla layers of this rich cake, which starts with a package mix. It’s best when served well chilled.—Antoinette Owens, Ridgefield, Connecticut Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel-Fudge Chocolate Cake
images.description: To satisfy the chocolate lovers in our family, I added hot fudge topping and chocolate chips to a caramel-covered dessert that's quite popular in our area. The moist cake layer is a breeze to prepare using a boxed mix, and the rich toppings make it especially decadent. —Karen Stucky, Freeman, South Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Come-Home-to-Mama Chocolate Cake
images.description: You'll spend less than a half hour whipping up this cure-all cake that starts with a mix. Sour cream and chocolate pudding make it rich and moist, and chocolate, chocolate and more chocolate make it decadent comfort food at its finest. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Double-Chocolate Toffee Icebox Cake
images.description: My mother-in-law gave me a cooking lesson when I first got married: "Anything tastes good if you put enough butter, chocolate or cream in it." This cake has two out of three and proves she was right. Sometimes I use chocolate graham crackers and stack up the layers in a 9x9 pan. —Bee Engelhart, Bloomfield Township, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate-Strawberry Celebration Cake
images.description: Although I have some great "from-scratch" recipes, this one uses a boxed mix with plenty of doctoring. It has become a popular groom's cake that gets more attention than the wedding cake. —Nora Fitzgerald, Sevierville, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: Our Best-Ever Chocolate Cakes

items.title: 50 Dinner Recipes That Will Feed a Crowd
items.abstract: Feed the whole family (and a few more!) with these delicious dinner recipes that serve 12 or more!
items.author: Caroline Stanko

images.title: Buffalo Chicken Lasagna
images.description: This recipe was inspired by my daughter's favorite food—Buffalo wings! It tastes as if it came from a restaurant. —Melissa Millwood, Lyman, South Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mini Barbecue Meat Loaves
images.description: I gave classic meat loaf a tasty twist by adding barbecue sauce. My kids usually get bored with beef entrees, but they keep asking for this dish. It's become a dinner staple at my house. —Vicki Smith, Okeechobee, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Green Chili Beef Burritos
images.description: Recipes that are leaner in fat and calories—like the one for these burritos—helped me lose 30 pounds! The meat is so tender and delicious. —Shirley Davidson, Thornton, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow-Cooked Pizza Casserole
images.description: A friend from church gave me the recipe for this satisfying slow-cooked casserole. It's always one of the first dishes emptied at potlucks, and it can easily be adapted to personal tastes. —Julie Sterchi, Campbellsville, Kentucky Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Southwestern Casserole
images.description: I've been making this mild family-pleasing casserole for years. It tastes wonderful, fits nicely into our budget and, best of all, makes a second one to freeze and enjoy later. —Joan Hallford, North Richland Hills, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow-Cooked Chunky Chili
images.description: Pork sausage, ground beef and plenty of beans make this chili a marvelous meal. I keep serving-size containers of it in my freezer at all times so I can quickly warm up bowls on busy days. —Margie Shaw, Greenbrier, Arkansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Bratwurst Supper
images.description: This meal-in-one grills to perfection in a heavy-duty foil bag and is ideal for camping. Loaded with chunks of bratwurst, red potatoes, mushrooms and carrots, it's easy to season with onion soup mix and a little soy sauce. —Janice Meyer, Medford, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fruit-Pecan Pork Roast
images.description: This spectacular roast was a huge hit with members of the cooking club I belong to. The sweet, tangy fruit glaze looks lovely and is a wonderful complement to the juicy pork. It's a family favorite for special occasions and holidays. -Gay Flynn, Bellevue, Nebraska Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Southern Seafood Gumbo
images.description: I tasted a similar dish at a local restaurant and later duplicated it pretty closely. I trimmed it down a bit and no one in my family seemed to mind. —Susan Wright, Champaign, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chicken Burritos
images.description: This mouthwatering Southwestern recipe makes enough for two casseroles, so you can enjoy one today and freeze th other for a busy weeknight. They're super to have on hand for quick meals or to take to potlucks. —Sonya Nightingale, Burley, Idaho. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Favorite Chicken Potpie
images.description: Chock-full of chicken, potatoes, peas and corn, this autumn favorite makes two golden pies, so you can serve one at supper and save the other for a busy night. These potpies are perfect for company or a potluck. —Karen Johnson, Bakersfield, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Best Lasagna
images.description: For a casual holiday meal, you can't go wrong with this rich and meaty lasagna. My grown sons and daughter-in-law request it for their birthdays, too. —Pam Thompson, Girard, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pepper Sausage Pizza
images.description: Fresh spinach gives this recipe a tasty twist. That leafy green plus yellow peppers, snow-white mushrooms and tomato sauce make this a colorful addition to your pizza buffet table. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Teriyaki Pineapple Drumsticks
images.description: We have a large family and throw big parties, so I look for ways to free my husband from the grill. Roasted drumsticks keep everyone happy. —Erica Allen, Tuckerton, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cheesy Spinach-Stuffed Shells
images.description: This is my own personal recipe. I'm very proud of it because I am still a beginner cook and it was the first recipe I created. You can adjust it to your liking by doubling the spinach or adding some meat. —Laci Hooten, McKinney, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lime-Chipotle Carnitas Tostadas
images.description: Here's a great recipe for your next party! Set out various toppings and garnishes so guests can custom-make their own tostadas with the lime-kissed shredded pork. —Jan Valdez, Chicago, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Church Supper Spaghetti
images.description: Because this recipe feeds so many, I often take it to church dinners and potlucks. This colorful dish also comes in handy when we have lots of help to feed on our farm.—Verlyn Wilson, Wilkinson, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brown Sugar Pineapple Ham
images.description: With pineapple, brown sugar, mustard and cloves, this baked ham is straightforward and simple - just what you're looking for in a holiday ham with easy steps. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Stuffing & Turkey Casserole
images.description: This is a plate full of love, comfort and goodness. —Debbie Fabre, Ft Myers, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hearty Pasta Fajioli
images.description: Here's an Italian favorite. Spaghetti sauce and canned broth form the flavorful base. —Cindy Garland, Limestone, TN Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Golden Apricot-Glazed Turkey Breast
images.description: Basted with a simple glaze, this wonderfully moist and tender turkey bakes to a lovely golden brown. Make it the centerpiece of your holiday table; guests will be glad you did. —Greg Fontenot, The Woodlands, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Spaghetti & Meatballs
images.description: I’ve been cooking 50 years and this dish is still one that guests ask for frequently. My No. 1 standby recipe also makes amazing hero sandwiches, and the sauce works for any pasta. —Jane McMillan, Dania Beach, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Honey Chipotle Ribs
images.description: Nothing's better than having a sauce with the perfect consistency for slathering. Here's one that'll ensure a lip-smacking feast. Make the sauce up to a week ahead. —Caitlin Hawes, Westwood, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Freezer Burritos
images.description: I love burritos, but the frozen ones are so high in salt and chemicals. So I created these. They're great to have on hand for quick dinners or late-night snacks—I've even had them for breakfast! —Laura Winemiller, Delta, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Firehouse Chili
images.description: As one of the cooks at the firehouse, I used to prepare meals for 10 men. This chili was among their favorites.—Richard Clements, San Dimas, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Spiral-Sliced Ham
images.description: In my mind, few foods in a holiday spread are as tempting as a big baked ham. I always hope for leftovers so we can have ham sandwiches in the following days. —Edie DeSpain, Logan, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Greek Zucchini & Feta Bake
images.description: Looking to highlight your meal with something light, indulgent and golden on top? Turn to this Greek-style egg bake. —Gabriela Stefanescu, Webster, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Double-Duty Layered Enchilada Casserole
images.description: Here's a heap of cozy comfort. The Taste of Home Test Kitchen took my recipe for chili without beans and turned it into a scrumptious enchilada casserole. —Molly Butt, Granville, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Burrito Lasagna
images.description: A friend showed me how to make stacked enchiladas years ago. I took it even further to create this filling casserole. I serve it with Mexican corn or chips and dip. I love the rave reviews I get every time I make it. —Deana Briggs, Maud, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Orange-Glazed Pork Loin
images.description: This is one of the best pork recipes I've ever tried. My family looks forward to this roast for dinner, and guests always want the recipe. The flavorful rub and a glaze sparked with orange juice are also outstanding on pork chops. —Lynnette Miete, Alna, Maine Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Favorite Barbecued Chicken
images.description: What better place to find a fantastic barbecue sauce than Texas, and that’s where this one is from—it’s my father-in-law’s own recipe. We’ve served it at many family reunions and think it’s the best! —Bobbie Morgan, Woodstock, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow-Cooked Loaded Potato Soup
images.description: I put a twist on one of my favorite comfort foods that my grandmother used to make. I look forward to passing this down to my kids. —Jamie Chase, Rising Sun, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Taco Meat Loaves
images.description: We live in Texas and love the Southwest style of cooking. This recipe spices up plain ol’ meat loaf so it tastes like a filling for tacos. —Susan Garoutte, Georgetown, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cabbage Roll Casserole
images.description: I layer cabbage with tomato sauce and ground beef lasagna-style to create a hearty casserole that tastes like cabbage rolls but without all the work. —Doreen Martin, Kitimat, British Columbia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Stuffed Shells
images.description: I put this recipe together one day when we had unexpected guests. It was an immediate hit and is now a family favorite. Get the kids involved when putting together this simple, savory dish. —Dolores Betchner, Cudahy, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Balsamic Roast Chicken
images.description: When the aroma from this dish fills your house, your family will think you spent all day cooking. But this elegant, Sunday-special roast chicken, flavored with rosemary, wine and balsamic vinegar, is surprisingly simple to make. —Tracy Tylkowski, Omaha, Nebraska Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chicken Cordon Bleu Bake
images.description: I got this recipe from a friend years ago. I freeze several half recipes in disposable pans to share with neighbors or for when I'm pressed for time myself. —Rea Newell, Decatur, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Polish Casserole
images.description: When I first made this dish, my 2-year-old liked it so much that he wanted it for every meal! You can use most any pasta that will hold the sauce. —Crystal Bruns, Iliff, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spicy Goulash
images.description: —Melissa Polk, West Lafayette, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Baked Beef Tacos
images.description: We give tacos a fresh approach by baking the shells upright in refried beans and tomatoes. The bottom gets soft, and the top stays crisp and crunchy. —Patricia Stagich, Elizabeth, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Eggplant Sausage Casserole
images.description: If you want your kids to happily eat their eggplant, serve it in this lovely layered casserole. Our whole family enjoys it. Always a popular potluck item, it's a great company dish, as well. —Carol Mieske, Red Bluff, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Greek Salad Ravioli
images.description: Turn the fresh flavors of a Greek salad into a warm dish for cold winter nights. I like to make a large batch, freeze them, then simply drop into simmering water for dinner in five minutes! —Carla Mendres, Winnipeg, Manitoba Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Bacon Cheeseburger Tater Tot Bake
images.description: Roll your burgers, cheese and taters all into one. It's the perfect dish to bribe your kids; homework, chores, piano practice—consider them done! —Deanna Zewen, Union Grove, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Authentic Cajun Gumbo
images.description: I learned to cook in Louisiana and I love to cook Cajun food. This chicken oyster gumbo is one of my favorites. —Paul Morris, Kelso, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Nikki's Perfect Pastitsio
images.description: My mother used to work so hard in the kitchen to make this classic Greek dish, and the results were always well worth her effort. My recipe for pastitsio is easier, a bit lighter and every bit as great as Mom's.—Nikki Tsangaris, Westfield, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Red Lentil Soup Mix
images.description: Give your friends the gift of good health. Red lentils are a protein powerhouse, and loaded with folate, iron and fiber. Oh, and this soup tastes amazing, too.—Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Garlic Bread Pasta Torte
images.description: My kids love to stuff spiral pasta inside bread for a clever dinner torte. We save the bread crusts to make garlicky croutons for salad. —Melissa Birdsong, Waleska, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Meaty Arugula Pizzas
images.description: When I was growing up, my mom always made homemade pizza every Friday night. We'd watch a movie as a family or have friends over, too. Now that I'm married, I carry on the pizza tradition. —Morgan Harvey, Longview, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hearty Beef & Vegetable Soup
images.description: When you need to feed a crowd, consider this beefy favorite loaded with both fresh and frozen veggies. —Sue Straughan, Prattville, AL Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Beef Tenderloin with Sauteed Vegetables
images.description: This is the most elegant, tender beef. It’s made the classic French way—so easy! —cleo gonske, redding, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 50 Dinner Recipes That Will Feed a Crowd

items.title: You Know Youre from the West Coast If Youve Tried All These Foods
items.abstract: From Pacific smoked salmon to Mission-style burritos, the West Coast is full of unique regional foods. Cook your way through California, Oregon and Washington with these recipes.
items.author: Ellie Martin Cliffe

images.title: Korean Pulled Pork Tacos
images.description: I created this unique pulled pork recipe to replicate our favorite food truck tacos at home. They're a little sweet, a little spicy and totally delicious any time of year. —Julie Orr, Fullerton, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Classic Avocado Toast
images.description: This is such an easy way to add avocados to your diet. Use healthy multi-grain bread and top with sliced radishes and cracked pepper or lime zest, chipotle peppers and cilantro for extra flavor. —Rachel Seis, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grilled Street Corn
images.description: Mexican food is my grandmother’s favorite. I wanted a perfect side for her legendary tacos, and this chile-lime grilled corn turned out to be just right. —Ashley Crainshaw, Shawnee, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Smoked Salmon Cheese Spread
images.description: Pretzels, chips and veggies all taste awesome with this creamy blend of salmon, cheese and herbs. Thanks to a food processor, it's always ready in a hurry. —Jill Campbell, Huntsville, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cobb Salad
images.description: Made on the fly by Hollywood restaurateur Bob Cobb in 1937, the Cobb salad is a world-famous American dish. Here's a fresh take, with all the original appeal and an extra-special presentation. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Oregon's Best Marionberry Pie
images.description: I believe Oregon marionberries make about the best berry pie in the world. And when you add some cream cheese and flavorings, you'll be making the best even better! —Frances Benthin, Scio, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: North Pacific Chowder
images.description: This is so yummy and so fresh! Tender vegetables and tarragon add good flavor to this smooth fish soup. —Pam Woolgar, Qualicum Beach, British Columbia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mexican Hot Dogs
images.description: My stepmom was born in Mexico and introduced us to hot dogs with avocado and bacon. We were instantly hooked. Now our whole family makes them. —Amanda Brandenburg, Hamilton, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: California Sushi Rolls
images.description: This tastes as good as any restaurant or store-bought California roll. For best results, do use the sushi rice to ensure the right sticky consistency. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fish Tacos with Guacamole
images.description: Fish tacos are my new favorite thing—lighter and healthier than beef tacos smothered in cheese. Try adding tomatoes, green onions and chopped jalapeno on top. —Deb Perry, Traverse City, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Colorful Shrimp Pad Thai
images.description: Bright, fresh veggie flavors, a splash of tart lime juice, the crunch of peanuts and a hint of heat make this healthy and beautiful shrimp stir-fry a real standout! —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Maple-Bacon Doughnut Bites
images.description: While these delicious bite-size treats are ready in minutes, they’ll disappear in a flash. And don’t relegate the deep-fried goodness to the breakfast nook—I’ve never had anyone turn these down no matter the time of day. —Chelsea Turner, Lake Elsinore, CA Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spicy Fresh Seafood Cioppino
images.description: Using prepared pasta sauce makes this hearty and hot one-pot dinner a cinch. —Doris Mancini, Port Orchard, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brunch Burritos
images.description: I like to use a second slow cooker to keep the tortillas warm and pliable when I serve these hearty burritos. Just place a clean wet cloth in the bottom, then cover it with foil and add your tortillas.—Beth Osburn, Levelland, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pacific Northwest Pickled Shrimp
images.description: This refreshing recipe is one of my husband's favorites. I like to serve the sweet-sour pickled shrimp when we're entertaining. People say it's addictive! —Kathy Wright, Highland, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Vietnamese Pork Lettuce Wraps
images.description: Casual, flavorful and low in carbohydrates, these Vietnamese Pork Lettuce Wraps are a perfect and low-fuss way to feed a group. Place the ingredients in separate dishes and let your guests assemble their own wrap, which allows them to personalize to suit their tastes. —Gretchen Barnes, Fairfax, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Irish Coffee
images.description: My maternal grandma was never a drinker, beyond a glass of champagne at Christmas, but she couldn't resist Bailey's Irish Coffee. —Rebecca Little, Park Ridge, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Date Shake
images.description: The shake has the rich taste of dates. We recommend using Medjool dates for the most flavor. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Garlic-Chive Baked Fries
images.description: Yes, you do want fries with that—especially these crispy, golden fries, full of garlic flavor and just a little bit of heat. —Steve Westphal, Wind Lake, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: California Burger Bowls
images.description: Burgers are a weekly staple at our house all year round. Skip the fries, chips and bun—you won't need them with these loaded veggie & fruit burgers. To spice up the mayo, add 1/2 tsp. of chipotle powder. —Courtney Stultz, Weir Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sage & Gruyere Sourdough Bread
images.description: A sourdough starter gives loaves extra flavor and helps the rising process. This bread, with sage and Gruyere cheese, comes out so well that I’m thrilled to share it. —Debra Kramer, Boca Raton, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: California Club Pizza
images.description: You can use your favorite store-bought pizza dough or make your own for this West Coast-inspired pie topped with tomato, avocado and sprouts. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Washington State Apple Pie
images.description: This pie won Grand Champion in the Apple Pie category at the 1992 Okanogan County Fair. The pie looks traditional, but making your own filling gives it a different flair and great taste. —Dolores Scholz, Tonasket, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mai Tai
images.description: This party favorite has been around for quite some time. It's not overly fruity and features a good blend of sweet and sour. For a splash of color, garnish with strawberries and lime.—Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Greendale, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Barbecued Chicken Pizzas
images.description: So fast and so easy with refrigerated pizza crust, these saucy, smoky pizzas make quick fans with their hot-off-the-grill, rustic flavor. They're perfect for spur-of-the-moment cookouts and summer dinners on the patio. —Alicia Trevithick, Temecula, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pork, Bean & Rice Burritos
images.description: The combination of spices is key to this slow-cooked pork—it's my family's favorite burrito filling. The aroma that fills the air as the pork slowly simmers is like a Mexican restaurant. A perfect recipe for tailgate parties. —Valonda Seward, Coarsegold, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cappuccino Punch
images.description: When I tried this punch at a friend's wedding shower, I had to have the recipe. Guests will eagerly gather around the punch bowl when you ladle out this frothy mocha ice cream drink. -Rose Reich, Nampa, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chicken & Waffles
images.description: My first experience with chicken and waffles sent my taste buds into orbit. I first made the dish into appetizers, but we all love them as a main course, too. —Lisa Renshaw, Kansas City, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pesto Buttermilk Dressing
images.description: A good dressing is hard to beat; a great one is brilliant. We love a tangy blend of buttermilk and Greek yogurt. —Liz Bellville, Jacksonville, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Herb Grilled Salmon
images.description: I have a huge herb garden and love using herbs in almost everything I cook. Living in the Pacific Northwest, we eat a lot of wild-caught salmon, so I use fresh herbs in this moist and delicious grilled recipe. On cooler days, bake it instead. —Michelle Glassmeyer Wunsch, Bothell, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: California Citrus & Avocado Salad
images.description: The awesome flavors in this salad remind me of my childhood in Southern California. My great-uncle had an orchard, so our family meals were filled with avocados, citrus fruits and nuts of all varieties. —Catherine Cassidy, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Oregon's Hazelnut Chocolate Chip Cookie
images.description: Oregon has an abundance of nuts, and these nutty cookies are popular with the ladies at my craft club. Growing up during the Depression, my mother taught us to use what was available and said, "It doesn't have to be expensive to be good." She was right! —Selmer Looney, Eugene, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.title: 30 Classic Christmas Cookies to Spread Holiday Cheer
items.abstract:
Cookie season in full swing, and we can't wait to get baking! Fill your treat trays with these classics, from crispy gingerbread to melt-in-your-mouth spritzand stash some away for yourself, too.

By Angela LeMoine of LeMoine Family Kitchen
items.author: Nicole Doster

images.title: White Velvet Cutouts
images.description: We make these cutouts every Christmas and give lots of them as gifts. Last year, we baked a batch a week all through December to be sure we'd have plenty for ourselves, too. These rich cookies melt in your mouth! — Kim Hinkle, Wauseon, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gingerbread Men Cookies
images.description: No holiday cookie platter would be complete without gingerbread men! This is a tried-and-true recipe I'm happy to share with you. —Mitzi Sentiff, Annapolis, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Vanilla-Butter Sugar Cookies
images.description: While I usually bake these cookies for Christmas, I'll also make them at Valentine's Day (in the shape of hearts, with messages written in frosting), at Thanksgiving (shaped like turkeys), at Halloween (pumpkins), etc. Children like to help out with the decorating. —Cynthia Ettel, Hutchinson, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Thumbprints Cookies
