images.description: While growing up in Texas, I spent a lot of time helping my grandma cook. Lemon and cilantro add a deliciously different twist to turkey soup. —Margarita Cuellar, East Chicago, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Festive Holiday Sliders
images.description: Turkey sliders with ginger, horseradish and cranberry sauce refrigerate well, so I keep them ready for get-togethers when we bake gifts and wrap presents. —Pamela Miller, Big Rapids, MI Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Thanksgiving Stuffed Shells
images.description: Leftover turkey, dressing and sweet potatoes make terrific stuffing for jumbo pasta shells. We add cheese and use turkey gravy as the sauce for this crowd-pleaser. —Robin Haas, Cranston, Rhode Island Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Four-Cheese Turkey Pasta Bake
images.description: Leftover turkey combines with penne and cheeses to make a classic comfort food. The pasta bake works with chicken, shrimp or beef, too.—Mary Cokenour, Monticello, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey and Mushroom Potpies
images.description: I always use the leftovers from our big holiday turkey to prepare this recipe. I think my family enjoys the potpies more than the original feast! —Lily Julow, Lawrenceville, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cran-Apple Turkey Skillet
images.description: You need only one skillet to pull off this delicious meal. Talk about simple! —Lisa Renshaw, Kansas City, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: White Turkey Chili
images.description: Here's proof that chili doesn't have to be red. I combined several recipes and changed flavors until the recipe was just right. Trust me, this one is a keeper. —Tina Barrett, Houston, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Biscuit Turkey Bake
images.description: As a college student, I go for stick-to-your-ribs foods that are also easy on the budget. Here's one that fits the bill. I like to bake this casserole for friends' birthdays. —Stephanie Denning, Mt. Pleasant, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Mushroom Tetrazzini
images.description: Your family will flip over this turkey and mushroom casserole. In fact, the creamy Parmesan-topped tetrazzini is so satisfying, no one will suspect it's low fat! —Irene Banegas, Las Cruces, New Mexico Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey & Stuffing Eggs Benedict
images.description: This is a fun way to enjoy holiday leftovers as if presenting them for the first time. Serve for brunch, with champagne and cranberry juice. — Brittany Allyn, Nashville, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Posole
images.description: I love making this soup because it makes good use of leftovers from Thanksgiving. It is quick, easy and tasty. No one feels like they're eating leftovers since it's so different from Thanksgiving dinner. —Margee Berry, White Salmon, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Portobello Pasta Bake
images.description: I always plan to use this recipe right after Thanksgiving Day. Leftover turkey never tasted so good. — Preci D'Silva, Dubai Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sesame Turkey Stir-Fry
images.description: I really like the rich taste of sesame oil in this Thai-inspired dish. If you don't have it, canola oil does the trick, too. To get a similar nuttiness, toss in a handful sliced almonds before serving. —Kelli Whiting, Fortville, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Gnocchi Soup
images.description: While trying to find a creative use for leftover turkey, we decided to add gnocchi instead of noodles. My 8-year-old daughter always asks for more. If you don't have leftover turkey, a rotisserie chicken works just as well. —Amy Babines, Virginia Beach, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Mushroom Sandwich Bowls
images.description: My grandmother was an amazing cook, who brought new life to leftovers. I've tried to do the same here in these creamy, mushroom-packed sandwiches.—Angela Leinenbach, Mechanicsvlle, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Alfredo Tetrazzini
images.description: I speed up my mother-in-law’s tetrazzini by using jarred Alfredo sauce, canned mushrooms and onion powder. —Judy Batson, Tampa, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Mashed Potato Chimis
images.description: A little creative recycling will take your post-holiday morsels from boring to brilliant. A homemade sauce of pumpkin puree and chipotle peppers gives these delicious chimis a spicy-sweet finish.—Sherri Gordon, Olmsted Falls, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Stuffing Crust Turkey Potpie
images.description: Here's a wonderful, stick-to-the-ribs dish that slices well since the filling is thicker than that of traditional potpies. Prebaking the crust makes it crunchy.—Tamara Furda, Naperville, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Pinto Bean Salad with Southern Molasses Dressing
images.description: This salad is a welcome alternative to the usual post-Thanksgiving fare. It's a tasty main dish loaded with good-for-you protein.—Lily Julow, Lawrenceville, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gobble-Up Strata
images.description: I always look forward to making strata after Thanksgiving. We invite our neighbors, and they think it’s neat that I prepare another whole meal. — Bonnie Hawkins, Elkhorn, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Black Bean 'n' Pumpkin Chili
images.description: My family is crazy about this slow cooker chili because it uses ingredients you don't usually find in chili. Believe it or not, I discovered that pumpkin is what makes the dish so special. Cook up a big batch and freeze some for later; it tastes even better reheated. —Deborah Vliet, Holland, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spicy Mustard Turkey Pizza
images.description: A unique take on traditional pizza, this is an instant family favorite thanks to the tangy sauce and crisp crust. If you're not a fan of Swiss cheese, substitute provolone or mozzarella.—Keri Cotton, Lakeville, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Thai Turkey Salad Pitas
images.description: “Here’s a quick and easy way to use up leftover turkey. My son likes to try foods from different nationalities, and he really enjoys these pitas.” —Renee Dent, Conrad, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Italian Turkey Skillet
images.description: It's a challenge to find imaginative ways to use leftovers, especially for turkey after Thanksgiving. Here's a favorite of mine that you can easily make ahead for another dinner option. Prepare the recipe as directed, then transfer to a casserole dish and freeze up to three months. —Patricia Kile, Nokomis, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Stuffing Dumpling Soup
images.description: I've always loved turkey, dumplings and stuffing, so I combined them and added a punch of Creole flavor. My family loves it, even my little ones. It's got some kick, but a dollop of sour cream mellow that out. —Relina Shirley, Reno, Nevada Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mediterranean Turkey Potpies
images.description: Your clan will love these wonderful, stick-to-the-ribs potpies with a Mediterranean twist. I always use the leftovers from our big holiday turkey to prepare this recipe. I think my family enjoys the potpies more than the original feast! —Marie Rizzio, Interlochen, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chipotle Turkey Chilaquiles
images.description: As a frugal mom, I try to use leftovers in a way that provides good nutrition. This recipe does just that and it’s also a great way for my children to learn to enjoy the flavors of their Mexican heritage. —Aimee Day, Ferndale, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Triple-Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
images.description: My kids go for sweet potatoes stuffed with leftover turkey and dressing. We enjoy being in the kitchen together, each of us making our own potato boats. —Ane Burke, Bella Vista, AR Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Holiday Stromboli
images.description: At our house, we wrap holiday leftovers in pizza crust as a yummy way to finish them off. Here’s to getting the flavor, without the all-day cooking. —Alia Slatton, Boulder, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey & Vegetable Pasta
images.description: This recipe freezes beautifully and is a wonderful way to use up leftover holiday turkey and vegetables.—Veronica McCann, Columbus, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gobbler Cakes
images.description: I watched a chef make crab cakes and decided to try it with turkey and stuffing. Now the kids request them year-round, so I buy cooked turkey. —Suzee Krebs, Brielle, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mexican Turkey Roll-Ups
images.description: This is the perfect recipe when you're hungry for a dish with Mexican flavor and want to use turkey. These roll-ups are fun and so tasty, even kids like them. It's a different use for leftover turkey. —Marlene Muckenhirn, Delano, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hearty Turkey 'n' Rice Soup
images.description: Use the leftover cooked turkey in the fridge to speed up dinner. You'll be ladling up bowlfuls of goodness in only 30 minutes. —Maggie Brewer, Canandaigua, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey-Stuffed Acorn Squash
images.description: We stuff acorn squash with leftovers like turkey, dressing and cranberry sauce. Make as much or as little as you need to use everything up. —Cindy Romberg, Mississauga, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Tortilla Soup
images.description: My wife created this recipe as a healthy way to use up Thanksgiving leftovers. It’s a nice alternative to the typical fare, and it’s so easy. Our family looks forward to this soup every year. —Matthew Szyndler, Maumee, Ohio. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day-After-Thanksgiving Turkey Stir-Fry
images.description: I work for a priest, Fr. Leo, who loves to cook and shared this recipe with me. Perfect for the day after Thanksgiving, the dish encompasses the holiday spirit, while adding a twist. —Stefen Lovelace, Marriottsville, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 48 Delicious Ideas for Leftover Turkey

items.title: 62 Delicious Thanksgiving Dinner Ideas
items.abstract: Whether you're a Thanksgiving veteran cook, or newbie, find delicious mains, sides and desserts to whip up this holiday season.
items.author: Caroline Stanko

images.title: Cranberry-Orange Roasted Turkey
images.description: You'll have an elegant centerpiece to your meal with this tender, juicy turkey. “The cranberry makes it so good. It has such a wonderful aroma and flavor.” Kara de la Vega - Santa Rosa, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: German-Style Cabbage and Beans
images.description: This is one of my greatest hits as a potluck dish at church suppers. If you use some red cabbage, it will have very festive colors, light pink with green. It looks so pretty.—Winifred Winch, Wetmore, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lattice-Topped Apple Pie
images.description: You can’t beat my mom’s yummy apple pie. Pretty as a picture, the golden crust is flaky and the filling has just the right amount of spices. —Anne Halfhill, Sunbury, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cauliflower Au Gratin
images.description: This dish will make a vegetable lover out of anyone. Whenever I serve it, everyone just raves about it and asks for the recipe. Sometimes I'll substitute broccoli for all or half of the cauliflower, and it tastes just as good! —Jacki Ricci, Ely, Nevada Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Scalloped Sweet Corn Casserole
images.description: This is my Grandma Ostendorf's corn recipe I grew up enjoying. Now a grandmother myself, I still serve this comfy, delicious side as a family classic. —Lonnie Hartstack, Clarinda, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Frosted Cranberry Drop Cookies
images.description: I started making these treats after tasting a batch her friend whipped up. I immediately requested the recipe and have been baking them by the dozens ever since. The icing is an ideal complement to the tart berries in the cookies. —Shirley Kidd, New London, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mulled Wine
images.description: This mulled wine is soothing and satisfying with a delightful blend of spices warmed to perfection. Refrigerating the wine mixture overnight allows the flavors to blend, so don't omit this essential step.—Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Swiss Chard with Onions & Garlic
images.description: I like to dress up this Swiss chard by serving it with pasta, but it’s also a tasty side dish all on its own. My boys love it and ask for it often. —Rebekah Chappel, Portales, New Mexico Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roasted Squash, Carrots & Walnuts
images.description: After the turkey’s done, I dial up the oven temp and roast carrots and squash for this yummy side. That frees me up to start the gravy. —Lily Julow, Lawrenceville, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Golden Apricot-Glazed Turkey Breast
images.description: Basted with a simple glaze, this wonderfully moist and tender turkey bakes to a lovely golden brown. Make it the centerpiece of your holiday table; guests will be glad you did. —Greg Fontenot, The Woodlands, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hearty Butternut Squash Soup
images.description: The comforting combination of squash, meat, beans and veggies makes this my go-to soup in fall. It's full of freshness. —Jaye Beeler, Grand Rapids, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Aunt Margaret's Sweet Potato Casserole
images.description: My great aunt made an incredible sweet potato casserole for our holiday dinners. I’ve lightened it up a bit, but we love it just the same. —Beth Britton, Fairlawn, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Garlic-Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Mustard Sauce
images.description: Don’t be afraid to bring out the Brussels sprouts. Mellowed by roasting and tossed with mustard sauce, they may just delight even the most skeptical folks. —Becky Walch, Orland, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roasted Butternut Tossed Salad
images.description: This salad makes an easy and special side dish for Thanksgiving dinner, and it's packed with nutritious veggies, almonds, berries and squash.—Katie Wollgast, Florissant, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Double Delights
images.description: You get the best of both worlds with these chocolate and vanilla cookies. They're an appealing addition to any cookie tray. I usually serve them at the holidays, when they're often the first cookies to disappear, but you can have them any time of year.—Ruth Ann Stelfox, Raymond, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Quick & Easy au Gratin Potatoes
images.description: On holidays, a friend serves these creamy, cheesy potatoes when we gather together to celebrate with lifelong friends and grown children. —Carol Blue, Barnesville, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Maple-Sage Brined Turkey
images.description: When the leaves start turning color, it’s turkey time at our house. We use maple-sage brine to help brown the bird and make the meat incredibly juicy. —Kim Forni, Laconia, New Hampshire Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sausage and Rice Casserole Side Dish
images.description: When company's coming or when I need a quick-and-easy dish to pass, this is my hands-down favorite. A neighbor introduced me to the delicious combination of fluffy rice and sage-seasoned sausage. One forkful was all it took to convince me that I'd found a winner. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry-Orange Bars
images.description: My mother has had this recipe for years. I love it! These bars make great snacks, but can also be served for dessert. —Margaret Adelman, Bellingham, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Cornmeal Dressing
images.description: This moist dressing is perfect when paired with poultry or even pork. The sweet-tart flavor of the dried cranberries really complements the dish's turkey sausage. —Corinne Portteus, Albuquerque, New Mexico Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mom's Roast Beef
images.description: Everyone loves slices of this fork-tender roast beef and its savory gravy. This well-seasoned roast is Mom's specialty. People always ask what her secret ingredients are. Now you have the delicious recipe for our favorite meat dish! -Linda Gaido, New Brighton, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Hash Brown Casserole
images.description: This versatile side dish was dairy-good with the steaks we grilled and is delicious with other meats as well. A creamy cheese sauce and crunchy topping make this potato casserole ever-popular for family dinners and potlucks. —Carol Troyer, Pryor, Oklahoma and Teresa Stutzman, Adair, Oklahoma Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Black Bean 'n' Pumpkin Chili
images.description: My family is crazy about this slow cooker chili because it uses ingredients you don't usually find in chili. Believe it or not, I discovered that pumpkin is what makes the dish so special. Cook up a big batch and freeze some for later; it tastes even better reheated. —Deborah Vliet, Holland, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Frosted Maple Cookies
images.description: Living in New England, I've come to appreciate the unique qualities of our area. Many people here enjoy the flavor of maple in their recipes, and I love this adaptation of an old favorite. —Connie Borden, Marblehead, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Corn Bread Casserole
images.description: What could be better on a cold day than a warm casserole and creamy sweet cornbread put together? Since it starts with a mix, this side takes no time to make. Just bake, scoop and eat. Yum!—Valery Anderson, Sterling Heights, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Potato Stuffing Casserole
images.description: I adapted this recipe from a Pennsylvania Dutch cookbook, and it's indicative of the fine German cooking found in this area. If you're looking for an alternative to mashed potatoes, try this dish. —Elsa Kerschner, Kunkletown, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Golden Roasted Turkey
images.description: Your holiday turkey will never turn out dry again if you reach for this recipe. Brining overnight and stuffing with apples results in moist, tender meat.—Michael Williams, Moreno Valley, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Walnut Pumpkin Cake Roll
images.description: This is one of my family's favorite dessert recipes, especially for holiday gatherings. —Mary Gecha, Center Rutland, Vermont Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Perfect Winter Salad
images.description: "This is my most-requested salad recipe. It is delicious as a main dish with grilled chicken breast or as a side salad. I think it's so good, I sometimes eat it as dessert!" DeNae Shewmake, Burnsville, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gingersnap Pumpkin Cake
images.description: It just so happened that on the first day that really felt like fall, we were getting together with friends. I had to make this pumpkin cake. —Koni Brewer, Fort Worth, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Shredded Gingered Brussels Sprouts
images.description: Even people who normally don't care for Brussels sprouts will ask for a second helping of these. —James Schend, Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin & Cauliflower Garlic Mash
images.description: I wanted healthy alternatives to my family's favorite recipes. Pumpkin, cauliflower and thyme make an amazing dish. You'll never miss those plain old mashed potatoes. —Kari Wheaton, South Beloit, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Holiday Brussels Sprouts
images.description: Make Brussels sprouts special with peas, celery and, of course, bacon. The recipe doubles easily if needed. —Jodie Beckman, Council Bluffs, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Chai Tea
images.description: The sweet and spicy aroma that wafts from the slow cooker as this pleasantly flavored chai tea cooks is wonderful. —Crystal Jo Burns, Iliff, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Scalloped Apples Casserole
images.description: When preparing my first Thanksgiving dinner years ago, I wanted to add something special to the table and came up with this recipe. It's been a part of our traditional dinner ever since. —Kellie Erwin, Westerville, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Marinated Thanksgiving Turkey
images.description: My family enjoys this turkey because it cooks up tender, tasty and golden brown. Build up flavor by marinating the meat, then grill it to add a tempting barbecued flavor. &mdashKen Churches, Kailua-Kona, Hawaii Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet & Salty Truffle Pie
images.description: Homemade truffles—a little bit sweet and a little bit salty—will keep you coming back for more. Store extra truffles in the fridge.—Shirley Warren, Thiensville, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brussels Sprouts au Gratin
images.description: In our house, Brussels sprouts have always been popular. When I topped them with a creamy sauce, Swiss cheese and bread crumbs, it became a new holiday dinner tradition. —Gwen Gregory, Rio Oso, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Scalloped Potatoes with Mushrooms
images.description: Potatoes and mushrooms make a one-dish meal I love – it’s the calories you have to watch. Swap out dairy products with lower fat options. —Courtney Stultz, Columbus, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Potato & Carrot Casserole
images.description: This tangy and sweet casserole is full of flavor. We've served it at many celebrations over the years and it's always been a bit hit! —Gloria Mezikofsky, Wakefield, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin-Lentil Soup
images.description: I was really craving a hot delicious soup—something filling and healthy. I looked around my kitchen for a few ingredients, then created this recipe. Pumpkin adds creamy richness and body. —Amy Blom, Marietta, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roasted Turkey with Maple Cranberry Glaze
images.description: I prepare turkey with a taste of Canada in mind. The sweet maple flavor comes through even in the breast meat. You may start to notice it's caramelized color after about 2 hours. That's when I cover it loosely with foil while it finishes cooking. The meat will stay tender and juicy. —Suzanne Anctil, West Vancouver, British Columbia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spiced Butternut Squash Pie
images.description: My mom always made this dessert with her homegrown squash. It was my dad's favorite after-dinner treat. I continue to make it to this day. —Johnna Poulson, Celebration, Florida. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fudge-Topped Brownies
images.description: If you love brownies and fudge, why not combine the two? Mix up a pan of these exquisite brownies for any holiday or special gatherings...or just when you want to treat yourself to the ultimate chocolate dessert. —Judy Olson, Whitecourt, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Wendy's Apple Pomegranate Salad
images.description: My grandparents grew pomegranates, pecans and walnuts and would send us some each year. Some of my best memories are the days I used to spend with my grandmother learning how to cook with her. Whenever I make this it's like having lunch with my grandmother again. —Wendy Ball, Battle Creek, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Pumpkin Pie
images.description: Pumpkin pie does not have to be difficult to make. This recipe has a wonderful taste and will be a hit at your holiday meal. —Marty Rummel, Trout Lake, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Caramel Apple Cider
images.description: Spiced with cinnamon sticks, allspice and caramel, this warm-you-up sipper will chase away winter's chill. Serve brimming mugs alongside a platter of festive cookies at your next holiday gathering. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Best Coconut Pecan Cookies
images.description: I gave cookies to friends every year, and these are a favorite. Freeze the dough in logs, then slice and bake the crisp buttery cookies when you need them. —Betty Matthews, South Haven, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brussels Sprouts with Bacon & Garlic
images.description: When we have company, these sprouts are my go-to side dish because they look and taste fantastic. Fancy them up a notch with pancetta instead of bacon. —Mandy Rivers, Lexington, South Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Spiced Rum Pound Cakes
images.description: My recipe makes two loaf-size treats, perfect for sharing. The spiced rum flavor in both the cake and the glaze really comes through. —Christine Russell, Littleton, New Hampshire Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Eggnog Sweet Potato Bake
images.description: I love eggnog so I am always looking for new ways to use it. When I added it to mashed sweet potatoes I knew I had a winner. You can make this the night before and refrigerate it unbaked; the next day, let it stand at room temperature for 30 minutes before baking.—Katie Wollgast, Florissant, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Scrumptious Sweet Potato Pie
images.description: There are many good sweet potato pies out there, but this one doesn't contain milk. It does have a splash of whiskey and a hint of lemon. —Suzanne Smith, Maumee, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Kipplens
images.description: My Great-Aunt Hilda makes this recipe every Christmas, and everybody loves them! Kipplens taste a lot like Mexican wedding cakes, but I like my aunt's version better.—Susan Bohannon, Kokomo, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Potato Cheesecake Bars
images.description: Your whole house will be filled with the aroma of pumpkin spice when you bake these wonderful sweet potato cheesecake bars. They look complicated but are so easy, you can whip up a batch anytime. —Nancy Whitford, Edwards, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Apple Sausage Salad with Cinnamon Vinaigrette
images.description: Making croutons with cinnamon raisin bread is sweet genius. Toss together the rest of the salad while they toast. —Kim Van Dunk, Caldwell, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Pecan Torte
images.description: This impressive dessert looks lovely on a buffet table. It takes some time to prepare, but it’s worth the effort. —Lois Schlickau, Haven, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fruit-Glazed Roast Turkey
images.description: Apple, cranberry and raspberry flavors blend with fresh herbs in a tangy glaze for the roasted turkey. It's a welcome change to a traditional entree. —Aysha Schurman, Ammon, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry-Pumpkin Praline Pie
images.description: Here's my spin on praline pie. It has a nice crunch from the pecans, brightness from the orange zest, pop from the cranberries and richness from the cream cheese. —Barb Miller, Oakdale, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Turkey Breast with Gravy
images.description: This quick-prep recipe lets you feast on turkey at any time of year. We save the rich broth for gravy, noodles and soup making. —Joyce Hough, Annapolis, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hidden Mint Morsels
images.description: Is it a cookie or a candy? No matter which answer folks choose, they find these minty morsels yummy. The recipe makes so much that you can whip up tons of gifts at once. —Adina Skilbred, Prairie du Sac, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Sweet Potatoes
images.description: I took my mother's delicious sweet potato casserole recipe and gave it a new twist by adding the tempting taste of orange-a fruit very abundant in our state. The flavors are wonderful together and make this dish a family favorite. —Norma Poole, Auburndale, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Pecan Dreams
images.description: Packed with fruit, nuts and vanilla chips, these goodies are sure to please. If you prefer, replace the cherries with cranberries or apricots. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 65 Delicious Thanksgiving Dinner Ideas

items.title: 22 Cast-Iron Skillet Recipes for Thanksgiving
items.abstract: These Thanksgiving recipes put your Grandma's cast-iron skillet to good use when everyone comes together for the big feast. You'll be thankful for these homey desserts, rustic side dishes, oven-fresh rolls, creative turkey dishes and hearty breakfasts for overnight guests.
items.author: Kristin Sutter

images.title: Cinnamon-Sugar Apple Pie
images.description: Apple pie baked in a cast iron skillet is a real stunner. This beauty, with its flaky, tender crust, also works in a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate. —Renee Schettler Rossi, New York, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Biscuit Stew
images.description: This chunky stew makes a hearty supper, especially in the fall and winter. Plus, it's a great way to use extra turkey during the holidays. —Lori Schlecht, Wimbledon, North Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sauteed Radishes with Green Beans
images.description: I’ve heard radishes are the only vegetable you don’t cook, but a cookbook from the 1950s disagrees. Green beans and wax beans round out this dish. —Pam Kaiser, Mansfield, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Butternut Squash Rolls
images.description: With their cheery yellow color and delicious aroma, these appealing buns will brighten your buffet table. Plus, I've found this recipe is a great way to use up squash from the garden. —Bernice Morris, Marshfield, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Skillet Sausage Stuffing
images.description: I dressed up a package of stuffing mix with pork sausage, mushrooms, celery and onion to make this stuffing. It impressed my in-laws at a family gathering and has since become a popular side dish with my husband and children. —Jennifer Lynn Cullen, Taylor, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Shredded Gingered Brussels Sprouts
images.description: Even people who normally don't care for Brussels sprouts will ask for a second helping of these. —James Schend, Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Homey Mac & Cheese
images.description: I also call this "My Grandson's Mac & Cheese." Zachary has been to Iraq and Afghanistan with both the Marines and Navy, and I've been privileged to make his favorite casserole for him for over 20 years. —Alice Beardsell, Osprey, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gentleman's Whiskey Bacon Jam
images.description: You can slather this smoky jam on pretty much anything. It lasts only a week in the fridge, so I freeze small amounts for a quick snack with crackers. —Colleen Delawder, Herndon, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel-Apple Skillet Buckle
images.description: My grandma used to make a version of this for me when I was a little girl. She would make it using fresh apples from her tree in the back yard. I've adapted her recipe because I love the combination of apple, pecans, and caramel. —Emily Hobbs, Springfield, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creole Corn Bread
images.description: Corn bread is a staple of Cajun and Creole cuisine. This is an old favorite that I found in the bottom of my recipe drawer, and it really tastes wonderful. —Enid Hebert, Lafayette, Louisiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Skillet Potato Medley
images.description: The pretty potatoes I had just harvested from my garden inspired me to mix them up for dinner. The results: a wonderful side dish. —Lori Merrick, Danvers, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Potato Pan Rolls
images.description: My family loves these rolls, which is why they're requested often. They don't take long to make because quick-rise yeast is used. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cilantro Ginger Carrots
images.description: Peppery-sweet ginger and cooling cilantro have starring roles in this colorful side of crisp-tender carrots. They go from pan to plate in a twinkling. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grandmother's Toad in a Hole
images.description: I have fond memories of my grandmother’s Yorkshire pudding wrapped around sausages, a puffy dish my kids called “The Boat.” Slather it with butter and maple syrup. —Susan Kieboam, Streetsboro, OH Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey a La King
images.description: These tasty appetizers look so cute served in pastry shells! They're a great way to use up leftver chicken or turkey, too. You might want to make a double batch. No one can eat just one! Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rainbow Hash
images.description: To get my family to eat outside their comfort zone, I use lots of color. This happy hash combines sweet potato, carrots, purple potato and kale. —Courtney Stultz, Weir, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grilled Cranberry Pear Crumble
images.description: My husband loves it when I make dessert. Fruit crisps are easy and quick to prepare, so I make them often! I created this fall-flavored grilled version with fresh pears and items I had on hand. We loved it. —Ronna Farley, Rockville, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Skillet-Roasted Lemon Chicken with Potatoes
images.description: This is a meal I have my students make in our nutrition unit. It has a delicious lemon-herb flavor and is simple to make. —Mindy Rottmund, Lancaster, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hash Brown Maple Sausage Casserole
images.description: This crave-worthy casserole has a golden hash-brown crust that's topped with sausage and veggies. My favorite part is the surprise layer of gooey Gruyere. —Anuja Argade, Foster City, CA Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Apples 'n' Cream Pancake
images.description: This recipe is delicious for breakfast or brunch. I usually make a double batch—because everyone wants more! With our own orchard, we have plenty of Delicious and Winesap apples...they make this a true Midwestern meal. —Ruth Schafer, Defiance, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Broccoli with Asiago
images.description: This is one of the best (and most simple) ways I’ve found to serve broccoli. It’s also good with Parmesan if you don’t have the Asiago cheese. —cjintexas, Tasteofhome.com, Community Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Vegetable Frittata
images.description: When you're looking for something healthy in a hurry, you can't beat this veggie-filled frittata cooked in a cast-iron skillet. —Janet Eckhoff, Woodland, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 22 Cast-Iron Skillet Recipes for Thanksgiving

items.title: 55 Thanksgiving Recipes That Are As Easy As Pie
items.abstract: With these simple and stress-free recipesincluding some that can be made ahead or in the slow cooker, with just a handful of ingredients or in 30 minutes or lesscreating a Thanksgiving feast that pulls out all the stops has never been easier!
items.author: Amy Glander

images.title: Easy Pumpkin Pie
images.description: Pumpkin pie does not have to be difficult to make. This recipe has a wonderful taste and will be a hit at your holiday meal. —Marty Rummel, Trout Lake, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Thyme Roasted Turkey
images.description: It's easy for flavors to get lost when using too many seasonings together. When in doubt, a simple combination of butter and fresh thyme captures the essence of Thanksgiving for a classic turkey dinner. —Alma Winberry, Great Falls, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Mashed Potatoes
images.description: Sour cream and cream cheese give richness to these smooth make-ahead potatoes from Trudy Vincent, Valles Mines, Missouri. "They are wonderful for Thanksgiving or Christmas dinner since there's no last-minute mashing required," she remarks. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Vegetable Barley Bake
images.description: Forget the potatoes and rice, and consider this change-of-pace dinner accompaniment from Shirley Doyle. The Mt. Prospect, Illinois reader relies on wholesome barley for the heart-smart dish that complements most any main course. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Quick Cranberry Sauce
images.description: Honest to goodness, my family loves this inspiring cranberry sauce because the orange marmalade and spices make it stand out from the typical sauces. —Lucia Johnson, Massena, NY Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Garlic-Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Mustard Sauce
images.description: Don’t be afraid to bring out the Brussels sprouts. Mellowed by roasting and tossed with mustard sauce, they may just delight even the most skeptical folks. —Becky Walch, Orland, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Potato Rolls
images.description: After I discovered this recipe, it became a mainstay for me. I make the dough ahead of time when company is coming, and I try to keep some in the refrigerator to bake for our ranch hands. Leftover mashed potatoes are almost sure to go into these rolls. —Jeanette McKinney, Belleview, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Marmalade Candied Carrots
images.description: My favorite way to make baby carrots is to steam them, then drizzle with an orangey glaze that makes them candy-sweet. —Heather Clemmons, Supply, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cucumber Canapes
images.description: I always get requests for the recipe whenever I serve these delicate finger sandwiches with a creamy herb spread and festive red and green garnishes. —Nadine Whittaker, South Plymouth, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cran-Apple Turkey Skillet
images.description: You need only one skillet to pull off this delicious meal. Talk about simple! —Lisa Renshaw, Kansas City, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Waldorf Gelatin
images.description: We enjoy this easy-to-make salad in the fall when apples are in season. Their crisp freshness adds so much to a favorite dish. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hot Spinach Apple Salad
images.description: This salad is just lightly coated in a sweet-tangy dressing so the spinach doesn't wilt and the apples retain their crunch. We especially like this salad served with homemade bread. —Denise Albers, Freeburg, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Walnut & Fig Goat Cheese Log
images.description: Here's a simple spread that calls for only a handful of ingredients. The tablespoon of honey is optional, but I think that touch of sweetness really complements the tang of the goat cheese. —Ana-Marie Correll, Hollister, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Colorful Cranberry Sweet Potato Bake
images.description: Sweet potatoes and tart cranberries are a feast for the eyes and the palate in this beautiful side dish. —Patricia Kile, Elizabethtown, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Creamed Corn with Bacon
images.description: Every time we take this super rich corn to a potluck or work party, we leave with an empty slow cooker. It's decadent, homey and so worth the splurge. —Melissa Birdsong, Waleska, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Pumpkin Muffins
images.description: Tart, juicy cranberries enhance the delicate pumpkin flavor of these muffins. Sometimes I dust the tops with powdered sugar to add a little sweetness. —Sue Ross, Casa Grande, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: No-Bake Apple Pie
images.description: We always have an abundance of apples in the fall, so I like to make this easy pie. My husband is diabetic, and this recipe fits into his diet...but everyone enjoys it. —Shirley Vredenburg, Ossineke, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Cider
images.description: There's no last-minute rush when you slowly simmer this punch. —Alpha Wilson, Roswell, New Mexico Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Make-Ahead Turkey and Gravy
images.description: Ease the holiday time crunch with a make-ahead turkey recipe that's ready to serve when you are. It's a great choice for potlucks, too. —Marie Parker, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Applesauce Sweet Potatoes
images.description: During the holidays, using your slow cooker not only frees up oven space, but time, too! Sweet potatoes are a must on our family menu, and this no-fuss version will have everyone thinking you spent hours in the kitchen.—Pamela Allen, Marysville, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Honey-Thyme Butternut Squash
images.description: This golden, honey-sweetened squash can easily pass as a potato dish. A hearty, pretty side for special autumn meals. —Bianca Noiseux, Bristol, Connecticut Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Pie Dip
images.description: I came up with this rich, creamy pumpkin dip when I had a small amount of canned pumpkin left in the fridge after my holiday baking. It is also great served with sliced pears and apples, or as a spread on zucchini bread or any nut bread. —Laurie LaClair, North Richland Hills, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Make-Ahead Mashed Potatoes
images.description: Creamy make-ahead mashed potatoes get even better when topped with a savory trio of cheese, onions and bacon. —JoAnn Koerkenmeier, Damiansville, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Frozen Maple Mousse Pie
images.description: A homemade crust made with ginger cookie crumbs really complements the maple syrup in this frozen refresher. It’s a cool yet comforting finale to a holiday meal. —Deirdre Cox, Kansas City, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spiced Sweet Potato Soup
images.description: This Thanksgiving serve your spuds as soup. It makes a unique first course, and guests will love the creamy texture and flavors of ginger, cinnamon and curry. —Lisa Speer, Palm Beach, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pineapple-Strawberry Cranberry Relish
images.description: My son is a strawberry fanatic—anything with strawberries in it is a must-have in his book. I'll always remember the look on his face the first time he tried this. It was love! — Karen Wilkes, Lakewood, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rosemary Root Vegetables
images.description: This heartwarming side dish from our Test Kitchen is sure to get rave reviews! The ingredient list may look longer, but you'll soon see, this colorful fall medley is a snap to prepare. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Herbed Slow Cooker Turkey Breast
images.description: A holiday meal warrants an elegant and satisfying entree. This one promises to deliver. The turkey comes out of the slow cooker moist and tender, and the herbs make a flavorful gravy. —Lorie Miner, Kamas, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Stuffed Apples
images.description: Cinnamon, nutmeg and walnuts add a homey autumn flavor to these stuffed apples, but the slow cooker does most of the work for me. —Graciela Sandvigen, Rochester, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Make-Ahead Butterhorns
images.description: Mom loved to make these lightly sweet, golden rolls. They're beautiful and impressive to serve and have a wonderful, homemade taste that makes them so memorable. —Bernice Morris, Marshfield, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Pumpkin Polenta
images.description: Sometimes I like to hollow out a pumpkin and serve this creamy, hearty polenta inside it. The salted pumpkin seeds add a fun crunch. —Debi George, Mansfield, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Orange Gelatin Pretzel Salad
images.description: Salty pretzels pair nicely with sweet oranges in this refreshing layered salad. It’s a family favorite that's a slam dunk at potlucks. —Peggy Boyd, Northport, Alabama Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Potato Tartlets
images.description: My family can't resist sweet potatoes when they're mashed, placed in crunchy phyllo shells and topped with marshmallows. The bite-size tarts are fun to eat, too! —Marla Clark, Moriarty, New Mexico Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Snappy Pumpkin Dessert
images.description: Our town has a pumpkin-canning factory, so we're known as the "Pumpkin Capital of the World". New pumpkin recipes are always welcomed by our family, and this has become a favorite. The gingersnap crust goes great with the pumpkin. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey with Mushroom Sauce
images.description: "When we were first married, I didn't have an oven, so I made this tender turkey in the slow cooker," recalls Myra Innes of Auburn, Kansas. "These days, I rely on this recipe because it frees up the oven to make other dishes for large get-togethers." Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Zesty Garlic Green Beans
images.description: These green beans travel so well because they can either be served at room temperature or reheated at the party. —Christine Bergman, Suwanee, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry-Champagne Granita
images.description: After serving a heavy holiday meal, I like to offer a light, refreshing dessert, like this gorgeous granita. Because it can be made ahead, there's no last-minute fuss. —Joyce Gemperlein, Rockville, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Bacon Crescent Rolls
images.description: The mouthwatering aroma of warm bacon from these three-ingredient rolls will draw folks to the table. These are fun for children to prepare and such a cinch to assemble with ready-cooked bacon. —Jane Nearing, Indianapolis, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Pilgrim Cookies
images.description: These darling little gobblers are fun to make and will make all your Turkey Day guests smile. —Taste of Home Food Styling Team Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Stuffing from the Slow Cooker
images.description: If you're hosting a big Thanksgiving dinner this year, add this simple slow-cooked stuffing to your menu to ease entertaining. The recipe comes in handy when you run out of oven space at large family gatherings. I use it often. —Mrs. Donald Seiler, Macon, Mississippi Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Gingersnap Ice Cream Pie
images.description: My family and I always try new desserts during the holidays. This one was a clear winner at our Christmas party, so we now make it for all occasions!—Patricia Ness, La Mesa, California. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sausage Dressing
images.description: Mary Kendall of Appleton, Wisconsin relied on this slow cooker recipe at Thanksgiving when there was no room in her oven to bake stuffing. "The results were fantastic-very moist and flavorful," she relates. "Even family members who don't usually eat stuffing had some. There were no leftovers." Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Sauce
images.description: I turn to this recipe frequently because I can prepare it a day ahead—it's so convenient when company's coming. And with only a trace of fat, the fruity side dish is nutritious and delicious.—Nancy Zimmerman, Cape May Court House, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mom's Sweet Potato Bake
images.description: Mom loves sweet potatoes and fixed them often in this creamy, comforting casserole. With its nutty topping, this side dish could almost serve as a dessert. It's a yummy treat! —Sandi Pichon, Memphis, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate-Nut Caramel Tart
images.description: With just a few ingredients and in less time than you'd think, this sinfully rich tart is ready to go. It's a good recipe to have up your sleeve for any gathering. —Kathy specht, Clinton, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gorgonzola-Pear Mesclun Salad
images.description: This pretty salad is a tasty way to get your greens. To change it up, swap apples for pears and pecans for walnuts. —Joylyn Trickel, Helendale, CA Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Toffee Trifle
images.description: I wanted to use pumpkin for a quick party dessert. This twist on a cream cheese pie tastes divine when made ahead. It keeps well, too. —Jodie Jensen, Draper, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roasted Cauliflower & Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
images.description: This deeply delicious recipe is a surefire way to get my husband to enjoy Brussels sprouts. Between the roasted flavor of the veggies and smoky, crisp bacon, it will convert even the pickiest eater. —Lisa Speer, Palm Beach, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Simple Turtle Cheesecake
images.description: For an almost instant dessert, I spread homemade ganache and caramel sauce over pre-made cheesecake. It makes the holidays feel slightly less hectic. —Laura McDowell, Lake Villa, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spiced Acorn Squash
images.description: Working full time, I found I didn't always have time to cook the meals my family loved. So I re-created many of our favorites in the slow cooker. This cinnamony treatment for squash is one of them. —Carol Greco, Centereach, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hurry-Up Biscuits
images.description: When I was young, my mom would make these biscuits with fresh cream she got from a local farmer. I don't go to those lengths anymore, but the family recipe is still a real treat. —Beverly Sprague, Baltimore, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry-Orange Cordials
images.description: Quick but elegant makes an ideal recipe for me. I place all the fixings for the cordials on a tray and let each person make their own. It's fun and saves me even more time. —Diane Nemitz, Ludington, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pear & Pomegranate Salad
images.description: Pomegranate and Boursin add zip to this cool salad of Bosc pears over lettuce. Look for the 5-ounce Boursin with a firmer texture than the spreadable version. —Erika Monroe-Williams, Scottsdale, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Butternut Squash Apple Bake
images.description: Even if you don’t like squash, you’ll like this side dish. Sweet slices of butternut squash are topped with apples covered in a cinnamon sugar glaze for an elegant side. —Ellie Klopping, Toledo, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 55 Thanksgiving Recipes That Are As Easy As Pie

items.title: 35 Super Easy Thanksgiving Appetizers
items.abstract: Let's face it: Thanksgiving appetizers often take a backseat to the feast. But we bet you have a few minutes to throw together one of these cheesy, flaky, crispy, creamy apps. That's righteach of these recipes needs 15 minutes of hands-on time or less. Now, who's ready to party?
items.author: Ellie Martin Cliffe

images.title: Baked Crab Dip
images.description: We enjoyed this exquisite dip at my grandson's wedding reception. It looks fancy but is easy to make. You can even fill the bread bowl early in the day and chill it until serving. Just remove it from the refrigerator 30 minutes before baking. —Marie Shelley, Exeter, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Holiday Appetizer Meatballs
images.description: Reports Yellow Springs, Ohio field editor Pat Waymire, "These tasty meatballs are a perennial favorite at our Christmas parties." Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Savory Party Bread
images.description: It's impossible to stop nibbling on warm pieces of this cheesy, oniony bread. The sliced loaf fans out for a fun presentation. —Kay Daly, Raleigh, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Pie Dip
images.description: I came up with this rich, creamy pumpkin dip when I had a small amount of canned pumpkin left in the fridge after my holiday baking. It is also great served with sliced pears and apples, or as a spread on zucchini bread or any nut bread. —Laurie LaClair, North Richland Hills, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Party Shrimp
images.description: The marinade for this dish makes the shrimp so flavorful, you won't even need a dipping sauce. Even those who claim they don’t like shellfish really dig this appetizer. —Kendra Doss, Colorado Springs, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Almond Cheddar Appetizers
images.description: I always try to have a supply of these appetizers on-hand in the freezer. If guests drop in, I just pull some out and reheat to serve. They work great as a snack, for brunch or along with a lighter lunch. —Linda Thompson, Southampton, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chicken Crescent Wreath
images.description: Here's an impressive-looking dish that's a snap to prepare. Even when my cooking time is limited, I can still serve this delicious crescent wreath. The red pepper and green broccoli add a festive touch. —Marlene Denissen, St. Croix Falls, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Antipasto Platter
images.description: We entertain often, and this is one of our favorite party pleasers. It's such a refreshing change from the usual chips and dip. —Teri Lindquist, Gurnee, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fireside Cheese Spread
images.description: When our family and friends get together for holidays or other occasions, I serve this appetizer. It's always a success. If you prefer, try a Swiss cheese spread instead of the cheddar. And, if you enjoy garlic, substitute a small clove of minced garlic for the garlic powder. —Debbie Terenzini-Wilkerson, Lusby, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sausage Chive Pinwheels
images.description: These spirals are simple to make but look special on a buffet. Our guests eagerly help themselves, and sometimes the eye-catching pinwheels never even make it to their plates! —Gail Sykora, Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Marinated Mozzarella
images.description: I always come home with an empty container when I bring this dish to a partym and I've used the recipe for years. It can be made ahead to free up time later. I serve it with pretty party picks for a festive, holiday look. —Peggy Cairo, Kenosha, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Warm Bacon Cheese Spread
images.description: My friends threaten not to come by unless this dip is on the menu! The rich spread bakes right in the bread bowl and goes well with almost any dipper. Plus, cleanup is a breeze. —Nicole Marcotte, Smithers, British Columbia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow-Cooked Smokies
images.description: I like to include these little smokies smothered in barbecue sauce on all my appetizer buffets since they're popular with both children and adults. —Sundra Hauck, Bogalusa, Louisiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Honey-Mustard Chicken Wings
images.description: For a change from spicy buffalo sauce, try these sweet and sticky wings. There's a good chance they'll become your new favorite! —Susan Seymour, Valatie, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Dilly Cheese Ball
images.description: The whole family devours this herby cheese spread—even my son, the chef. Serve it with your favorite crackers. —Jane Vince, London, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Nutty Stuffed Mushrooms
images.description: Basil, Parmesan cheese and mushroom blend together well, while buttery pecans give these treats a surprising crunch. Our children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren always ask for them! —Mildred Eldred, Union City, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Holiday Salsa
images.description: When we offer this cream-cheesy salsa of fresh cranberries, cilantro and a little jalapeno kick, everyone hovers around the serving dish until it’s scraped clean. —Shelly Pattison, Lubbock, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Classic Swedish Meatballs
images.description: I'm a "Svenska flicka" (Swedish girl) from northwest Iowa, where many Swedes settled at the turn of the century. This recipe was given to me by a Swedish friend. It's obviously a 20th century version of a 19th century favorite, since back then they didn't have bouillon cubes or evaporated milk! I think you'll agree that these modern-day "Kottbullar" are very tasty. —Emily Gould, Hawarden, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Festive Apple Dip
images.description: I came up with this layered peanut butter treat when my dad gave me a big bag of apples. The dip has been one of my favorites ever since. In addition to serving it with apples, try it with graham crackers, vanilla wafers, banana chunks or animal crackers. —Theresa Tometich, Coralville, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brie Phyllo Cups
images.description: Mini phyllo shells from the freezer section hurry along these elegant cups. They look fancy and taste delicious but are a snap to put together for a special occasion.—Brenda Little, Boise, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Jalapeno Cheese Spread
images.description: This easy spread is based on several different relishes and spreads I've tasted or made before. I love the sweet and spicy combination of flavors. —Diane Nemitz, Ludington, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry-Brandy Baked Brie
images.description: No one will believe this impressive appetizer is so easy to make. You can substitute dried cranberries or apricots for the cherries and apple juice for the brandy. —Kevin Phebus, Katy, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hot Crab Pinwheels
images.description: I got the recipe for these crabmeat bites from a friend. What amazed me most is that my husband, who hates seafood, couldn't stop eating them. —Kitti Boesel, Woodbridge, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Baked Onion Dip
images.description: "Some people like this cheesy dip so much that they can't tear themselves away from the appetizer table to eat their dinner," writes Mona Zignego of Hartford, Wisconsin. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gentleman's Whiskey Bacon Jam
images.description: You can slather this smoky jam on pretty much anything. It lasts only a week in the fridge, so I freeze small amounts for a quick snack with crackers. —Colleen Delawder, Herndon, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon-Herb Olives with Goat Cheese
images.description: Greek olives have a fruity flavor that comes into play when you mix them with lemon and fresh herbs. Spoon over goat cheese and slather on crackers. —Jeanne Ambrose, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: White Chocolate Brie Cups
images.description: Try these unique little tarts as an appetizer before a special meal, or save them for a surprisingly different dinner finale. They’re sweet, creamy and crunchy—and very addictive!—Angela Vitale, Delaware, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brandied Blue Cheese Spread
images.description: Pour on the holiday spirit with a splash of brandy and three kinds of cheese. Pumpkin seeds, or pepitas, are a crunchy topping for the smooth spread. —T.B. England, San Antonio, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Goat Cheese Mushrooms
images.description: Stuffed mushrooms are superstars in the hot appetizer category. I use baby portobello mushrooms and load them with creamy goat cheese and sweet red peppers. —Mike Bass, Alvin, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Three-Cheese Pepperoncini Spread
images.description: Our big family loves to celebrate with food. Here’s my take on a cheesy Greek spread known as Kopanisti. We serve it with pita crisps or crackers. —Michael Hall, Goodland, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pickled Mushrooms with Garlic
images.description: I'm always asked to bring these tempting tidbits to holiday gatherings. Easy to make ahead and transport, they're something to celebrate on a festive relish tray. —Joyce Anderson, Chico, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Garlic-Herb Mini Quiches
images.description: Looking for a wonderful way to ring in the New Year? You’ve got it—and you need only five ingredients to make these tasty apps! —Josephine Piro, Easton, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet & Savory Pineapple Cheese Ball
images.description: One of my favorite dishes in childhood was my mom's pineapple and green pepper cheese ball. Now I make it, and it’s always a hit. —Susan Harrison, Laurel, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gorgonzola Polenta Bites
images.description: For a New Year’s Day party, I needed a brand-new appetizer. I covered polenta with Gorgonzola and a tangy sauce. That’s how you spread holiday cheer. —Margee Berry, White Salmon, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Candied Bacon-Wrapped Figs
images.description: I stuffed figs with cream cheese and wrapped them in bacon and spices for an addictive flavor combo that’s sweet, salty and delicious. You can use dates, too. —Shelly Bevington, Hermiston, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 35 Super Easy Thanksgiving Appetizers

items.title: 33 Non-Scary Bread Recipes Anyone Can Bake
items.abstract: Intimidated by homemade bread? Love to bake but short on time? Try our collection of easy bread recipes, from super-speedy quick breads to true yeasted loaves. You got this.
items.author: Tasteofhome

images.title: Judy's Chocolate Chip Banana Bread
images.description: I received this recipe from my co-worker and dear friend, Judy, 32 years ago. When she gave it to me she said, “You will never need another banana bread recipe.” She was almost right. I added lots of chocolate chips for the chocolate lovers in my family. — Debra Keiser, St. Cloud, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Favorite Irish Soda Bread
images.description: My best friend Rita shared this irresistible Irish soda bread recipe. It bakes up high, with a golden brown top and a combination of sweet and savory flavors. —Jan Alfano, Prescott, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rustic Garden Herb Biscuits
images.description: The rosemary butter takes warm biscuits to another level. I use herbs from the garden but dried work, too. —Michelle Gauer, Spicer, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Potato Cinnamon Bread
images.description: My family loves quick breads. This one is moist and spicy. If you don't have mini loaf pans it works just as well in regular size pans. —Nancy Foust, Stoneboro, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Basic Homemade Bread
images.description: Here's a basic yeast-risen white bread that bakes up deliciously golden brown. I enjoy the aroma of freshly baked homemade bread in my kitchen. —Sandra Anderson, New York, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Apple Zucchini Bread
images.description: Since apples and zucchini are so abundant in this area, it's only natural that the two be used together in one recipe. I really don't know the origin of this bread, but I do know it's been one of my favorites for many years. —Patti Dillingham, Scranton, Arkansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Honey Corn Bread
images.description: It's a pleasure to serve this moist corn bread to family and guests. Honey gives it a slightly sweet taste. Most people find it's difficult to eat just one piece. -Adeline Piscitelli, Sayreville, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chapati Breads
images.description: My daughter and I used to make this Indian flatbread frequently. It's so fun and goes well with any spiced dish. We use the extras to make sandwich wraps. — Joyce McCarthy, Sussex, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon-Blueberry Tea Bread
images.description: Moist slices of this cake-like bread are bursting with blueberries and lots of lemon flavor. — Wendy Masters, Grand Valley, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: French Loaves
images.description: My kids love to help me make this delicious bread recipe. It's quite easy, and they enjoy the fact that they can be eating fresh bread in less than two hours! —Denise Boutin, Grand Isle, Vermont Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Herbed Dinner Rolls
images.description: After I had my sixth child, a friend dropped off dinner, including these rolls, which start in a bread machine. They were so delicious that I quickly bought my own machine so I could make them myself. —Dana Lowry, Hickory, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Apple Bread
images.description: We're confident that anyone who tries this will be thrilled. The bread has a hearty texture and sweet, home-baked flavor, but none of the fat and calories. —Liz Titler, Madison, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon-Thyme Bread
images.description: Lemon and thyme go together like milk and cookies. Fresh thyme is best, but if you must use dried, reduce the amount to 1 tablespoon and crush it between your fingers before adding it to the batter. —Cathy Tang, Redmond, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Tart Cranberry Quick Bread
images.description: My mother always made this cranberry bread. I usually stock up on cranberries when they're in season and freeze them so I can make this year-round. —Karen Czechowicz, Ocala, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Vegetable & Cheese Focaccia
images.description: My family eats up this flavorful bread as fast as I can make it. Sometimes I add different herbs, red onion or crumbled bacon. It's one of my best recipes! —Mary Cass, Baltimore, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Yummy Apricot Pecan Bread
images.description: Every time I prepare this yummy bread, I always receive raves. It’s perfect with coffee or as a gift, plus it’s really quick and easy to prepare. —Joan Hallford, North Richland Hills, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Dutch Apple Loaf
images.description: Being of Dutch descent, I knew I had to try this recipe for a moist, fruity quick bread. It freezes well, so I often have a loaf on hand for church bazaars. —Gladys Meyer, Ottumwa, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Swirl Cinnamon Bread
images.description: If you like cinnamon, you’ll love this quick bread! It’s crusty on top, soft and moist inside. Make extra loaves for the holidays and give them to family and friends. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Herb Quick Bread
images.description: This simple bread is especially good with soups and stews, but slices are also tasty alongside fresh, green salads. The herbs make it a flavorful treat any time of the year. —Donna Roberts, Shumway, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Elvis Banana Bread
images.description: As a toddler, my son loved bananas, so we always had them in the house. We didn't always eat them all before they were too ripe, so we experimented beyond basic banana bread. That’s how we came up with Elvis bread! —Liz Somppi, Greenfield, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Bacon Walnut Bread with Honey Butter
images.description: My savory loaf filled with bacon bits, walnuts and blue cheese dressing is complemented by the sweetness of honey-flavored butter. Cut yourself a thick slice, slather on the butter and enjoy!—Pam Ivbuls, Omaha, Nebraska Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry-Pecan Cocoa Bread
images.description: Full of sweet cherries and nuts, this loaf has a mild cocoa flavor. It would be perfect to serve for breakfast, brunch or a mid-morning snack. Have a tall glass of milk at the ready.—Margaret Beyersdorf, Kissimmee, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fluffy Biscuits
images.description: If you're looking for a flaky basic biscuit, this recipe is the best. These golden-brown rolls bake up tall, light and tender. Their mild flavor tastes even better when the warm biscuits are spread with butter or jam. —Nancy Horsburgh, Everett, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Italian Holiday Bread
images.description: This is authentic ciambellotto, a sweet loaf my great-grandmother used to bake in Italy. I still use her traditional recipe—the only update I made was for modern appliances. —Denise Perrin, Vancouver, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Beernana Bread
images.description: Really, it's simple arithmetic…or something like that: Beer is good. Banana bread is good. Beernana bread is great! Even guys who don't know their way around the kitchen can pull this one off. —Steve Cayford, Dubuque, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Orange Cranberry Bread
images.description: You can enjoy two moist loaves of bread that are packed with the zesty taste of cranberries and orange peel. I suggest serving slices toasted with butter or cream cheese. —Ron Gardner, Grand Haven, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sun-Dried Tomato Provolone Bread
images.description: This savory quick bread, which was passed down from my mother, is packed with great flavors. It not only goes well will soups and chowders, but makes a delicious accompaniment to beef and chicken entrees. —Marie Rizzio, Interlochen, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon Blueberry Biscuits
images.description: Lemon and blueberries make such a fresh and flavorful combination in all kinds of baked goods, especially these biscuits. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Seeded Whole Grain Loaf
images.description: My husband and I want whole grain bread, but we don't like the spongy store-bought whole wheat breads. I drastically altered one of my favorite batter bread recipes to create this earthy bread. It is crunchy, chewy and easy. The add-ins are just suggestions. Sometimes I use pepitas, sesame seeds or even 1/4 cup of a multi-grain hot cereal mix. —Amber Rife, Columbus, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Raisin Filled Pumpkin Spice Bread
images.description: Years ago, I got this recipe from one of the best cooks in our church. Freeze a few loaves to have on hand when a friend or neighbor needs a pick-me-up. —Martha Sue Stroud, Clarksville, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Louisiana Pecan Bacon Bread
images.description: One Christmas, the babysitter brought gifts for my daughter and a basket of goodies, including pecan bread. When I make this bread, I remember that kind soul. —Marina Castle, Canyon Country, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rosemary Flatbreads
images.description: My family loves this as a pizza crust. But with a touch of olive oil and fresh herbs it makes a lovely flatbread appetizer. —Sue Brown, West Bend, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Double Corn Cornbread
images.description: Looking for a moist bread to dunk in a bowl of chowder or chili? Try this tasty recipe. —Silvana Nardone, New York, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.title: 70 Homemade Baked Goods that Start with Cake Mix
items.abstract: These great cake mix recipes use the store-bought mix as an ingredient, not an end point. Your gorgeous dessert will still be distinctive and delicious  and look nothing like the photo on the box.
items.author: Hazel Wheaton

images.title: Peanut Butter Caramel Bars
images.description: When my husband and our three sons sit down to dinner, they ask, "What's for dessert?" I have a happy group of guys when I report that these rich bars are on the menu. They're chockfull of yummy ingredients. —Lee Ann Karnowski, Stevens Point, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Almond Chocolate Biscotti
images.description: My neighbors look forward to getting my gifts of these chocolate-covered cookies. They're such a cinch to make. —Ginger Chatfield, Muscatine, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pear Bundt Cake
images.description: Next time you make cake from a mix, try my easy and delicious recipe. The pears and syrup add sweet flavor and prevent the cake from drying out. And since there's no oil added to the batter, this tender fall-perfect cake is surprisingly low in fat. —Veronica Ross, Columbia Heights, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon Snowflakes
images.description: Four ingredients is all it takes to whip up these delightful cookies.—Linda Barry, Dianna, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Irish Creme Chocolate Trifle
