images.description: I was given a bottle of Irish cream liqueur as a gift and had leftover peppermint candy, so I created this delicious trifle. It's always rich and decadent. —Margaret Wilson, Sun City, CA Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon Meringue Cupcakes
images.description: Classic lemon meringue pie inspired these gorgeous little cupcakes. The tangy treats hide a surprise lemon pie filling and are topped with fluffy toasted meringue. Make them for your next special gathering. —Andrea Quiroz, Chicago, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cake & Berry Campfire Cobbler
images.description: This warm cobbler is one of our favorite ways to end a busy day of fishing, hiking, swimming or rafting. It's yummy with ice cream—and so easy to make! —June Dress, Boise, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pecan Pumpkin Dessert
images.description: I always fix this recipe for Thanksgiving. It was given to me by a friend and I've shared it with many others. —Sue Williams, Mt. Holly, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Pudding Cake
images.description: This rich, fudgy dessert is a cross between pudding and cake. I like to serve it warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Whenever I take it to parties, everybody wants the recipe. —Paige Arnette, Lawrenceville, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel Apple Cupcakes
images.description: Bring these extra-special cupcakes to your next event and watch how quickly they disappear! With a caramelly topping and spice cake base, they're the perfect mix of two fall-favorite treats. —Diane Halferty, Corpus Christi, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon Angel Cake Bars
images.description: A neighbor gave me this recipe years ago and it's been in flavor rotation ever since. It can be made ahead and serves a bunch, so it's perfect for parties and potlucks. —Marina Castle, Canyon Country, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Come-Home-to-Mama Chocolate Cake
images.description: You'll spend less than a half hour whipping up this cure-all cake that starts with a mix. Sour cream and chocolate pudding make it rich and moist, and chocolate, chocolate and more chocolate make it decadent comfort food at its finest. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Butterscotch Toffee Cookies
images.description: With its big butterscotch and chocolate flavor, my cookie stands out. I like to enjoy it with a glass of milk or a cup of coffee. It’s my fallback recipe when I’m short on time and need something delicious fast. —Allie Blinder, Norcross, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Almond Fudge Cakes
images.description: I teach in a school with 3-4 teachers per grade. I bake this cake in small springform pans so that each group can grab a cake before school and divide it among themselves later. Sometimes I slice the cakes into 3 or 4 slices and fill one layer with strawberry preserves or cherry pie filling.—Carleen Johns, Brownwood, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pistachio Cake with Walnuts
images.description: It didn't take long for this cake from the 1970s to become the favorite birthday cake of my husband, Joe. —Patty LaNoue Stearns, Traverse City, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Triple Fudge Brownies
images.description: When you're in a hurry to make dessert, here's a "mix of mixes" that's so convenient and quick. The result is a big pan of very rich, fudgy brownies. Friends who ask me for the recipe are amazed that it's so easy. —Denise Nebel, Wayland, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Tres Leches Cupcakes
images.description: A sweet, silky mixture using a trio of milks makes these little cakes three times as good. Because they soak overnight, they're a great make-ahead dessert for a potluck. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Cordial Cake Balls
images.description: Brandy and coffee add mild flavor to these scrumptious cherry cake balls. —Susan Westerfield, Albuquerque, New Mexico Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin-Pecan Spice Cake
images.description: I'm a wife and mother of eight children. I like baking more than cooking, so I enjoy dressing up a spice cake mix with nuts, canned pumpkin and a homemade cream cheese frosting to create this fabulous dessert. —Joyce Platfoot, Wapakoneta, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Banana Chip Cake
images.description: This is my version of Ben & Jerry’s Chunky Monkey Ice Cream (my favorite!) in a cake. The hardest part is waiting for it to cool. —Barbara Pryor, Milford, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Chip Cookies
images.description: "It's a snap to make a batch of tasty cookies using this recipe, which calls for a convenient boxed cake mix," relates Mary Pulyer of Port St. Lucie, Florida. "My husband and son gobble them up." Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Potato Cheesecake Bars
images.description: Your whole house will be filled with the aroma of pumpkin spice when you bake these wonderful sweet potato cheesecake bars. They look complicated but are so easy, you can whip up a batch anytime. —Nancy Whitford, Edwards, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Chip Red Velvet Whoopie Pies
images.description: Baking a fun treat is a must when my four grandchildren come for “Grandma Camp.” This year I’ll recruit the oldest, Henry, to help pipe the cake batter. —Linda Schend, Kenosha, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Layer Cake
images.description: I adapted a Bundt cake recipe to create this layer cake. Cranberries, walnuts and homemade frosting make it taste so delicious that you'd never guess it starts with a convenient cake mix. —Sandy Burkett, Galena, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pina Colada Bundt Cake
images.description: We named this bundt a “pina colada” because it has coconut, pineapple and rum. It’s a soothing finish at the end of a big spread. —Debra Keil, Owasso, Oklahoma Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Quick Chocolate Sandwich Cookies
images.description: These cookies freeze well, so it's easy to keep some on hand for last-minute munching. In summer, I often make them larger to use for ice cream sandwiches. —Mary Rempel, Altona, Manitoba Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel Nut Breakfast Cake
images.description: I first tasted this incredible coffee cake when a kind neighbor brought it by. It was so good, my brother-in-law tried hiding it from us so he wouldn’t have to share. —Arlene Isaac, Crooked Creek, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Strawberry Cake
images.description: Garnish the top of this strawberry cake with fresh strawberries to hint at the flavor of this pretty pink cake before you cut it—or let it be a surprise! —Pam Anderson, Billings, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Eggnog Cheesecake Bars
images.description: My family loves everything cheesecake. These bars combine tart cranberries and rich cream cheese, and taste even better when chilled overnight! —Carmell Childs, Ferron, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sacher Torte Squares
images.description: Sacher torte is a Viennese cake that requires several steps. My squares are an easy alternative, but they still feature the classic apricot and chocolate flavors. —Arlene Erlbach, Morton Grove, IL Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Oatmeal Cream Pies
images.description: These easy cookies use only five ingredients and taste very similar to a store-bought cookie. Of course, everything's better from your own kitchen! —Crystal Schlueter, Northglenn, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Macadamia Sunshine Bars
images.description: Your guests will be delighted with my bars. They are packed with nuts and dried fruit. I think that when you take a bite of this treat it’s like a mini-vacation to a Polynesian paradise. —Jeanne Holt, Mendota Heights, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: German Chocolate Tres Leches Cake
images.description: I first tried tres leches cake while in Ecuador several years ago. Since then, I’ve changed it up by adding some of my favorite ingredients, namely chocolate and coconut. This version also has a splash of rum for an adults-only treat. —Lisa Varner, El Paso, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Orange-Lemon Cake
images.description: Family and friends will love this moist cake’s refreshing citrus taste and its pretty presentation. —Ann Robinson, Bloomington, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Cherry Coffee Cake
images.description: With its pretty layer of cherries and crunchy streusel topping, this coffee cake is great for breakfast. Or you can even serve it for dessert. —Gail Buss, Beverly Hills, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fudgy Mint Cookies
images.description: Chocolate lovers will get a double dose when they bite into this cake-like cookie. The cookies are especially popular served alongside a big scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream! —Renee Schwebach, Dumont, MN Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blueberry Crumb Bars
images.description: Think of this as a blueberry crisp turned into a hand-held treat. Oats and fresh blueberries are combined for a sweet, no-fuss dish. —Blair Lonergan, Rochelle, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Warm Rocky Road Cake
images.description: When it's warm, this reminds me of super-moist lava cake. And until I made this, I didn't think a slow-cooker cake could be so attractive. It's a real winner. —Scarlett Elrod, Newnan, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Graham Streusel Coffee Cake
images.description: I use this sweet coffee cake recipe often. It's quick and easy to make. —Blanche Whytsell, Arnoldsburg, West Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Coconut Cake with White Chocolate Frosting
images.description: My husband adores coconut but not so much cake. When I take this beauty to family potlucks, he gets his coconut, too. —Sharon Rehm, New Blaine, Arkansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rum-Glazed Pumpkin Cake
images.description: For years, my co-workers were taste testers as I worked on a recipe for pumpkin cake. This version wins, hands down. —Gilda Smith, Santee, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Butterscotch-Toffee Cheesecake Bars
images.description: I took a cheesecake bar recipe and added a new flavor combo to transform it! The butterscotch and toffee really taste divine here. —Pamela Shank, Parkersburg, West Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pear Upside-Down Gingerbread
images.description: I prefer to bake from scratch, but this Christmasy cake mix recipe is a favorite. For a change of pace, use apples and walnuts in place of the pears and pecans.—Trisha Kruse, Eagle, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Spice Cookies
images.description: These big soft spice cookies, created by our Test Kitchen staff, have a sweet frosting that makes them an extra special treat. Enjoy! —Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Deluxe Strawberry Shortcake
images.description: This tasty shortcake is perfect for the Fourth of July. I love the moist, from-scratch flavor. It's foolproof and always brings lots of compliments. —Janet Fant, Denair California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Banana Nut Bread
images.description: A yellow cake mix streamlines assembly of this moist golden bread. I searched a long while for a banana bread that was easy to make. This one takes no time at all, and makes two loaves. —Marie Davis, Pendleton, South Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Minister's Delight
images.description: A friend gave me this recipe several years ago. She said a local minister's wife fixed it every Sunday, so she named it accordingly —Mary Ann Potter, Blue Springs, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Can't Leave Alone Bars
images.description: Convenient cake mix hurries along the preparation of these tasty bars. I bring these quick-and-easy treats to church meetings, potlucks and housewarming parties. I often make a double batch so we can enjoy some at home. —Kimberly Biel, Java, South Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Apricot-Pecan Thumbprint Cookies
images.description: I enjoy experimenting with cake mixes to make new cookie recipes. I love apricot, but feel free to fill the thumbprint in the center of these goodies with any fruit preserve you like. —Nancy Johnson, Laverne, Oklahoma Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Susan's Favorite Mocha Cake
images.description: "My family insists on this cake for our Christmas dinner. They refer it to as 'the best cake in the world.' The flavors are simply wonderful." – Susan Bazan, Sequim, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pineapple Orange Cake
images.description: This is one of my favorite cakes. It’s moist and light yet so satisfying. I’ve been adapting it for years and now it’s almost guilt-free. —Pam Sjolund, Columbia, South Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Little Holiday Cakes
images.description: My college friend shared this cupcake recipe that has pie crust on the bottom, raspberry jam in the middle and cake on top—scrumptious for a buffet or potluck. —Dana Beckstrom, Salt Lake City, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel-Pecan Dream Bars
images.description: These ooey-gooey cake bars that pull ever so gently from the pan and hold a firm cut are a baker’s dream come true. —Cay Keppers, Nisswa, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spiced Sherry Cake
images.description: My mother received this recipe from a friend years ago when fluted tube pans first became popular. The cake lasts a few days in the refrigerator, but I personally love to serve it warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. —Debbie Pelletier, Jupiter, FL Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rhubarb Berry Coffee Cake
images.description: I rely on a cake mix to speed the prep for this moist streusel-topped dessert that pairs tart rhubarb with sweet strawberries. It's great all by itself, but feel free to add some frosting or ice cream. —Jackie Heyer, Cushing, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Peppermint Patty Sandwich Cookies
images.description: At my annual holiday party, these cookies are a big hit with kids and adults, especially when I mix festive food coloring or crushed candy canes into the filling. —Amy Martin, Vancouver, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Crumb Dessert
images.description: This dessert is a sweet treat, especially when garnished with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of ice cream! The crust and crumb topping have a wonderful nutty flavor, and the smooth fruit filling looks beautiful when served. —Ann Eastman, Greenville, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Black Forest Dump Cake
images.description: I make a Black Forest cake the easy way: Dump everything into a dish and let the magic happen. Give it a cherry topping by reserving two tablespoons of juice from the canned cherries and stir into whipped cream. —Meghan McDermott, Springfield, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Dream Cake
images.description: I serve this cake for holidays because it's so festive and easy. No one will know your secret is adding a package of cherry gelatin to a boxed cake mix! —Margaret McNeil, Germantown, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel-Fudge Chocolate Cake
images.description: To satisfy the chocolate lovers in our family, I added hot fudge topping and chocolate chips to a caramel-covered dessert that's quite popular in our area. The moist cake layer is a breeze to prepare using a boxed mix, and the rich toppings make it especially decadent. —Karen Stucky, Freeman, South Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Favorite Frosted Cinnamon Rolls
images.description: I serve these yummy frosted rolls warm from the oven as a Christmas morning treat at our house. Even if you are not accustomed to working with yeast dough, you'll find this dough is easy to handle. —Julie Sterchi, Jackson, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Potato Cranberry Cake
images.description: This convenient recipe uses items you have in your pantry, like sweet potatoes, cranberries, coconut and chocolate chips. Everyone will enjoy this delicious dessert! —Amie Valpone, New York, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: ABC Muffins
images.description: The ABC stands for Applesauce, Bran and Cinnamon. These moist bran muffins are an absolute favorite at our house. In fact, my husband asks for them instead of birthday cake. —Susan Smith, Newark, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: More The Merrier Orange, Fig & Walnut Bars
images.description: Orange, fig and walnuts make a bar that’s uniquely different and delicious. Think you can eat just one? —Judy Dalton, Danville, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rainbow Layer Cake
images.description: Fruity gelatin helps create the rainbow effect for this pretty cake. Lemon frosting is a nice and springy finishing touch. —Dawn Shackelford, Fort Worth, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Giant Spice Cookies
images.description: "I heard this cookie recipe over the radio about 1950—shortly after my husband and I married," recalls Sandy Pyeatt of Tacoma, Washington. "The big spicy treats are so nice and chewy, they remain my favorite to this day." Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Root Beer Float Cake
images.description: I add root beer to both the cake batter and fluffy frosting of this summery dessert to get that great root beer float taste. Serve this moist cake to a bunch of hungry kids and watch it disappear! —Kat Thompson, Prineville, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Ultimate Chocolate Cake
images.description: Semisweet chocolate chips add rich flavor to this moist chocolaty cake that's lower in fat. Slices of it are excellent for dessert or a snack. —Kay McMicken, Charlotte, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Cake Mix Bars
images.description: I take these bars to work for Friday pick-me-ups. I love to share them because they're so easy to eat, easy to make and easy on the wallet. —Amy Rose, Ballwin, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Eggnog Cream with Spiced Pecan Raisin Dunkers
images.description: I have a thing for eggnog and other creamy desserts like s’mores, pudding, mousses and dips. So I turned them into one yummy dip with homemade dunkers. —Arlene Erlbach, Morton Grove, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 70 Incredible Ways to Upgrade a Box of Cake Mix

items.title: 30 Vintage Cakes Like Grandma Used To Make
items.abstract: From fluffy angel food to decadent Devil's food, vintage cakes are making a comeback. Bake your way through this collection of classic recipes and make your grandma proud.
items.author: Tasteofhome

images.title: Grandma's Red Velvet Cake
images.description: In our family no one thinks it’s Christmas without the Red Velvet Cake. I baked the first one for Christmas in 1963 when I found the recipe in the newspaper and my Mother kept the tradition going into the ’80s. It’s different than other Red Velvet Cakes I’ve tasted over the years, since this one tastes only mildly chocolate and the icing is as light as snow. —Kathryn H. Davison, Charlotte, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Classic Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
images.description: A classic recipe like this never goes out of style! It’s delicious with the traditional pineapple, but try it with peaches or a combination of cranberries and orange. —Bernardine Melton, Paola, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: German Black Forest Cake
images.description: As far as I know, this cake recipe can be traced back to my German great-grandma. When I got married, my mother gave me a copy and I hope to someday pass it down to my children. —Stephanie Travis, Fallon, Nevada Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Contest-Winning Gingerbread with Lemon Sauce
images.description: I asked my mother-in-law for this recipe once I learned it's my husband's favorite. Now I bake it whenever he needs an extra-special treat. The spice cake topped with lemony sauce makes us both smile. —Kristen Oak, Pocatello, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Old-Fashioned Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
images.description: A pleasingly moist cake, this treat is the one I requested that my mom make each year for my birthday. It's dotted with sweet carrots and a hint of cinnamon. The fluffy buttery frosting is scrumptious with chopped walnuts stirred in. One piece of this cake is never enough!—Kim Orr, West Grove, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spiced Devil's Food Cake
images.description: One of my mom's friends gave her this recipe when I was a child and it has been a family favorite ever since. When your "chocolate sweet tooth" acts up, this really hits the spot! —Linda Yeamans, Ashland, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: 7UP Pound Cake
images.description: My grandmother gave me my first cake recipe—a pound cake using 7UP—and her grandmother gave it to her. On top of being delicious, it represents family tradition, connection and love. —Marsha Davis, Desert Hot Springs, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Moist Lazy Daisy Cake
images.description: We always called this Mama's "never fail" recipe. I guess the same holds true for me, since I've entered this cake in contests and won with it. This tasty dessert is popular in our family, and it always brings back fond memories of Mama. —Carrie Bartlett, Gallatin, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lady Baltimore Cake
images.description: I first made this cake for my fathers' birthday and now it is the only cake that he requests. This cake has complex flavors and is very unique. —Cleo Gonske, Redding, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Southern Lane Cake
images.description: I just love this Southern-style dessert, and so do dinner guests. With pecans, cherries and raisins in the filling and topping, the recipe is reminiscent of a fruitcake—only yummier! —Mabel Parvi, Ridgefield, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gran's Apple Cake
images.description: My grandmother occasionally brought over this wonderful cake warm from the oven. The spicy apple flavor combined with the sweet cream cheese frosting made this dessert a treasured recipe. Even though I've lightened it up, it's still a family favorite. —Lauris Conrad, Turlock, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Best Angel Food Cake
images.description: For our daughter's wedding, a friend made this lovely, airy cake from a recipe she's used for decades. Serve slices plain or dress them up with fresh fruit. —Marilyn Niemeyer, Doon, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grandma's Tandy Kake
images.description: My grandmother made this for all our family gatherings. Everyone loves it now I make it for every party we attend or host. —John Morgan III, Lebanon, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Flourless Chocolate Torte
images.description: Here’s the perfect dessert for chocoholics—like me! I bake the melt-in-your-mouth torte all the time for special occasions. For an elegant finish, dust it with confectioners’ sugar. —Kayla Albrecht, Freeport, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Banana Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
images.description: As a mother of three sons, I know that sweets are a staple in my kitchen! I buy lots of ripe bananas on sale and freeze them with this cake in mind. I’m often asked to bring it to family picnics and dinners.—Bonnie Krause, Irvona, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Bavarian Torte
images.description: Whenever I take this eye-catching torte to a potluck, I get so many requests for the recipe. —Edith Holmstrom, Madison, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Coconut Italian Cream Cake
images.description: I’d never tasted an Italian cream cake before moving to Colorado. Now I bake for people in the area, and this beauty is one of my most requested treats. —Ann Bush, Colorado City, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Classic Tres Leches Cake
images.description: Tres leches means "three milks." This cake gets its name because it uses three kinds of milk—evaporated, condensed and cream. This cake's light and airy texture has made it a classic in Mexican kitchens for generations. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Vanilla Ring Cake
images.description: Yes, the amount is correct—you add 2 tablespoons of vanilla to the batter. A friend who shared this recipe years ago loved the taste of vanilla and wanted this cake to taste just as good. I like to use Mexican vanilla in this recipe.—Joan Hallford, North Richland Hills, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Walnut Honey Cake
images.description: This light and fluffy marvel all but melts in your mouth. Back in the day, it took effort for my grandmother's kitchen helper to make it, but now that we have stand mixers, it's a breeze. —Lily Julow, Lawrenceville, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Spice Cake with Maple Glaze
images.description: Serve up some fun with this delicious cake that’s yummy any time of the year, but especially nice during the holiday season. No one will guess that cake mix simplifies the recipe. The traditional pumpkin and spices plus the delectable maple glaze give it a real from-scratch taste. —Barbara Elliott, Tyler, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Coconut Chiffon Cake
images.description: Toasted coconut adds visual appeal to this tall and impressive cake. With an airy texture and heavenly coconut-ginger flavor,it's a lovely end to meals throughout the year. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sandy's Chocolate Cake
images.description: Years ago, I drove 4-1/2 hours to a cake contest, holding my entry on my lap the whole way. But it paid off. One bite and you'll see why this velvety beauty won first prize. —Sandra Johnson, Tioga, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spicy Applesauce Cake
images.description: This picnic-perfecgt cake travels and slices very well. With chocolate chips, walnuts and raisins, it's a real crowd pleaser. —Marian Platt, Sequim, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Jeweled Fruitcake
images.description: I promise this jeweled fruitcake is simply fantastic. Even my friends and family members who don’t normally care for fruitcake say they love it! —Sharon Hoffman, Donna, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: German Chocolate Tres Leches Cake
images.description: I first tried tres leches cake while in Ecuador several years ago. Since then, I’ve changed it up by adding some of my favorite ingredients, namely chocolate and coconut. This version also has a splash of rum for an adults-only treat. —Lisa Varner, El Paso, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gingered Apple Upside-Down Cake
images.description: I like that this gingerbread delight is so deeply flavored and delicious. Served warm from the oven, a nice scoop of vanilla bean ice cream is definitely the icing on this cake. —Raymonde Bourgeois, Swastika, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Buttermilk Pound Cake
images.description: Now that I've retired from teaching, I have more time to bake. This cake is the one I make most often. It is a truly Southern recipe, and one I think can't be topped—once people taste it, they won't go back to their other pound cake recipes. —Gracie Hanchey, De Ridder, Louisiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Spiced Rum Pound Cakes
images.description: My recipe makes two loaf-size treats, perfect for sharing. The spiced rum flavor in both the cake and the glaze really comes through. —Christine Russell, Littleton, New Hampshire Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Butter Pecan Layer Cake
images.description: Pecans and butter give this cake the same irresistible flavor as the popular ice cream. —Becky Miller, Tallahassee, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.title: The Secret Technique for Getting Crispy Oven-Baked Fries
items.abstract: Is there anything better than a batch of perfectly cooked fries? Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, these golden spears have satisfied cravings for decades. Want to make your own fries without soaking them in a Jacuzzi of messy oil? Read on.
items.author: skosalos

images.title: Pick the Right Potato
images.description: Grab Russet (aka Idaho) potatoes for your oven-baked fries. They're high in starch and low in water, so they'll bake up nicer than other varieties. Plan on using one medium potato for each person at the table.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / zorbital

images.title: Head to the Cutting Board
images.description: After scrubbing the potatoes, you can peel them or leave the skins on for a little extra fiber. Carefully slice the potatoes into 1/4- to 1/2-inch-thick fries. Any thinner and you risk the chance of the fries drying out during baking or falling apart in the next step.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Sea Wave

images.title: Soak 'em
images.description:
Ready for the ultimate secret to crispy fries? (Insert your own drum roll here.) Soak those spuds! Drop the fries into very cold water for 45 minutes. This process, called blanching, will help remove excess starch. You can even set them in the refrigerator if you want. After blanching, rinse the fries and dry them between two clean kitchen towels.
Pro tip: If you're making a big batch of fries for a large group, add a tablespoon of lemon juice to the water to prevent the potatoes from browning, and soak the spuds for a few hours.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / ffolas
images.image_alt: Adding potato slices into pan with water.

images.title: Season Well
images.description: Treat the fries to a light coating of olive oil to help them crisp up while baking. Season with salt, garlic powder or herbs. For easy cleanup, put the fries, oil and seasoning into a resealable storage bag. Close the bag and shake it up!
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / pressxto
images.image_alt: pouring oil or yellow liquid on white background

images.title: Turn Up the Heat
images.description: Make sure that oven is hot by preheating it to 400° to 425°. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or with aluminum foil that's been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Try not to overlap the fries so they brown equally, and don't crowd them too tightly in the pan as you'll need to flip the fries halfway through the baking time. Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until golden brown and crisp.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / plantic
images.image_alt: Close up of women hand setting cooking mode or temperature on oven

images.title: Enjoy
images.description: And there you have it: crispy, crunchy fries without a deep fryer. Feel free to get creative with or experiment with different oils. So what are you waiting for? Grab a few potatoes and bake up a batch tonight! Psst: They go great with our favorite burger recipes.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Brent Hofacker
images.image_alt: Homemade Oven Baked French Fries with Ketchup

items.title: 43 Must-Try Puff Pastry Recipes
items.abstract: From breakfasts to desserts and everything in between, this recipe collection shows off puff pastry's versatility and convenience with any-occasion dishes that are easy, impressive and loaded with buttery, flaky goodness.
items.author: Ellie Martin Cliffe

images.title: Fontina Asparagus Tart
images.description: This lemony tart is loaded with fontina cheese and fresh asparagus. It's a snap to make but looks really impressive. Be advised…your guests will be vying for the last tasty slice. —Heidi Meek, Grand Rapids, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brie Cherry Pastry Cups
images.description: These yummy little appetizers almost taste like dessert. They are always a big hit at parties. —Marilyn McSween, Mentor, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brunch Puff with Sausage Gravy
images.description: When company stays overnight, I make this puff with sausage gravy as a hearty breakfast treat. It’s meaty, cheesy and delightful with a fresh fruit salad. —Danielle Cochran, Grayling, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Provolone Beef Pastry Pockets
images.description: My children always make sure they're home when they find out we're having these pockets for dinner. They're a smart way to use leftover pot roast. —Karen Burkett, Reseda, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Tomato and Corn Cheesy Pastry Bites
images.description: Local veggies and herbs have a magical knack for inspiring me to cook. After my CSA box arrived, I used the fresh ingredients to create this adorable appetizer. —Kristen Heigl, Staten Island, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Strawberry Shortcake Stacks
images.description: When my wonderful friend Kelly brought me a pint of strawberries, I didn’t want to just eat them straight (tempting as it was). I decided to make strawberry shortcake with my own pretty, elegant spin. These light and airy puff pastry stacks let the fruit shine. —Jenny Dubinsky, Inwood, West Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Butternut, Kale and Cashew Squares
images.description: Butternut squash and kale are two of my favorite fall vegetables. Combined with cashews and feta in a puff pastry, it makes me think this could be a fall version of spanakopita! This could be served for brunch, lunch or dinner as an entree or it could be cut into smaller pieces and served as an appetizer. —Arlene Erlbach, Morton Grove, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mediterranean Tomato Bites
images.description: My friend Mary served these lovely appetizers at a summer gathering several years ago, and I adapted it a bit to my taste. It's a great August recipe when tomatoes and herbs are at their freshest! —Susan Wilson, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Onion Brie Appetizers
images.description: Guests will think you spent hours preparing these cute appetizers, but they're really easy to assemble, using purchased puff pastry. And the tasty combination of Brie, caramelized onions and caraway is terrific. -Carole Resnick, Cleveland, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Southern Brunch Pastry Puff
images.description: My family just about jumps out of bed when the smell of eggs, sausage and buttery pastry hits their noses. This recipe is morning magic. —Misty Michelle Leddick, Chester, South Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel Apple Strudel
images.description: My father, who was born and raised in Vienna, Austria, would tell us stories about how his mother covered all of the kitchen counters with dough whenever she made apple strudel. This recipe is a modern, delicious way to carry on part of my family's heritage. —Sarah Haengel, Bowie, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chickaritos
images.description: This recipe is one I created, substituting chicken for beef and omitting the frying, when our son grew fond of a fast-food restaurant's "junior burritos". They've been a big hit with our whole family ever since! —Nancy Coates, Oro Valley, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Puff Pastry Danishes
images.description: Even though they're simple, these jam-filled danishes are right at home in a holiday brunch spread. They were my dad's favorite, so the recipe will always be close to my heart. —Chellie Helmke, Jackson Center, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Banana Bundles
images.description: Banana and chocolate is such a irresistible combination that I make this quick dessert often. I sometimes sprinkle on a dash of sea salt. You can also top with any leftover butter and brown sugar mixture.—Thomas Faglon, Somerset, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Honeyed Pears in Puff Pastry
images.description: A honey of a salute to late-summer pear season, this cozy dessert has plenty of "wow" factor. Wrapped in puffed pastry, it resembles a beehive. —Heather Baird, Knoxville, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Benedict Eggs in Pastry
images.description: Here's a new twist on an old favorite. Inside these puffy golden bundles is an omelet-like filling of eggs, ham and lemony hollandaise sauce. —Catherine Slussler, Tomball, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Raspberry Chocolate Puffs
images.description: This chocolaty, flaky dessert is one my favorite "show-off" recipes because it makes a spectacular presentation. Although it looks like you fussed, it's actually really easy and quick to make! —Anneliese Deising, Plymouth, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cheesy Chicken Wafflewiches
images.description: I've had lots of fun experimenting with my new waffle maker. I decided to use shredded meat, cheese and vegetables for a savory twist. Make sure the griddle is hot before adding the sandwiches. —Marietta Slater, Justin, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Swedish Puff Coffee Cake
images.description: Some of my most treasured childhood memories involve waking to the heavenly scent of this almond-glazed coffee cake baking in the oven. — Mary Shenk, DeKalb, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pesto Twists
images.description: Use pesto made straight from your garden if you make these in the summer or purchase it prepared from the grocery store to fill these easy appetizers. —Jaye Beeler, Grand Rapids, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Puff Pastry Chicken Potpie
images.description: When my wife is craving comfort food, I whip up my chicken potpie. It's easy to make, sticks to your ribs and delivers soul-satisfying flavor. —Nick Iverson, Taste of Home lead test cook Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Palmiers
images.description: It takes just two ingredients to make these impressive but easy-to-do French pastries, which are often called palm leaves. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Ham and Broccoli Puffs
images.description: These starters look complex, but they're easy to make and still very elegant. —Lynda McCulloch, San Antonio, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Shiitake Scrambled Eggs in Puff Pastry
images.description: Easter brunch will be an event to remember with this elegant egg pastry as the main dish. Everyone will love the bold flavors and light texture. —Jamie Brown-Miller, Napa, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Smoked Salmon Bites with Shallot Sauce
images.description: Tangy mayonnaise-Dijon sauce adds zip to flaky pastry and layers of crisp arugula, thinly sliced smoked salmon and nutty-flavored Asiago cheese. —Jamie Brown-Miller, Napa, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Oktoberfest Strudels
images.description: My husband, being born and raised in Wisconsin, loves bratwurst sausages. So I tweaked this strudel recipe to include some of his favorite filling ingredients and it was an instant hit. Serve with extra mustard for dipping. —Cleo Gonske, Redding, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Potato Ham Omelet Pie
images.description: As a holiday kickoff, my family gets together in early December for a hearty brunch before going out to cut our Christmas trees. This flavorful breakfast pie, assembled in layers, was a big hit at last year's gathering. -Shelly Rynearson, Oconomowoc, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Hazelnut Mousse Cups
images.description: Three of my favorite foods—chocolate, hazelnuts and puff pastry—come together for an impressive dessert. Dress them up with a drizzle of melted chocolate and sprinkling of chopped nuts. —Roxanne Chan, Albany, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mini Party Burgers
images.description: We love finger foods in the South. For a party, I make mini burgers in advance, then wrap, bake and serve them with assorted sauces. —Monica Flatford, Knoxville, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Autumn Torte Rustica
images.description: The wonderful flavor and lovely look of this cheese and vegetable pie is worth the bit of extra effort it takes to prepare it. The butternut squash adds a subtle sweetness that's irresistible. Slices make a great appetizer, or serve it with soup or salad as a light meal. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Raspberry & Cream Cheese Pastries
images.description: I wanted to surprise my grown daughter with a different dessert for her birthday. The puff pasty tarts I dressed up have a chocolaty center with a splash of amaretto.—Jennifer Zuk, Burnaby, British Columbia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Individual Beef Wellingtons
images.description: A savory mushroom-wine sauce is draped over golden pastry. This elegant entree is perfect to present to guests on Christmas. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Aussie Sausage Rolls
images.description: I was born and raised in Australia, but moved to the U.S. when I married my husband. When I long for a taste of home, I bake up a batch of these sausage rolls and share them with neighbors or co-workers. —Melissa Landon, Port Charlotte, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Puffed Apple Pastries
images.description: For a little extra indulgence, serve these oven-fresh pastries with a scoop of creamy vanilla ice cream. Cherry pie filling can be substituted for the apple. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramelized Fennel Tarts
images.description: Fennel is a favorite of mine, no matter how it’s cooked, but I think it is really amazing sauteed until rich and golden, then baked on delicious puff pastry. I’ve served these as a side dish and as an appetizer.—Lisa Speer, Palm Beach, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Greek Breadsticks
images.description: Get ready for rave reviews with these crisp breadsticks twisted with Greek-inspired goodness. Best served fresh from the oven. —Jane Whittaker, Pensacola, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Reuben Rounds
images.description: Fans of the classic reuben sandwich will go crazy for baked pastry spirals of corned beef, Swiss and sauerkraut. They're so easy to make, and bottled Thousand Island dressing makes the perfect dipping sauce. —Cheryl Snavely, Hagerstown, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fruity Puff Pastries
images.description: Caramelized pears with raspberries in puff pastry shells make a special dessert any night of the week. Do not freeze. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sweet Almond Twists
images.description: These delicate almond pastries make lovely light-as-air accompaniments for coffee, tea or cocoa. Your guests will never guess the recipe calls for packaged frozen dough. —Gloria Devendittis, Waterford, Connecticut Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mushroom Palmiers
images.description: I found this recipe while working at a small-town museum in West Texas. It was the appetizer for a fundraiser a long, long time ago, and it’s still a huge hit at parties. Frozen puff pastry helps make it easy and impressive. The palmiers also freeze well. —Judy Lock, Panhandle, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mini Sausage Pies
images.description: The simple ingredients and family-friendly flavor of these little sausage cups make them a go-to dinner favorite. The fact that everyone gets their own pie makes them even better! —Kerry Dingwall, Ponte Vedra, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Peanut Butter Cup Napoleons
images.description: Top layers of puff pastry and peanut butter ice cream with a warm, sweet drizzle the whole family will love! It’s a terrific last-minute dessert, or you can freeze the cooled pastry and scooped ice cream separately in an airtight container the day before you serve it. —Jeanne Holt, Mendota Heights, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Bacon Galette
images.description: Sweet, smoky, tangy, fresh…the flavors in this distinctive appetizer are sure to perk up taste buds for dinner. I sprinkle the warm squares with basil and add a dollop or two of a mascarpone cheese topping. —Merry Graham, Newhall, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 45 Must-Try Puff Pastry Recipes

items.title: 25 Juicy, Golden Holiday Turkey Recipes
items.abstract: For many families, it just isn't the holiday feast without a turkey. Whether your bird is roasted, grilled or even slow cooked, you can bet these turkey recipes will be gobbled right up.
items.author: Ellie Martin Cliffe

images.title: Maple-Sage Brined Turkey
images.description: When the leaves start turning color, it’s turkey time at our house. We use maple-sage brine to help brown the bird and make the meat incredibly juicy. —Kim Forni, Laconia, New Hampshire Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Marinated Thanksgiving Turkey
images.description: My family enjoys this turkey because it cooks up tender, tasty and golden brown. Build up flavor by marinating the meat, then grill it to add a tempting barbecued flavor. &mdashKen Churches, Kailua-Kona, Hawaii Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Moist & Tender Turkey Breast
images.description: This easy turkey recipe is sure to be popular in your home. Everyone will love the taste, and you'll love how quickly it comes together. —Heidi Vawdrey, Riverton, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Tangerine-Glazed Turkey
images.description: A technique passed down from generations—drenching cheesecloth in melted butter and oil, then draping the cloth over the turkey before roasting—helps give the bird beautiful golden-brown skin. The technique also results in juicy, moist breast meat.—Jeanne Horn, Duluth, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Make-Ahead Turkey and Gravy
images.description: Ease the holiday time crunch with a make-ahead turkey recipe that's ready to serve when you are. It's a great choice for potlucks, too. —Marie Parker, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roasted Sage Turkey with Vegetable Gravy
images.description: There’s no place like home-style when roasting the big bird. Instead of sage stuffing with turkey, stuff this bird with fresh sage and sprigs of thyme. — Beth Jacobson, Taste of Home Magazine, Milwaukee, WI Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Citrus Turkey Roast
images.description: I was skeptical at first about fixing turkey in a slow cooker but once I tasted this dish, I was hooked. With a little cornstarch to thicken the juices, the gravy is easily made. —Kathy Kittell, Lenexa, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow Cooker Turkey Breast with Gravy
images.description: This quick-prep recipe lets you feast on turkey at any time of year. We save the rich broth for gravy, noodles and soup making. —Joyce Hough, Annapolis, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry-Orange Roasted Turkey
images.description: You'll have an elegant centerpiece to your meal with this tender, juicy turkey. “The cranberry makes it so good. It has such a wonderful aroma and flavor.” Kara de la Vega - Santa Rosa, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Golden Apricot-Glazed Turkey Breast
images.description: Basted with a simple glaze, this wonderfully moist and tender turkey bakes to a lovely golden brown. Make it the centerpiece of your holiday table; guests will be glad you did. —Greg Fontenot, The Woodlands, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Happy Orange Turkey
images.description: Here’s the perfect centerpiece for your Thanksgiving feast. Champagne and oranges flavor this special bird. Our tester called it “one of my favorite turkey recipes ever!” —Tara Baier, Menomonie, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Dilly Barbecued Turkey
images.description: This is one of my brother-in-law's special cookout recipes. The onions, garlic and herbs in the marinade make a tasty, tender turkey, and the tempting aroma prompts the family to gather around the grill. —Sue Walker, Greentown, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Company's Coming Turkey
images.description: This recipe accomplishes every cook's turkey wish—a bird that brings the flavor of seasonings and herbs in every bite. It's the perfect, mouthwatering centerpiece for your celebration, and it's very easy to prepare. —Caroline Wamelink, Cleveland Heights, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roast Turkey with Sausage-Cabbage Stuffing
images.description: This turkey and trimmings recipe is a staple in my family. No one guesses that there's cabbage in the stuffing! — Alma Winberry, Great Falls, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Slow-Cooked Herbed Turkey
images.description: When herbs are plentiful in my garden, I prepare this turkey recipe. The turkey stays moist in the slow cooker and is bursting with herb flavors. When I served this to our Bible study potluck group, everyone wanted the recipe! —Sue Jurack, Mequon, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Stuffed Turkey with Mojo Sauce
images.description: I love Latin food so I created this recipe that combines wonderful spices and fresh ingredients. This is a traditional turkey recipe with a healthier twist because it uses chicken sausage instead of chorizo. —Melissa Lauer, San Antonio, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Citrus Herb Turkey
images.description: When it came to a roasting turkey, my grandmother had the magic touch: she would wrap her turkey in foil and cook it on low heat for 8 hours so it would bake up juicy and tender. This version doesn't take that long, but it's just as good. —Portia Gorman, Los Angeles, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spatchcocked Herb-Roasted Turkey
images.description: This moist and tender turkey cooks up with even browning and crispy skin in half the time of a whole turkey. —Matthew Hass, Taste of Home Test Cook Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creole Roasted Turkey with Holy Trinity Stuffing
images.description: I jazz up turkey Creole style with the trinity of onions, bell peppers and celery—plus a stuffing that gets hotter and hotter the longer it sits. —Eric Olsson, Macomb, MI Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Citrus & Herb Roasted Turkey Breast
images.description: This recipe will make you love turkey again. Brining with lemon, rosemary and orange juice makes it so moist and flavorful. It's the star attraction at our table. —Fay Moreland, Wichita Falls, TX Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rosemary Turkey Breast
images.description: In Wills Point, Texas, Dorothy Pritchett seasons turkey with a mixture of garlic and rosemary for a tasty and tender bird. The attractive main course is a perfect accompaniment to your holiday meal. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Roasted Turkey with Maple Cranberry Glaze
images.description: I prepare turkey with a taste of Canada in mind. The sweet maple flavor comes through even in the breast meat. You may start to notice it's caramelized color after about 2 hours. That's when I cover it loosely with foil while it finishes cooking. The meat will stay tender and juicy. —Suzanne Anctil, West Vancouver, British Columbia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Thanksgiving Stuffed Turkey
images.description: “I’ve tried fancy stuffing recipes for our Thanksgiving bird, but none hits the spot like my mother’s simple mixture of bread, eggs and caramelized vegetables,” says field editor Lily Julow, Lawrenceville, Georgia. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fresh Herb-Brined Turkey
images.description: Brining a turkey is all about adding moisture for a tender, juicy bird. We flavor our brine with parsley, rosemary and a touch of thyme. —Felicia Saathoff, Vashon, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.title: 23 Blue-Ribbon Recipes Ready to Win Your Heart
items.abstract: These classic recipes took home the coveted blue ribbon at fairs across the country. Make these blue-ribbon recipes for cookies, cake, pie (and even a big burrito) and you, too, will feel the victory.
items.author: Emily Tyra

images.title: Blueberry Lattice Bars
images.description: Since our area has an annual blueberry festival, my daughters and I are always looking for great new berry recipes to enter in the cooking contest. These lovely yummy bars won a blue ribbon one year. —Debbie Ayers, Baileyville, Maine Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Amish Sugar Cookies
images.description: These easy-to-make cookies simply melt in your mouth! I've passed the recipe around to many friends. After I gave the recipe to my sister, she entered the cookies in a local fair and won the "best of show" prize! —Sylvia Ford, Kennett, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sesame Wheat Braids
images.description: Meet the Cook: When I started making this bread, my husband and our six children liked it so much I was baking every day. I was thrilled when the judges at our county fair gave these braids both a blue ribbon and best of show award! -Nancy Montgomery, Hartville, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blue-Ribbon Doughnuts
images.description: What could be more delicious than a warm homemade doughnut? I've been making these tasty treats for my children and grandchildren for many years. —Kay McEwen, Sussex, New Brunswick Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Tropical Muffins
images.description: I entered these muffins at our county fair and won the grand champion award for baked goods. They're so moist, they don't need butter. —Sylvia Osborn, Clay Center, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blue-Ribbon Butter Cake
images.description: I found this recipe in an old cookbook I bought at a garage sale and couldn’t wait to try it. I knew it had been someone’s favorite because of the well-worn page. —Joan Gertz, Palmetto, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Aunt Rose's Fantastic Butter Toffee
images.description: I don't live in the country, but I love everything about it—especially good old-fashioned home cooking! Every year, you'll find me at our county fair, entering a different recipe contest. This toffee is a family favorite! —Kathy Dorman, Snover, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Winning Apricot Bars
images.description: This recipe is "down-home" baking at its best, and it really represents all regions of the country! It's won blue ribbons at county fairs and cookie contests in several states! This treat is easy to make, and it's perfect for potluck suppers, bake sales, lunch boxes or just plain snacking. —Jill Moritz, Irvine, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Muenster Bread
images.description: My sister and I won blue ribbons in 4-H with this bread many years ago. The recipe makes a beautiful, round golden loaf. With a layer of cheese peeking out of every slice, it's definitely worth the effort. -Melanie Mero, Ida, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Five-Star Brownies
images.description: There's a bit of my state's history behind these brownies' name and shape. In 1990, when I entered them at our state fair, Kansas was celebrating the 100th birthday of a famous native son, Dwight Eisenhower. In fact, that occasion was the theme of the fair. So I renamed my brownies, in honor of the rank he'd achieved as a general and cut them out with a star cookie cutter. They ended up winning a blue ribbon! —Pam Buerki Rogers, Victoria, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Barbecued Shrimp & Peach Kabobs
images.description: Shrimp grilled with peaches and green onions really sets off fireworks! The spicy seasonings even helped me win a ribbon at a county fair. —Jen Smallwood, Portsmouth, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Apple-Cherry Cream Cheese Pie
images.description: A layer of sweetened cream cheese topped with a tart fruit filling makes this pie popular with family, friends and co-workers. It won the blue ribbon at a local fair.—Donna L. Rettew, Jonestown, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blue Ribbon Beefy Burritos
images.description: I have a son who lives in Mexico, so we don’t see him very often. When I make these burritos, it feels as if he is right there at the table with us, inhaling them. —Marina Castle, Canyon Country, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Corn Chowder with Potatoes
images.description: I developed this soup out of two others to create my own low-calorie recipe. It turned out so well that I entered it in my county fair and won a blue ribbon. —Alyce Wyman, Pembina, North Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blue-Ribbon Herb Rolls
images.description: These rolls have been a favorite of ours for nearly 25 years. I even baked them in an old wood stove when we lived on a farm. I developed the recipe using several techniques I learned while studying the art of bread making. The recipe won a blue ribbon at our county fair. —Mary Ann Evans, Tarpon Springs, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blue-Ribbon Apple Pie
images.description: This pie is special to me because I won a blue ribbon for it at the local fair and was able to compete at the state farm show. —Collette Gaugler, Fogelsville, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blue Ribbon Red Velvet Cake
images.description: This two-layer beauty features a striking red interior. It calls for more baking cocoa than most red velvet cakes, making it extra chocolaty. Feel free to change the color of the food coloring to suit the occasion. I'm proud to say that this recipe won a blue ribbon in the holiday cake division at the 2006 Alaska State Fair. I think it will be a winner in your house, too! —Cindi DeClue, Anchorage, Alaska Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cheese & Garlic Biscuits
images.description: My biscuits won the division Best Quick Bread at my county fair. One of the judges liked it so much, she asked for the recipe! These buttery, savory biscuits go with just about anything.—Tall Pines Farm, Gloria Jarrett, Loveland, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blue Ribbon Carrot Cake Cookies
images.description: I created this recipe because I just love carrot cake. I wanted something that I could take with me anywhere and not need a fork. I entered my recipe in the Los Angeles County Fair and the cookies not only won first place, but were also named Best of Division. —Marina Castle, Canyon Country, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lime Mint Jelly
images.description: This holly-green jelly won a Best of Show at the county fair and I was so thrilled. Flavored with lime, it's delicious on roasted meats. —Tall Pines Farm, Gloria Jarrett, Loveland, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brown Sugar Icebox Cookies
images.description: My daughters and I have been "fair-ly" successful competitors at county fairs and bake-offs for more than 20 years. This is one of the those winning recipes.—Eilene Bogar, Minier, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Blue-Ribbon Rye Bread
images.description: “My older sister and brother once had a little bread business, selling mom’s homemade loaves to neighbors and other people in the community, including this rye that won best of show at our county fair," says daughter Libby Spicker. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry No-Bake Cookies
images.description: I've always loved my no-bake cookie recipe, but I was never able to place at the fair with them. So I mixed in some maraschino cherries, added a few drops of almond extract, and voila! We won a blue ribbon at the county fair in 2010. —Denise Wheeler, Newaygo, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 23 Blue-Ribbon Recipes Ready to Win Your Heart

items.title: 29 Totally Indulgent Mocha Desserts
items.abstract: Coffee isn't just for drinking. Why not have it for dessert? From cookies to cupcakes, fondue to parfaits, there's something here for every coffeeand chocolatelover.
items.author: Nicole Doster

images.title: Layered Mocha Cheesecake
images.description: In my search for the perfect mocha cheesecake, I ended up combining a few of my favorite recipes to create this delicious version. It’s as much a feast for the eyes as for the palate! —Sue Gronholz, Beaver Dam, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brownie Mocha Trifle
images.description: By using instant pudding and a convenient box of brownie mix, there's nothing to the preparation. The result is moist and chewy. And the layers look so pretty spooned into a glass trifle bowl. —Louise Fauth, Foremost, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Java Pie with Kahlua Cream
images.description: I'm a big coffee drinker and love the iced and frozen versions, too. This pie was my way of incorporating those flavors into a dessert. —Becky McClaflin, Blanchard, Oklahoma Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Mocha Frozen Dessert
images.description: Light as a feather, this cool, satisfying dessert is delicious and impressive to serve. It's an excellent dessert to take to a potluck because it can be made ahead and stored in the freezer. —Launa Shoemaker, Landrum, South Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha-Pecan Ice Cream Bonbons
images.description: These bite-size bonbons may sound tricky to make, but you'll find that fashioning them is a breeze. What's more, our cooking experts advise that you keep this recipe handy when you serve them—as soon as folks sample the treats, they'll be asking how to make them!—Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Hazelnut Torte
images.description: I make this cake on birthdays and other special occasions because it looks and tastes so amazing. The combination of mild hazelnut and coffee flavors is impossible to resist. —Christina Pope, Speedway, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Molten Mocha Cake
images.description: When I first made my decadent slow cooker chocolate cake, my husband and daughter's expressions said it all. She says it's one of her "most favorites." Later, I brought one of these to our next-door neighbors. Turns out their teenage son, who'd answered the door, ate the whole thing without telling anyone else about it! —Aimee Fortney, Fairview, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Easy Mocha Cream Pie
images.description: This chocolate crust is excellent with a cool no-bake mocha filling. — Gina Nistico, Taste of Home Food Editor Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Frosted Snack Cake
images.description: Here's a lighter version of a chocolate mocha cake I've been baking for my family for over 30 years. I replaced part of the sugar with a lower-calorie sugar blend and some of the oil with applesauce. It turned out just as delicious.—Donna Roberts, Manhattan, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Contest-Winning Mocha Fondue
images.description: At our friends’ 25th anniversary celebration, several couples had fun concocting this chocolate fondue. With fresh fruit, marshmallows, pretzels and vanilla wafers as dippers, everyone will want to dive into dessert! Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel-Pecan Mocha Layer Cake
images.description: My version of a prize-winning chocolate cake is irresistible, especially when the rich caramel sauce oozes down the sides. —Judy Castranova, New Bern, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Baked Alaskas
images.description: Make these baked Alaskas ahead of time—you can torch the completed desserts and freeze them up to 24 hours before serving. —Kerry Dingwall, Ponte Vedra, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Creamy Caramel Mocha
images.description: Indulge in a coffeehouse-quality drink with this caramel mocha recipe. With whipped cream and a butterscotch drizzle, this treat will perk up even the sleepiest person at the table. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Sandwich Cookies
images.description: I've had cookies melt in my mouth, but not as much as these do! I've made several versions of these, but I like to make them as sandwiches with an almond-mocha filling. —Anna Sylvester, Sylvania, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Snow-Capped Mocha Fudge Drops
images.description: Everyone loves seeing chocolate on a cookie plate. Our version is super fudgy with an hint of rich mocha. The edible glitter adds a sparkling touch. —Patricia Harmon, Baden, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Truffles
images.description: Nothing compares to the melt-in-your-mouth flavor of these truffles...or to the simplicity of the recipe. Whenever I make them for my family or friends, they're quickly devoured. No one has to know how easy they are to prepare! -Stacy Abell, Olathe, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Frozen Mocha Marbled Loaf
images.description: This showstopping marbled dessert seems fancy, but it's really simple to prepare ahead of time and pop in the freezer. Frosty slices have a creamy blend of chocolate and coffee that's delightful anytime of year. —Cheryl Martinetto, Grand Rapids, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Scalloped Mocha Cookies
images.description: I tore this recipe out of a magazine many years ago, and they are one of my most requested cookie. They contain the four Cs, coffee, chocolate, cinnamon and crunch. Since they are sprinkled with coarse sugar, they add a little glitz to a cookie tray.—Loraine Meyer, Bend, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Truffle Cups
images.description: One classic recipe I pull out every yuletide is for these dreamy creamy truffle cups. They're just so festive...and the smooth filling melts as fast as snowflakes on your tongue! Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Caramel-Mocha Ice Cream Dessert
images.description: You can use any flavor of ice cream in this frosty dessert. Chocolate and vanilla would be delicious substitutes for coffee and dulce de leche.—Scarlett Elrod, Newnan, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Mocha Cheesecake
images.description: I've made this delicious dessert for quite a few occasions, and it is always a hit. The cranberries make it a perfect finale to a holiday dinner. —Anissa Bednarski, Oronoco, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Macaroon Cookies
images.description: This is definitely a grown-up version of an old favorite. The combination of chocolate, coffee and cinnamon are unbelievable. For more fun, I often use chocolate-covered coffee beans on top. —Jeanne Holt, Mendota Heights, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Toffee Mocha Cupcakes
images.description: Chocolate, toffee and espresso make a mouthwatering concoction in this recipe from Brenda Melancon of Baton Rouge, Louisiana. The yummy sweets are perfect for any party or gathering. Make plenty, they'll go fast! Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Hazelnut Mocha Eclairs
images.description: Once you try these, especially the filling, you'll be in heaven. They make a special ending to a meal or treat to afternoon coffee clutch.—Carol Witczak, Tinley Park, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Toffee-Mocha Cream Torte
images.description: When you really want to impress someone, this scrumptious torte is just the thing to make! Instant coffee granules give the moist chocolate cake a mild mocha flavor, while the fluffy whipped cream layers, blended with brown sugar and crunchy toffee bits, are deliciously rich. —Lynn Rogers, Richfield, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mocha Pecan Balls
images.description: Dusted in either confectioners’ sugar or cocoa, this six-ingredient dough rolls up into truffle-like treats—no baking required. —Lorraine Darocha, Mountain City, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Favorite Hazelnut-Mocha Torte
images.description: When my daughter was newly married, one of the recipes she received was this wonderful torte. It looks gorgeous decorated with shaved dark chocolate and chopped hazelnuts. —Elizabeth Cziszler, Calgary, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.title: 28 Gooey, Chewy, Delicious Ways to Love Marshmallows
items.abstract: Give us smore dessert! Enjoy ooey-gooey marshmallow goodness in bars, pies, cakes, pastries and more.
items.author: Molly Jasinski

images.title: Marshmallow Puffs
images.description: With peanut butter, chocolate and marshmallows, these treats were very popular with our three kids as they were growing up—and now I make them for our two grandchildren. They're perfect for the holidays when time is so precious. —Dody Cagenello, Simsbury, Connecticut Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fudgy S'mores Brownies
images.description: I combined the perfect, simple summer snack with my favorite brownie recipe to get a treat that's sure to wow at your next big party. —Judy Cunningham, Max, North Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Marshmallow Pops
images.description: Making these pops is a fun activity for a children's party because any age can participate. Customize them for holidays or special occasions by rolling them in coordinating colored sprinkles. —Marcia Porch, Winter Park, FL Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Marshmallow Cutouts
images.description: I make rich, fudgy cookies that taste like brownies with a marshmallow filling. I usually use heart-shaped cutters, but I've also left them uncut and filled with pink marshmallow creme.—Kelly Ward, Stratford, ON Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Layered Chocolate Marshmallow Peanut Butter Brownies
images.description: A friend of mine gave me the recipe for these layered brownies, but I added my own touch--chunky peanut butter. Every time I take them to a group gathering, I get requests for the recipe. It's a real crowd-pleaser! —Judy Sims, Weatherford, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pot of S'mores
images.description: Mom’s easy Dutch oven version of the popular campout treat is so good and gooey. The hardest part is waiting for this to cool so you can devour it. Yum! —June Dress, Meridian, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemony Gingerbread Whoopie Pies
images.description: These spiced-just-right whoopie pies combine two popular flavors in one fun treat. The moist cookies are rolled in sugar before baking for a bit of crunch. —Jamie Jones, Madison, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Vanilla Almond Hot Cocoa
images.description: Treat your family to this comforting, homemade cocoa as you decorate the tree or open holiday gifts. Vanilla and almond extracts make it taste even more special. —Vicki Holloway, Joelton, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: S'more Pops
images.description: My daughters and I came up with this treat when planning a candy-making party. They also make adorable hostess gifts, are perfect for potlucks and would sell out quickly at a bake sale. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Gelatin Supreme
images.description: When I was growing up, this yummy, easy-to-make dessert was always on the menu at holiday get-togethers. Years ago, my aunt gave me the recipe, and now when I make it for my family, I think of her. —Janice Rathgeb, Brighton, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: S'mores Milk Shake
images.description: When cabin fever hits, we whip up a beverage that tastes like s’mores. Oven-toasted marshmallows and a blender make it happen. —Sarah McKenna, Centennial, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: S'mores Creme Brule
images.description: A big bite into a scrumptious s’more brings back sweet campfire memories. This fancy take on the classic treat is perfect for a fall meal and will be adored by young and old alike. —Rose Denning, Overland Park, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Warm Rocky Road Cake
images.description: When it's warm, this reminds me of super-moist lava cake. And until I made this, I didn't think a slow-cooker cake could be so attractive. It's a real winner. —Scarlett Elrod, Newnan, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: S'mores Monkey Bread Muffins
images.description: When it comes to mini versions of anything, I'm sold! These muffins are ooey-gooey individual-sized monkey breads made with frozen dinner rolls, graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, and mini marshmallows. They couldn't be easier to make, and kids just love them. —Tina Butler, Royce City, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Marshmallow Pumpkin Pie
images.description: This was one of my mom's favorite pie recipes. She was a great cook and was always generous with her recipes, yet she rarely shared this special one. —Ruth Ferris, Billings, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolaty S'mores Bars
images.description: One night, my husband had some friends over to play poker and he requested these s'mores bars. They polished off the pan and asked for more! I shared the recipe, and now their families make them, too. —Rebecca Shipp, Beebe, Arkansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rocky Road Cookie Cups
