images.description: Traditional Rocky Road ice cream has nuts, marshmallows and chocolate. Using prepared cookie dough makes it easy to put the flavors together in these fast, kid-friendly cups.—Charlotte McDaniel, Jacksonville, AL Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: S'mores Cheesecake
images.description: This sweet and decadent cheesecake features graham crackers, chocolate and marshmallows. Enjoy! —Kurt Anderson, Willmar, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rocky Road Grilled Banana Splits
images.description: There's no wrong turn when you travel down this rocky road. Toasty-warm bananas filled with gooey goodness and topped with heaping scoops of (pause for drool) creamy perfection are a new cookout must-have. —Loretta Ouellette, Pompano Beach, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Microwave Marshmallow Fudge
images.description: A batch of this smooth fudge can be made in minutes, so it’s perfect for a bake sale when time is short. But it’s so easy, you can fix it anytime you're craving a sweet treat. Use different flavors of frosting and chips for variety.—Sue Ross, Casa Grande, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: S'Moreos
images.description: My son introduced us to this twist on classic s'mores when we were camping. Have a jar of Nutella around? Slather on the inside of the graham cracker halves before you build this one-of-a-kind treat. —Christina Smith, Santa Rosa, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Black & White Cereal Treats
images.description: When my daughter was just 7 years old, she had the brilliant idea of adding Oreo cookies to cereal treats. Now 24, she still asks for them on occasion; they're that good. —Tammy Phoenix, Ava, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: S'mores Crescent Rolls
images.description: Here’s how to score indoor s’mores: Grab crescent dough and Nutella. Invite the kids to help with this rolled-up version of the campfire classic. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Nana's Rocky Road Fudge
images.description: We make Rocky Road-style fudge every Christmas and it’s a tradition, but why wait until the holidays for a recipe this good? —Ashley Berry, Montgomery Village, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: S'mookies
images.description: S'mores are one of my favorite desserts. I wanted to create a cookie to replace the graham cracker—that's when my s'mookie was born. Just as delicious as the classic.—Maria Davis, Hermosa Beach, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brownie Affogato Sundaes
images.description: We can’t resist brownie sundaes. I combined an affogato (coffee-based beverage) idea with a brownie to get this decadent sundae that mixes it all in there: warm, cold, sweet and salty. —Julie Merriman, Seattle, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Candy Cane Pie
images.description: When my college roommate first made this pie, I couldn't get enough! Using a store-bought crust helps save time when you're in the midst of the holidays. —Charlotte Stewart, Mesa, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Mallow Drops
images.description: These fudgy treats feature a marshmallow layer topped with a squiggle of chocolate frosting. —Marie Hattrup, Sparks, Nevada Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 28 Gooey, Chewy Ways to Love Marshmallows

items.title: Slow Cooker Recipe-a-Day for November
items.abstract: Put your slow cooker to work this November with a month full of in-season recipes. These 30 mains, sides and desserts are the perfect mix of easy dump-and-go and cozy comfort to make the November days a little warmer.
items.author: Caroline Stanko

images.title: Day 1: Chicken with Sugar Pumpkins & Apricots
images.description: When we have family gatherings, we give the slow cooker kitchen duty. This yummy chicken with pumpkin and apricots has the warm flavors of Morocco. —Nancy Heishman, Las Vegas, Nevada Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 2: Beef & Veggie Sloppy Joes
images.description: I’m always looking for ways to serve my family healthy and delicious food, so I started experimenting with my favorite veggies and ground beef. I came up with this favorite that my three kids actually request! This healthy take on sloppy joes reminds me of my own childhood. —Megan Niebuhr, Yakima Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 3: Amazing Slow Cooker Orange Chicken
images.description: Orange chicken is my favorite Chinese takeout food, but I know that it’s very high in sodium and fat. So I got to work at home and created a healthier version. Now I have peace of mind knowing what ingredients are in it and that it’s better for my family. —Barbara J. Miller, Oakdale, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 4: Potato Soup
images.description: I decided to add some character to a basic potato chowder by adding roasted red peppers. The extra flavor gives a deliciously unique twist to an otherwise ordinary soup.—Mary Shivers, Ada, Oklahoma Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 5: Slow Cooker Beef Tostadas
images.description: I dedicate these slow-simmered tostadas to my husband, the only Italian man I know who can’t get enough of Mexican flavors. Pile on your best toppings. —Teresa DeVono, Red Lion, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 6: Spiced Hot Apple Cider
images.description: During cool-weather season, my husband and I take this soul-warming drink outside by the fire pit. Our house smells amazing while the cider is simmering! —Lisa Bynum, Brandon, Mississippi Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 7: Slow-Cooked Rump Roast
images.description: I enjoy a good pot roast, but I was tired of the same old thing, so I started experimenting. Cooking the beef in horseradish sauce gives it a tangy flavor. Even my 6- and 3-year-olds love this roast with its tender veggies and gravy. —Mimi Walker, Palmyra, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 8: Saucy Chicken & Tortellini
images.description: This heartwarming dish is something I threw together years ago for my oldest daughter. When she's having a rough day, I put on the Crock-Pot and prepare this special recipe. —Mary Morgan, Dallas, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 9: Bacon-Beef Barley Soup
images.description: Here’s a robust dish that’s perfect for hungry teenage boys! Served over creamy mashed potatoes, this quick, comforting soup will really hit the spot. —Cathy Peterson, Menominee, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 10: Slow-Cooked Ham
images.description: Entertaining doesn't get much easier than when you serve this tasty five-ingredient ham from the slow cooker. Plus, the leftovers are delicious in casseroles! —Heather Spring, Sheppard Air Force Base, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 11:Slow Cooker Beef Tips
images.description: As a busy mom, I love my slow cooker meals! Beef tips remind me of a childhood favorite. I cook them with mushrooms and red wine, then serve over brown rice, noodles or mashed potatoes. —Amy Lents, Grand Forks, North Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 12: Slow Cooker Peach Crumble
images.description: I look forward to going on our beach vacation every year, but I don't always relish the time spent cooking for everybody. This slow cooker dessert (or breakfast!) gives me more time to lie in the sun and enjoy the waves. Melty ice cream is a must. —Colleen Delawder, Herndon, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 13:Honey Buffalo Meatball Sliders
images.description: These little sliders deliver big Buffalo chicken flavor without the messiness of wings. The spicy-sweet meatballs are a hit on game day with kids and adults alike. —Julie Peterson, Crofton, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 14: Creamy Italian Chicken
images.description: Italian salad dressing mix is like a secret weapon for adding flavor to this creamy chicken dish. Served over rice or pasta, it's rich, delicious and special enough for company. —Maura McGee, Tallahassee, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 15: Beef-Wrapped Stuffed Peppers
images.description: We love Mexican flavors and spicy foods––and this recipe has it all. Try our peppers wrapped with flank steak along with rice, beans and sour cream.—Jane Whittaker, Pensacola, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 16: Slow Cooker Curry Pork
images.description: I’m a stay-at-home mom, and the slow cooker helps me create dishes like this pork with a curry and cumin rub. I add a splash of coconut milk. —Beverly Peychal, Waukesha, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 17: Slow-Simmering Pasta Sauce
images.description: Spaghetti with sauce is my kids' favorite dinner, so through trial and error, I came up with my own recipe. This is the winning result. I love that it's made in a slow cooker.—Samantha Vicars, Kenosha, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 18: Slow Cooker Italian Beef Sandwiches
images.description: I have fond memories of my mother in the kitchen preparing her amazing beef dip sandwiches. They always made our house smell like an Old World Italian restaurant. And as good as the aroma was, somehow the taste was even better! Set out a jar of giardiniera for spooning on top. —Kira Vosk, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 19: Slow-Cooked Blueberry French Toast
images.description: Your slow cooker can be your best friend on a busy morning. Just get this recipe going, run some errands and come back to the smell of French toast ready to eat. —Elizabeth Lorenz, Peru, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 20: Chipotle Carne Guisada
images.description: Chipotle peppers and adobo sauce add smoky heat to tender stewed beef. We serve this hearty dish with tortillas and sometimes rice. —Adrienne Spenrath, Austin, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 21: Broccoli-Cauliflower Chicken Casserole
images.description: A chicken, broccoli and rice casserole is one of our favorite comfort foods. I make my easy variation in the slow cooker, with no rice. You can easily swap in whatever cheese you prefer. I sometimes use dairy-free cheese to create a more paleo-friendly dinner. The dish is also delicious sprinkled with a simple bread crumb topping. —Courtney Stultz, Weir, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 22: Make-Ahead Loaded Mashed Potatoes
images.description: Every year my Mom made cream cheese mashed potatoes for Thanksgiving. I tailored the recipe to my family's taste and carried on the tradition. I make them a day ahead and use my slow cooker to free up oven space for other dishes. —Ann Nolte, Tampa, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 23: Slow Cooker Thanksgiving Turkey Breasts
images.description: Fresh thyme and marjoram lend amazing flavor to turkey breast. It comes out of the slow cooker perfectly tender. —Laurie Mace, Los Osos, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 24: Saucy Italian Roast
images.description: This tender roast is one of my favorite set-and-forget meals. I thicken the juices with a little flour and add ketchup, then serve the sauce and beef slices over pasta. —Jan Roat, Red Lodge, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 25: Apple Butterscotch Crisp
images.description: I give this classic dessert a rich twist with butterscotch pudding. The warm apple filling bubbles to perfection in a mini slow cooker. —Jolanthe Erb, Harrisonburg, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 26: Cuban-Style Pork Sandwiches
images.description: Loaded with tangy flavor, this is a lighter version of a favorite restaurant-style sandwich. If you don’t have a panini maker, tuck the sandwiches under the broiler until the bread is browned and the cheese melted. —Robin Haas, Cranston, Rhode Island Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 27: Slow-Cooked Turkey Stroganoff
images.description: I have been making this tasty dish for 30 plus years. Our family loves turkey and I make a variety of turkey dishes, but this is our favorite. I love it because I can put it in my slow cooker before I leave for work and come home to a hot, delicious dinner. It's great served over cooked noodles, rice, mashed potatoes or polenta. —Cindy Adams, Tracy, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 28: Slow-Cooked Cranberry Hot Wings
images.description: Cranberry wings remind me of all the wonderful celebrations and parties we've had through the years. My daughter’s friends can’t get enough of them. —Noreen Danek, Cromwell, CT Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 29: Beef Roast Dinner
images.description: Because this healthy dish is slow cooked, you can use less-expensive roasts with results as mouthwatering as the more costly cuts. Change up the veggies for variety, nutrition or to suit your tastes!—Sandra Dudley, Bemidji, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Day 30: Asian Shredded Pork Sandwiches
images.description: On cool-weather weeknights, the slow cooker is our friend. The plums might surprise in these juicy pork sandwiches, but they add a little sweetness and make the meat extra tender. —Holly Battiste, Barrington, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: Slow Cooker Recipe-a-Day for November

items.title: 8 Tips for Hosting an Unforgettable Holiday Cookie Swap
items.abstract: Want to throw the perfect Christmas cookie exchange? Nail it with these easy holiday ideas.
items.author: skosalos

images.description: You just can't beat a cozy holiday party. Toss in the idea of taking home dozens of Christmas cookies and a holiday cookie swap rises to the top of the Christmas-party heap! Consider these tips for a fun, festive and stress-free cookie exchange!
images.title: FB_shutterstock_538575922
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Israel Patterson
images.image_alt: Overhead of platters of decorated Christmas cookies and a cup of coffee with a hand

images.title: Choose When & Where
images.description: There are lots of parties this season, so think about what day and time make the most sense for your friends and family. A weeknight get-together? A Sunday Funday? You know your group best; just remember to invite everyone several weeks in advance so guests have time to bake.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Makistock
images.image_alt: Red present box and paper note with Merry christmas message: Ho Ho Ho! place on office table with laptop, colorful diary and a cup of coffee, concept to christmas gift and holiday season

images.title: Get Creative with Your Invite
images.description: Digital invites save money and get the word out quickly but can get overlooked in bustling inboxes. Consider going old school with printed invitations people hold onto and hang on the fridge. No time to be creative? Hit the web for some cute cookie-exchange invites!
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / anucha maneechote
images.image_alt: A mailbox with blue gift box with dots, yellow and green ribbon on background blur beautiful nature

images.title: Be Specific
images.description: In addition to the invite must-haves (date, time, location), let guests know how many cookies to bring and how many varieties. Two dozen of one type of cookie? Three types of cookies at a dozen of each type? A minimum of a dozen cookies per guest is a good starting point.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Sean Locke Photography
images.image_alt: Christmas: Woman Writing Holiday Cards And Having Cocoa

images.title: Keep It Simple
images.description: Take the load off your plate. Ask each guest to bring 2 dozen cookies—one to swap and another to serve. You only need to provide coffee and few other warm beverages because the food is taken care of. Plus, guests get to sample the cookies before the exchange begins!
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Africa Studio
images.image_alt: Many cups of coffee, top view

images.title: Location, Location
images.description: Choose a spot to set out the cookies. A dining room table is ideal, particularly if guests can walk completely around the table when choosing their treats. As guests arrive, ask them to fill out a place card, naming their treat. Set the cards in front of the cookies so everyone knows which cookie is which.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Maria Evseyeva
images.image_alt: Table setting for celebration Christmas and New Year Holidays.

images.title: Set the Rules
images.description: Having guests pick a number from a (Santa) hat levels the playing field regarding who gets to hit the cookie table first. Before the exchange begins, let everyone know how many cookies they're allowed to take.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / mongione
images.image_alt: Red santa hat laying against a wooden background

images.title: Wrap 'Em Up
images.description: Offer guests disposable storage containers or cookie tins so they can pile in their sweets to take home. You can go cheap with disposable aluminum pans from a dollar store or get fancy and buy decorative serving plates that guests can take home as your holiday gift to them. Have plastic wrap on hand to wrap up each plate. Colorful curling ribbon adds a nice touch!
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Jon Manjeot

images.title: Keep It Merry and Bright
images.description: Who cares if Susan brought chocolate-covered pretzels instead of cookies? Big deal if Chris snuck in Snickerdoodles from the bakery. Let it go. Everyone is there to have fun—it's Christmas, after all! Sit back, relax, and enjoy the sweet success of your incredible cookie-swap party.
images.author: Photo: Shutterstock / Alliance
images.image_alt: Portrait of laughing girlfriends having christmas snacks in christmas decorated kitchen

items.title: 67 Healthy Comfort Food Recipes
items.abstract: These homey dishes taste so indulgent, you'd never guess that they've been lightened up.
items.author: Peggy Woodward

images.title: Makeover Shrimp Rice Casserole
images.description: Marie Roberts of Lake Charles, Louisiana loves the lighter version of her shrimp casserole. And why not? It has only half the calories and sodium and 76% less fat than her original recipe. — Taste of Home's Test Kitchen   Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Cream Cheese Streusel Bars
images.description: With an oh-so-chocolaty crust, a crispy, crunchy topping and soft cream cheese filling, these delectable bars are over-the-top indulgent. —Janet Coops, Duarte, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Beef & Sausage Lasagna
images.description: The Taste of Home Test Kitchen trimmed the cholesterol and saturated fat in my original meat-lover's lasagna recipe, and came up with this healthier version. —Jacob Kitzman, Seattle, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Cheddar Biscuits
images.description: Here's our crack at the never-ending biscuits from Red Lobster. Made from scratch with lighter ingredients, they're just as cheesy and buttery as the original. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Fruit Pizza
images.description: We skimmed the calories and fat from a traditional fruit pizza to create this gorgeous, refreshing treat. It’s delightful as a dessert, and it also steals the show at parties and potluck brunches. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Li'l Cheddar Meat Loaves
images.description: My husband goes wild for my meatloaf, but I don't know how healthy it is. The Taste of Home Test Kitchen experts slashed the calories and fat, but kept the original's tender and delicious qualities. —Jodie Mitchell, Denver, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Apple Bread
images.description: We're confident that anyone who tries this will be thrilled. The bread has a hearty texture and sweet, home-baked flavor, but none of the fat and calories. —Liz Titler, Madison, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Slow-Cooked Mac 'n' Cheese
images.description: This recipe is a clear example of comfort food at it's finest; it's rich, hearty and extra cheesy. And because it's made in the slow cooker, it's also extremely easy. —Shelby Molina, Whitewater, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Streusel-Topped Sweet Potatoes
images.description: People really do "eat with their eyes," and no one ever misses the fat and calories in this dish when they see how yummy and attractive the makeover version is. —Tamra Duncan, Lincoln, Arkansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Cheesy Ham 'N' Potato Soup
images.description: This better-for-you version uses lean ham, canola oil, fat-free milk and reduced-fat cheddar cheese. Additional potatoes, whirred in the food processor, plus dry milk powder help keep the soup's thick creamy texture. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Caramel-Pecan Apple Pie
images.description: I lost 120 pounds and want my favorite pie to fit my new eating habits. This version better suits a healthy lifestyle and still delivers out-of-this-world taste. —Ronda Davis, King, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Loaded Pizza
images.description: —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Peanut Butter Cup Cheesecake
images.description: No one will ever guess this decadently rich, firmer-textured cheesecake, originally from Sharon Anderson of Lyons, Illinois has been lightened up. We promise! —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Chicken Potpies
images.description: By using feel-good ingredients like peas, carrots and fat-free milk, you'll want to dive into this healthy and comforting pot pie on days when it's icy cold outside. —John Slivon, Milton, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Swiss Chicken Supreme
images.description: Stephanie Bell asked our home economists to lighten her family-favorite recipe. Even though this makeover recipe is slimmed down, it is still supreme. It has 560 fewer calories, 81% less fat and nearly 75% less sodium. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Greendale, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Zucchini Bread
images.description: This makeover bread has a golden top, lots of sweet cinnamon flavor and a slimmed-down nutritional profile. It’s perfect for your next afternoon snack. —Marjorie Curtis, Haddam, Connecticut Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Beef Stroganoff
images.description: Our pros lightened up this classic dish, slashing calories, saturated fat, sodium and cholesterol, but kept every bit of its satisfying taste. —Candace Clark, Connell, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Hash Brown Casserole
images.description: I wanted a hash brown casserole I could feel good about eating. This light version keeps the cozy flavor while nixing a lot of the fat. —Kelly Kirby, Shawnigan Lake, BC Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Beef & Potato Soup
images.description: Slow-cooker easy, this soup is a Christmas Eve tradition after church services at our house. —Sheila Holderman, Berthold, North Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Philly Steak and Cheese Stromboli
images.description: Our family always looks forward to this traditional stromboli—and now it's lower in fat and calories! —Barb Miller, Oakdale, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Easy Beef-Stuffed Shells
images.description: Enjoy the convenience of this make-ahead dish or bake right away. Either way, it has half the saturated fat of the original recipe but is just as meaty. —Blair Lonergan, Rochelle, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Apple Coffee Cake
images.description: This sugary-topped apple coffee cake is a delicious way to get your family out of bed in the morning. Our pros lightened the original up, but this makeover version is still scrumptious to the core! —Denise Snyder, Lemoyne, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Chicken Enchilada Soup
images.description: Even though they have many other delicious dishes on the menu, I always find myself ordering Chicken Enchilada Soup from Chili’s. Here's the skinny version I make at home. —Traci Campbell, Saginaw, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Creamy Mac & Cheese
images.description: Macaroni and cheese just may be king of the comfort foods. This sensational version is bubbling with creamy goodness —but is lighter on calories. —April Taylor, Holcomb, Kansas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Tuna Melt Bites
images.description: For a healthier take on this diner special, our test kitchen updated to tinier "tuna melt bites," pumped up nutrition with whole wheat buns, slashed calories by substituting fat-free mayo and reduced-fat cheese, and added tomato and spinach on top. Give these a try! Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Overnight French Toast
images.description: “We tried this lighter version recently and the whole family really loved it! You can bet this dish is going to be made more than once.” —Sonya Labbe, Los Angeles Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Turkey Burgers with Peach Mayo
images.description: The unique fruit and mayo combination puts this burger over the top. You can also substitute nectarines for the peaches. They're both delicious! —Charlene Chambers, Ormond Beach, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Biscuits & Gravy
images.description: We lightened up biscuits and gravy to curb our guilt for eating them the day after having pancakes. Here’s a terrific homemade recipe for brunch guests. —Ian Cliffe, Milwaukee, WI Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Creamy Eggnog
images.description: During the holidays, my family always reminds me to make the eggnog. I’ve been making it for nearly 40 years, and my daughter, daughter-in-law and I would like to see a makeover version. —Barbara Smith, Chipley, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Sausage-Stuffed Peppers
images.description: When I tried this makeover version of stuffed peppers, I was surprised how much I enjoyed it. I don't usually like them, but my husband loves them. We preferred them with yellow and red bell peppers instead of green. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Deviled Eggs
images.description: This updated version of a classic appetizer uses only half the egg yolks of the original recipe and calls for soft bread crumbs to help firm up the filling. We replaced the mayo with fat-free mayonnaise and reduced-fat sour cream. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Hash and Eggs
images.description: Loaded with red potatoes and deli corned beef, our lightened up version of corned beef hash delivers fresh flavors and a dose of fiber. It's so spot on, you'll swear you're in a diner! Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Brie and Sausage Brunch Bake
images.description: The aroma of this lower-fat egg bake with all the flavor of the original will have mouths watering! —Becky Hicks, Forest Lake, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Chocolate-Covered Strawberry Milk Shake
images.description: I’m not a big sweets person, but I’ll slurp down a milk shake from Steak ‘n Shake any day! —Sarah Cowley, Houston, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Potato Cheese Soup
images.description: This makeover recipe has about 40% fewer calories, two-thirds less fat, less than half the saturated fat, about half the cholesterol and a third less sodium of the original. Yet its comforting taste and creamy consistency will surely please the soup lovers in your family!—Bethany Thayer, Troutville, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Crumb Coffee Cake
images.description: With its tender layers and sweet, cinnamon-y swirls, this better-for-you coffee cake is an absolute treat. Friends and family go nuts over it. —Valma Devall, Kennewick, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Sausage Pecan Stuffing
images.description: Nothing about this moist, pecan-topped stuffing says ‘lighter.’ Fabulous flavors! —Healthy Cooking Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Eggplant Parmesan
images.description: Here's a healthy version of a restaurant classic that you can easily make at home. Our recipe has 300 fewer calories and half the fat and sodium of typical eggplant Parmesan. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Stuffed Potato Appetizers
images.description: We barely noticed the difference in this lightened-up version of our favorite dish. We tried it with friends and loved it. —Sonya Labbe, West Hollywood, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Nutty Monkey Malts
images.description: Get all the flavor of a classic diner milkshake with only a fraction of the calories and fat. Flavored with peanut butter and bananas, this is one drink the kids will go crazy for! —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Red Velvet Cake
images.description: I’ve had this recipe for over 45 years and it has become our family’s favorite cake, but I would love to see it get a light makeover. —Betty Selchow, White Bear Lake, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Creamy Macaroni and Cheese
images.description: With its creamy consistency and two different cheeses, this entree captures the essence of comfort food. But here's the kicker-it's been slimmed down for you so you can enjoy it without over indulging. Darcie Zerniak - Ontario, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Rigatoni with Bacon and Asparagus
images.description: Wouldn’t it be great to find a company-worthy dish that not only impresses with its taste, but with its nutrition numbers, too? That’s just what field editor Joanie Fuson of Indianapolis, IN was looking for...and what we were ultimately able to provide with her amazing rigatoni with bacon and asparagus. Joanie Fuson — Indianapolis, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Penne with Vodka Cream Sauce
images.description: Makeover Penne with Vodka Cream Sauce is still creamy, rich and restaurant-quality special, but it now has less than half the original recipe’s fat and cholesterol. Even our pros had a hard time telling them apart. Debra Torres - Clarion, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Loaded Baked Potato Salad
images.description: Crispy bacon, crunchy pickle, cheddar cheese and a creamy dressing are guaranteed to make this salad a family favorite.—Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Corn Pudding
images.description: Passed down for generations, this recipe was a cherished family tradition at holidays and special gatherings. Now, with less than half the fat, sodium and cholesterol of the original, it can be served up for generations to come! —Arlene Spencer, Oconomowoc, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Lemon Pound Cake
images.description: For this lovely golden cake, I use fat-free yogurt to trim the calories. It's a comforting dessert for days when it's warm enough to dine outside. —Lauren Gilmore, Pennington, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Sour Cream Chicken Enchiladas
images.description: My husband knows he's in for a treat when I begin rolling the enchiladas. This is his favorite dish, and the makeover version is yummy! We think it's a home run. —Rynnetta Garner, Dallas, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Homemade Makeover Italian Cream Cake
images.description: Toasted pecans and coconut take this moist cake from good to great, but it's the cream cheese frosting that makes it truly extraordinary. Thank goodness it's a makeover, because you'll definitely want seconds! —Christy White, Oxford, Mississippi Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
images.description: Both of my boys loved this makeover version of a family favorite, and even my husband, who is a bit picky, wants a piece in his lunch tomorrow! —Mary Lou Moeller, Wooster, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Gooey Chocolate Peanut Butter Cake
images.description: My dad made sure this dessert was on the menu for Father's Day—or else! This makeover version is great. I can't believe so much fat was cut and it still tastes like the original. —Trisha Kruse, Eagle, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Blueberry French Toast
images.description: With this luscious makeover from our Test Kitchen, Joan has all the decadent richness and flavor of her original recipe but fewer calories and less fat and cholesterol. Joan Hallford - North Richland Hills, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Frosty Lemon Squares
images.description: This dessert has a lemony filling sandwiched between two creamy layers and a crunchy crust. What's not to love? Simple changes in the original recipe subtracted a lot of the calories and saturated fat, but left a ton of great lemon flavor and a rich cream cheese layer. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Spinach and Artichoke Casserole
images.description: Spinach never tasted better than in this creamy, colorful dish that's now even healthier and more delicious! —Judy Armstrong, Prairieville, Louisiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Manicotti Crepes
images.description: This made-lighter main dish will add a special touch to any event. “Green pepper and garlic give it a fresh vegetable aroma," Christine Rukavena relates from Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Waffles
images.description: These waffles taste just as terrific as the original recipe—with only half the fat. In other words, dust off that waffle iron because these breakfast sensations are a wonderful way to start your day! Carol Burger - Phillips, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Farm Girl Breakfast Casserole
images.description: “I served this lightened-up makeover casserole to my husband, Ken. He said it was fluffy—and very good!” —Nancy Zimmerman, Cape May Court House, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Sweet Kugel
images.description: This is a traditional recipe I make for the holidays. My close friend and I used to bake together until she moved 1,300 miles away. Now when I make this dish, I’m reminded of our time together. —Eileen Wolf, Abington, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Reuben Melt
images.description: This twist on a classic Reuben keeps the corned beef and uses a sauce made with Swiss (and plenty of thousand-island flavor). Fresh slaw on top replaces the sauerkraut. —Jenni Sharp, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover White Fruitcake
images.description: A beloved fruitcake recipe has been passed down through the generations, and I've made it lighter and brighter. I remember my mother making this every December—it just wouldn’t be Christmas in our home without it. —Judy Grebetz, Racine, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Spinach-Stuffed Chicken Pockets
images.description: For an easy, upscale chicken dish, you'll love these spinach-stuffed chicken breasts. You can also double the recipe without much effort. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Noodle Kugel
images.description: We think you'll feel good about serving this fabulous brunch dish, now that it's lower in saturated fat by 8 g and in cholesterol by 115 mg. —Cathy Tang, Redmond, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Maple Coffee Cake
images.description: Downsizing the sugar and margarine, and switching to fat-free milk made all the difference in this coffee cake recipe, but without sacrificing one tasty crumb of flavor. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Pick-Me-Up Cream Cheese Brownies
images.description: The lightened up version of these brownies tastes absolutely decadent but weighs in at a modest 159 calories and 8 g fat per serving. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Old-Fashioned Ice Cream Roll
images.description: This dessert is so convenient to make ahead of time and keep in the freezer for company. Cake and ice cream make it the best of two worlds! The original recipe's caramel sauce was high in fat and calories. Our Taste of Home Test Kitchen makeover version tastes great—and makes a nice topping for ice cream, too. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Semisweet Espresso Cheesecake
images.description: With fabulous flavor and a firmer texture that cuts like a breeze, this dish has only half the saturated fat and cholesterol as the original. —Sonya Labbe, Santa Monica, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Makeover Sloppy Joe Mac and Cheese
images.description: Decreasing the butter and replacing the half-and-half with milk helped cut a whopping 658 calories and more than half the fat from this casserole. Even though the cholesterol was reduced by 75% and the sodium by 40%, Makeover Sloppy Joe Mac and Cheese offers all the heart-warming comfort of the original submission. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 79 Drool-Worthy Comfort Food Makeovers

items.title: 73 Divine Church Bake Sale Recipes
items.abstract: For the most soul-stirring bake sale recipes, a good old-fashioned church bake sale is hard to beat. These heavenly cookies, bars, breads and pies will inspire you to bake up a few batches of the delicious money-makers at home.
items.author: Kristin Sutter

images.title: Blueberry Kuchen
images.description: In the summer, we can get beautiful, plump blueberries, which I use in this easy-to-make coffee cake. I like to freeze extra blueberries so I have them available any time I want this treat. —Anne Krueger, Richmond, British Columbia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Rainbow S'moreo Cookies
images.description: Homemade Oreo cookies are pretty great on their own, but they're even better when you add graham cracker crumbs to the cookie dough, stuff them with marshmallow creme, and then roll them in sprinkles. You can change the color of the sprinkles depending on the holiday or occasion you're baking them for. —Colleen Delawder, Herndon, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Winnie's Mini Rhubarb & Strawberry Pies
images.description: Every spring, we had strawberries and rhubarb on our farm outside Seattle. These fruity hand pies remind me of those times and of Grandma Winnie’s baking. —Shawn Carleton, San Diego, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cream Cheese Swirl Brownies
images.description: I'm a chocolate lover, and this treat has satisfied my cravings many times. No one guesses the brownies are light because their chewy texture and rich chocolate taste can't be beat. My family requests them often, and I'm happy to oblige. —Heidi Johnson Worland, Wyoming Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Doughnut Drops
images.description: I always have a few special treats handy when the grandchildren visit. These cake doughnuts are one of their favorite snacks. —Beva Staum, Muscoda, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Ice Cream Cone Treats
images.description: I came up with this recipe as a way for my grandkids to enjoy Rice Krispies Treats without getting sticky hands. You can also pack the cereal mixture into paper cups and insert a freezer pop stick to create cute pops. —Mabel Nolan, Vancouver, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Orange Walnut Bread
images.description: Cranberry Bread is a natural coming from Oregon, a state famous for its cranberries. And each fall my husband and I go out and scrounge around picking up the walnuts for this delicious bread. A lady was presenting this bread at a food fair when I had the "nerve" to ask her for the recipe. She obliged, and it's been a steady item in our menu ever since. But not just at Thanksgiving—heavens, no! I freeze the berries and have a ready supply all year long. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Almond-Coconut Lemon Bars
images.description: Give traditional lemon bars a tasty twist with the addition of almonds and coconut. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate-Glazed Doughnut Cookies
images.description: My little nieces love to help decorate these doughnut-shaped cookies. They top them with sprinkles, chopped pecans or crushed candy canes. —Jolie Stinson, Marion, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Almond Cream Spritz
images.description: Love spritz cookies at Christmastime? Try this version featuring almond-flavored dough and chopped almonds sprinkled on top. —Jo-Anne Cooper, Camrose, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Raspberry Patch Crumb Bars
images.description: To give these fresh, fruity bars even more crunch, add a sprinkling of nuts to the yummy crumb topping. Everyone will want to indulge. —Leanna M. Thorne, Lakewood, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Amish Sugar Cookies
images.description: These easy-to-make cookies simply melt in your mouth! I've passed the recipe around to many friends. After I gave the recipe to my sister, she entered the cookies in a local fair and won the "best of show" prize! —Sylvia Ford, Kennett, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Chip Red Velvet Whoopie Pies
images.description: Baking a fun treat is a must when my four grandchildren come for “Grandma Camp.” This year I’ll recruit the oldest, Henry, to help pipe the cake batter. —Linda Schend, Kenosha, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Snow Angel Cookies
images.description: Get a little snow at the holidays, no matter where you are. Head to the kitchen and bake a batch of angel cookies swirled with heavenly frosting. —Carolyn Moseley, Dayton, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Winning Apricot Bars
images.description: This recipe is "down-home" baking at its best, and it really represents all regions of the country! It's won blue ribbons at county fairs and cookie contests in several states! This treat is easy to make, and it's perfect for potluck suppers, bake sales, lunch boxes or just plain snacking. —Jill Moritz, Irvine, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Old-Fashioned Peanut Butter Cookies
images.description: My mother insisted that my grandmother write down one recipe for her when she got married in 1942. That was a real effort because Grandma was a traditional pioneer-type cook who used "a little of this or that 'til it feels right." This treasured recipe is the only one she ever wrote down! —Janet Hall, Clinton, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pecan Pie Bars
images.description: These bars are rich and delicious - just like pecan pie! They're perfect for taking to potlucks and other gatherings...I always come home with an empty pan. —Carolyn Custer, Clifton Park, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry-Orange Bars
images.description: My mother has had this recipe for years. I love it! These bars make great snacks, but can also be served for dessert. —Margaret Adelman, Bellingham, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cider Doughnuts
images.description: Here on our 1,250-acre farm, we usually have a quick breakfast on the go. So I often keep a batch of these light and moist doughnuts on hand. They disappear quickly because no one can eat just one! —Suzanne Christensen, Defiance, Iowa Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Banana Nut Bread
images.description: This quick bread is a family favorite, so I always try to have ripe bananas on hand especially for this recipe. I'm sure your family will love this tasty nutty bread as much as mine. —Susan Jones, La Grange Park, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Mint Brownies
images.description: One of the best things about this recipe is that the brownies get moister if you leave them in the refrigerator for a day or two. The problem at our house is no one can leave them alone for that long! —Helen Baines, Elkton, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Strawberry Oatmeal Bars
images.description: Their fruity filling and fluffy coconut topping make these bars truly one of a kind. They really dress up my trays of Christmas goodies. —Flo Burtnett, Gage, Oklahoma Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: First Place Coconut Macaroons
images.description: THESE COOKIES earned me a first-place ribbon at the county fair. They remain my husband's favorites—whenever I make them to give away, he always asks me where his batch is! I especially like the fact that the recipe makes a small enough batch for the two of us to nibble on. —Penny Ann Habeck Shawana, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Pie Squares
images.description: The first time my husband and two daughters tried this dessert, they thought it was delicious. It has all of the spicy pumpkin goodness of the traditional pie without the fuss of a pastry crust. —Denise Goedeken, Platte Center, Nebraska Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Macadamia Nut Cookies
images.description: These rich cookies are full of Hawaiian macadamia nuts and chocolate chips. —Mary Gaylord, Balsam Lake, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Zucchini Dessert Squares
images.description: We planted one too many zucchini plants a few summers ago and harvested a lot of zucchini that year. I was looking for ways to use them, and this delicious dessert is the result. —Nancy Morelli, Livonia, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Napoleon Cremes
images.description: For the annual Christmas open house we host, I set out a buffet with lots of food and candies like these lovely layered treats. They're so creamy...and with a green pistachio layer of pudding peeking out, they're very merry. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Frosted Cranberry Drop Cookies
images.description: I started making these treats after tasting a batch her friend whipped up. I immediately requested the recipe and have been baking them by the dozens ever since. The icing is an ideal complement to the tart berries in the cookies. —Shirley Kidd, New London, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Big Soft Ginger Cookies
images.description: These nicely spiced soft cookies are perfect for folks who like the flavor of ginger but don't care for crunchy gingersnaps. —Barbara Gray, Boise, Idaho Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon Blueberry Bread
images.description: Of all the quick breads we had growing up, this beautifully glazed berry-studded loaf is the best! The lemon glaze adds a lustrous finish and locks in moisture. —Julianne Johnson, Grove City, Minnesota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Frosted Fudge Brownies
images.description: A neighbor brought over a pan of these rich brownies along with the recipe when I came home from the hospital with our baby daughter. I've made them ever since for family occasions, potlucks and parties at work. —Sue Soderlund, Elgin, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Popcorn Cookies
images.description: It's so much fun to surprise people with the crushed popcorn in these yummy cookies. They're definitely a distinctive cookie on the holiday tray. —Leigh Anne Preston, Palmyra, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pumpkin Whoopie Pies
images.description: My kids start begging me for these cakelike sandwich cookies as soon as autumn arrives. I haven't met a person yet who doesn't like these fun treats. —Deb Stuber, Carlisle, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Crinkle-Top Chocolate Cookies
images.description: When I baked these moist, fudgy cookies for the first time, my three preschool children went wild over them! But I like them because they're lower in fat and easy to mix and bake. —Maria Groff, Ephrata, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Bars
images.description: Whip up a pan of these festive bars in just 20 minutes with staple ingredients and pie filling. Between the easy preparation and pretty color, they're destined to become a holiday classic. —Jane Kamp, Grand Rapids, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Maple Bars
images.description: My family runs a maple syrup operation, and I'm always looking for new ways to incorporate maple syrup into my cooking and baking. These bars are delicious! —Cathy Schumacher, Alto, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Shortbread Hearts
images.description: These flaky cookies melt in your mouth. Dipped in chocolate, they look festive.—Barbara Birk, St. George, Utah Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grandma's Star Cookies
images.description: My husband's grandma would only make these butter cutouts with a star cookie cutter. I use various shapes for celebrations throughout the year. —Jenny Brown, West Lafayette, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lemon Meltaways
images.description: Both the cookie and the frosting are spiked with lemon in these melt-in-your-mouth goodies. Field editor Mary Houchin of Lebanon, Illinois submitted the recipe. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chippy Blond Brownies
images.description: If you love chocolate and butterscotch, you won't be able to resist these chewy brownies. I often include this recipe inside a baking dish as a wedding present. Everyone, young and old, enjoys these delectable treats. —Anna Allen, Owings Mills, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Coffee 'n' Cream Brownies
images.description: A friend gave me the recipe for these rich cakelike brownies topped with a creamy coffee-enhanced filling and a chocolate glaze. I like to garnish each square with a coffee bean. —Michelle Tiemstra, Lacombe, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Double Nut Baklava
images.description: It may take some time to make this rich, buttery treat, but it's well worth the effort! The blend of coconut, pecans and macadamia nuts is irresistible. —Kari Kelley, Plains, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Stained Glass Gelatin
images.description: Kids love this sweet, wiggly gelatin and whipped topping dessert. Use different flavors of gelatin to make color versions that are as wild as your imagination. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies
images.description: Crazy about chocolate chips? This chewy cookie has plenty, not to mention lots of heart-healthy oatmeal. The gang’ll come back for more and more... so this big batch is perfect. —Diane Neth, Menno, South Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Peanutty Candy Bars
images.description: These chewy, gooey bars surely won't last long. Good thing they're quick and easy to make!—Mary Schmittinger, Colgate, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Candy Cane Chocolate Loaves
images.description: Having lots of leftover candy canes after Christmas inspired me to combine them with a favorite chocolate bread recipe. —Shelly Platten, Amherst, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Buttery 3-Ingredient Shortbread Cookies
images.description: These buttery cookies get instant holiday flair thanks to delicate snowflake designs on top. To create them, see the Editor's Note at the end of the recipe. —Pattie Prescott, Manchester, New Hampshire Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: White Chocolate Cranberry Blondies
images.description: This recipe is often requested for wedding receptions. For a fancier presentation, cut the bars into triangle shapes and drizzle white chocolate over each one individually. —Erika Busz, Kent, Washington Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gluten-Free Peanut Butter Kiss Cookies
images.description: Guests will stand in line to kiss the cook when these treats are served! For a change of pace, try them with chunky peanut butter, too. —Canada60, Tasteofhome.com Community Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Boston Cream Pie Cookies
images.description: I sandwich vanilla custard between tender, cake-like cookies. With their shiny chocolate glaze, these bite-size cookies remind me of Boston cream pie. —Evangeline Bradford, Erlanger, Kentucky Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Maple Pecan Tarts
images.description: I absolutely love pecans. I combine them with maple and vanilla to create the ultimate tart, made even richer with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. —Redawna Kalynchuk, Barrhead, Alberta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Strawberry Shortcake Cookies
images.description: Strawberry shortcake is one of my favorite desserts. I thought it would be great to capture all that wonderful flavor in a cookie. The pastry-like cookie is topped with pink strawberry frosting. —Allison Anderson, Avondale, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Giant Monster Cookies
images.description: Who can resist a gigantic cookie chock-full of goodies like chocolate chips, M&M's and peanut butter? If your appetite isn't quite monster-size, make them by heaping tablespoonfuls. —Judy Fredenberg, Missoula, Montana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Crunch Bars
images.description: My twist on rice crispy bars includes crunchy crushed pretzels. Then I top them with a creamy peanut butter coating and rich chocolate topping. Garnished with peanuts and even more pretzels, I don’t think I'd ever go back to plain old bars again. —Sherri Melotik, Oak Creek, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Old-Fashioned Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
images.description: I've been making these cookies for nearly 30 years. The flavor is delicious and they are always a well appreciated. This is an all-time favorite with my family. —Nancy Horton, Greenbrier, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Apple-Maple Blondies
images.description: My 6-year-old son and I conjured up this recipe to use up the last of the apples we picked from the local apple orchard. Serve it with a dollop of sweetened whipped cream. —Heather Bates, Athens, Maine Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Red Star Cookies
images.description: These super stars are plenty sweet and sturdy, making them great for shipping. Slip decorated cookies in stacks of three inside plastic storage bags then rest stacks in disposable plastic containers. Put containers in a cardboard box, then add crumpled newspaper so everything is tightly packed. Seal it with a kiss—or a card. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Frosted Malted Milk Cookies
images.description: My family loves anything made with malt or chocolate malted milk balls, so these cookies are one of their favorites!—Nancy Foust, Stoneboro, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Jelly Bean Cookies
images.description: It's a family tradition for my grandmother and me to make these colorful cookies every year for the holidays. —Cheyenne Fink, Pleasantville, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chewy Salted Peanut Bars
images.description: My rich bars are studded with the all-American peanut. I like to think famed peanut farmer Jimmy Carter would approve. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Maple Shortbread Cookies
images.description: Whenever I visit friends in Lutsen, Minnesota, I make sure to buy maple syrup there because I think it's even better than in Quebec. These delicious cookies can be decorated with sprinkles or they're just fine as is.—Lorraine Caland, Shuniah, Ontario Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Gingerbread-Pumpkin Cheesecake Bars
images.description: A party favorite of ours is gingersnaps and pumpkin dip. I combined those flavors for a wonderful cross between gingerbread bar cookies and cheesecake. —Kathleen Rhodebeck, Penacook, New Hampshire Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fudgy S'mores Brownies
images.description: I combined the perfect, simple summer snack with my favorite brownie recipe to get a treat that's sure to wow at your next big party. —Judy Cunningham, Max, North Dakota Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Strawberry Cookies
images.description: I learned to bake with my grandmother and mother. I knew I was giving them a sweet new family tradition when I shared this recipe with them. —Andrea Zulauf, Livonia, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Coconut-Almond Cookie Bark
images.description: As kids, my friends and I sandwiched Almond Joys between cookies. For our high school reunion, I re-created the idea with a tasty cookie version that breaks apart like chocolate bark.—Faith Cromwell, San Francisco, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Crazy Halloween Blondies
images.description: I have a real sweet tooth, so Halloween is my favorite holiday. I came up with these bars for my kids, but I think I like them even more than they do! —Nancy Heishman, Las Vegas, Nevada Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grandma Krauses' Coconut Cookies
images.description: When my two daughters were young, their great-grandma made them cookies with oats and coconut. Thankfully, she shared the recipe. —Debra Dorn, Homosassa, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry Clementine Bars
images.description: I love a good lemon bar but when the holidays roll around and clementines are everywhere, I make this holiday twist on a classic dessert. —Laurie Lufkin, Essex, MA Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Marshmallow Cutouts
images.description: I make rich, fudgy cookies that taste like brownies with a marshmallow filling. I usually use heart-shaped cutters, but I've also left them uncut and filled with pink marshmallow creme.—Kelly Ward, Stratford, ON Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Snickerdoodle Crisps
images.description: This classic cookie from New England can be made two ways: soft or crunchy. My happy version with cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg is crispy to perfection. —Jenni Sharp, Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Bacon Chocolate Chip Cheesecake Blondies
images.description: If you're a sweet and savory fan like me, you'll go wild over these. You just can't beat a cookie, brownie and cheesecake all mixed up and sprinkled with bacon. —Katie O'Keeffe, Derry, NH Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mom's Chocolate Bread
images.description: My mom made this divine chocolaty bread only for holidays or special requests, but it makes any old morning even better. I always think of our family when I smell it baking. —Rachel Rhodes, Bedford, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Humble Bumble Crumble Bars
images.description: While developing a treat for my bingo group, I asked my husband for ideas. He suggested a fruity bar. This berry bar is lightly sweet and so easy. —Nancy Phillips, Portland, Maine Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 73 Recipes to Bring to a Church Bake Sale

items.title: 28 Delicious Recipes for Two
items.abstract: Are you a small-scale cook? Here's a roundup of great-tasting chicken, pork, beef, seafood and veggie recipes for two. Now you can have something different every night without getting stuck with leftovers.
items.author: Julie Blume Benedict

images.title: Beef Orange Stir-Fry
images.description: This dinner for two is loaded with lots of flavor and color. Red pepper flakes add a little kick to the orange sauce, and the tender veggies add a pop of color.— Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chicken Creole for Two
images.description: I ladle this vegetable-packed chicken dish over jasmine rice. It’s a long-grain rice that’s not as sticky as most, but any cooked rice, including brown, works here. —Virginia Crowell, Lyons, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Buffalo Sloppy Joes for Two
images.description: Lean ground turkey makes this a lighter sloppy joe than the standard ground beef version. A hefty splash of hot sauce and optional blue cheese provide an authentic Buffalo-style flavor. —Maria Regakis, Saugus, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Orange-Pecan Salmon for Two
images.description: Give a classic seafood meal a flavorful twist with the addition or orange and pecan. This saucy salmon is the perfect meal for a romantic dinner for two. —Pat Neaves, Lees Summit, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Shrimp Fried Rice Quesadillas
images.description: Easy to make and always a treat, these fun quesadillas are bursting with flavor. The pepper Jack cheese gives them a nice kick. Feel free to add leftover fried rice.—Artland Campbell, Hyannis, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Curried Coconut Chicken for Two
images.description: Looking for a new way to fix chicken breasts? This five-ingredient recipe is a nice change of pace. It's sweet, savory and a little exotic. Serve it over rice or couscous. —Becky Walch, Manteca, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Grilled Veggie Tortillas for Two
images.description: Put your garden vegetables to good use in this delightful entree, which resembles a pizza. —Sharon Delaney-Chronis, South Milwaukee, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sizzling Ancho Ribeyes for Two
images.description: We love the taste of chipotle chili on just about anything. This simple, delicious recipe proves that chipotle pairs perfectly with grilled steak. —Angela Spengler, Tampa, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Homemade Fish Sticks
images.description: I'm a nutritionist and needed a healthy fish fix. Moist inside and crunchy outside, these are great with oven fries or roasted veggies and low-fat homemade tartar sauce. —Jennifer Rowland, Elizabethtown, Kentucky Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: BLT Skillet
images.description: This quick weeknight meal reminds me of a BLT, with its chunks of bacon and tomato. The whole wheat linguine gives the skillet dish extra flavor and texture. —Edrie O'Brien, Denver, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Sauteed Scallops & Shrimp Pasta
images.description: I created this tempting seafood pasta for my wife. It’s a terrific meal served with crusty sourdough. If you don't like spice, skip the red pepper flakes. —George Levinthal, Goleta, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spinach & Gouda-Stuffed Pork Cutlets
images.description: This started as a restaurant copycat dish at home. Cheese just oozes out of the center, and mustard lends a lot of flavor. —Joan Oakland, Troy, Montanta Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spinach & Feta Stuffed Chicken
images.description: My chicken bundles are simple, clean and comforting. Serve them with wild rice and green beans for one of our favorite meals. —Jim Knepper, Mount Holly Springs, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mahogany-Glazed Cornish Hen
images.description: I make this for my husband and myself for holiday dinners. It's an elegant tradition custom fit for two. —Jeannette Sabo, Lexington Park, Maryland Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Broccoli Chicken Stir-Fry for Two
images.description: Served on a bed of spaghetti squash, this easy stir-fry offers a restaurant-quality dinner at a fraction of the cost. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Couscous & Sausage-Stuffed Acorn Squash
images.description: If you have a tiny apartment, zero counter space and only two people to feed, hefty meals are out. This acorn squash with couscous is just the right size. —Jessica Levinson, Nyack, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pork Chops with Mushroom Bourbon Sauce
images.description: The golden crusted pork chops are accompanied with a rich mushroom sauce. This scrumptious entree is loved by my family and makes a terrific company dish. This is wonderful served with mashed potatoes. —Nadine Mesch, Mount Healthy, Ohio Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spicy Turkey Lettuce Wraps
images.description: My go-to meal after an evening run is this satisfying turkey wrap with jicama, a potato-like root veggie used in Mexican cooking. —Christie Arp, Blue Ridge, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pork Chops with Cherry Sauce
images.description: Enjoy the rich flavor of this pork chop dish. The spice rub also works well on lamb or beef. —Kendra Doss, Colorado Springs, Colorado Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chicken Reuben Roll-Ups
images.description: My Nebraska-native husband loves Reuben sandwiches and anything with chicken, so I combined his two favorites in a fun roll-up. —Ashli Kottwitz, Hermitage, Tennessee Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spinach-Stuffed Chicken Pockets for Two
images.description: With their creamy filling and delightful crispy crust, these elegant entrees are easy enough for weeknights, yet special enough for company, too. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Fire Island Ziti for Two
images.description: I've always been fascinated by Fire Island and thought the name was fitting for this slightly spicy pasta dish. —Candace Reed, DeSoto, Texas Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Braised Beef with Mushrooms
images.description: This slow-cooked beef is so tender, it melts in your mouth. The ingredients have time to season the meat, and it's a delicious entree for two. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Skewerless Stovetop Kabobs for Two
images.description: “We love this quick and easy recipe. It’s also great on the grill.” Jennifer Mitchell - Altoona, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Homemade Chicken Cordon Bleu
images.description: This is a great, fast dinner for two, and the leftovers are just as tasty. It's easy to fix and makes an elegant entree. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Turkey Saltimbocca
images.description: I kept prosciutto and sage in this Italian classic, but instead of veal I added turkey. This Saltimbocca is so divine, you won't believe how quick and easy it is. —Deirdre Cox, Kansas City, Missouri Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Zesty Baked Catfish
images.description: This catfish combines common pantry seasonings for a taste that's anything but basic. —Karen Conklin, Supply, North Carolina Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Crispy Buffalo Chicken Roll-Ups for Two
images.description: These winning chicken rolls with a crispy crust are both impressive and easy to make. My family and friends absolutely love them! —Lisa Keys, Kennett Square, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

items.shortTitle: 28 Delicious Recipes for Two

items.title: 30 Delish Ways to Celebrate The Bachelorette Season Finale
items.abstract: Treat your gal pals to snacks, sweets and drinks inspired by the famous reality TV show.
items.author: Tasteofhome

images.title: Cutout Wedding Cookies
images.description: The dessert table shapes up sweetly when we make these crisp, almond-flavored cookies for family weddings. Hearts, lips, doves, bells and other love-themed cutters work well.—Grace Van Timmeren, Grand Rapids, Michigan Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Heavenly Filled Strawberries
images.description: These luscious stuffed berries are the perfect bite-size dessert. —Stephen Munro, Beaver Bank, Nova Scotia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Ham 'n' Cheese Biscuit Stacks
images.description: I make these finger sandwiches for holidays and Super Bowl parties, too. They’re pretty enough for a baby shower and hearty enough for the guys. —Kelly Williams, Forked River, New Jersey Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate-Dipped Strawberry Meringue Roses
images.description: Eat these kid-friendly treats as is, or crush them into a bowl of strawberries and whipped cream. Readers of my blog, utry.it, went nuts when I posted that idea! —Amy Tong, Anaheim, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Quick White Sangria
images.description: Using white instead of red wine makes my version of sangria a little lighter, yet it still has the same wonderful sweetness. Frozen fruit allows me to serve this any time of year. —Sharon Tipton, Orlando, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Pretty Pink Punch
images.description: This refreshing punch is convenient because you can make it ahead of time and just add the ginger ale just before serving. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Strawberry Shortcake Cookies
images.description: Strawberry shortcake is one of my favorite desserts. I thought it would be great to capture all that wonderful flavor in a cookie. The pastry-like cookie is topped with pink strawberry frosting. —Allison Anderson, Avondale, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Valentine Heart Brownies
images.description: Steal hearts this Valentine's Day with brownies that have cute frosting centers. They're simply irresistible. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Cream Cupcakes
images.description: My favorite hockey team the Boston Bruins inspired these cupcakes. Add a love note on top using a little white icing. —Alisa Christensen, RSM, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Crabbie Phyllo Cups
images.description: I always like a little extra chili sauce on top of these easy snacks. If you're out of crab, try them with water-packed tuna. —Johnna Johnson, Scottsdale, Arizona Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Kiss Cookies
images.description: Topped with a chocolate kiss, these cherry-flavored cookies look super cute on a dessert tray. Share them with family and friends. —Joy Yurk, Grafton, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: P.S. I Love You Cake
images.description: Growing up, there was always some scrumptious treat to eat at our house. The name my mom chose for this cake has a double meaning: P.S. for the type of cake (poppy seed) and for the love note to her family. —Sue Groetsch, La Crosse, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Mulled Wine
images.description: This mulled wine is soothing and satisfying with a delightful blend of spices warmed to perfection. Refrigerating the wine mixture overnight allows the flavors to blend, so don't omit this essential step.—Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Nutella-Stuffed Strawberries
images.description: Gourmet strawberries are pricey to order but easy to make. We serve strawberries with hazelnut spread as a crowd-pleasing appetizer or dessert. —Darlene Brenden, Salem, Oregon Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Ham & Brie Pastries
images.description: Growing up, I loved pocket pastries. Now with a busy family, I need quick bites, and my spin on the classic ham and cheese delivers at snack or supper time. —Jennifer Tidwell, Fair Oaks, California Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate Lover's Pizza
images.description: I created this after my dad said that my graham cracker crust should be topped with dark chocolate and pecans. It's easy to customize by adding your favorite chocolate and toppers. Dad thinks the whole world should know about this pizza! —Kathy Rairigh, Milford, Indiana Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Chocolate-Raspberry Cutout Cookies
images.description: When my daughter, Katie, was 2, the juicy, ripe raspberries in my backyard inspired me to create this cutout cookie. It's become a mother-daughter tradition to pick the raspberries, choose the cutter shapes, cut out the cookies and frost them. We treasure the hours we’ve shared in the kitchen creating not only delightful cookies, but lasting memories.—Cindy Beberman, Orland Park, Illinois Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Marinated Olive & Cheese Ring
images.description: We love to make meals into celebrations, and antipasto always kicks off the party for Italian dinners. This one is almost too pretty to eat, especially when sprinkled with pimientos, fresh basil and parsley. —Patricia Harmon, Baden, Pennsylvania Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Champagne Party Punch
images.description: To make this punch even more festive, float an ice ring in the punch. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Ranch Popcorn
images.description: What’s movie night at home without some popcorn to munch? Try a big tub of this buttery, showstopping blend. It’s easy, cheesy and finger-lickin’ good. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Glazed Strawberry Cookies
images.description: I learned to bake with my grandmother and mother. I knew I was giving them a sweet new family tradition when I shared this recipe with them. —Andrea Zulauf, Livonia, New York Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lots of Love Cherry Pies
images.description: Become the Queen of Hearts when you make these tart-style cherry pies (but without the pepper and treacle, as in "Alice and Wonderland"). Made as single servings, they disappear at the hands of friends and knaves alike. —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cranberry-Orange Sangria
images.description: Letting this sangria sit in the fridge overnight improves the fruitiness, making it the perfect do-ahead drink for a party. It's also nice with a splash of brandy. —Maria Regakis, Somerville, Massachusetts Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Lovely Lemon Cheesecake
images.description: Watch for the oohs and ahs when you present this luxurious cheesecake. The lemon flavor gives it a bright and tangy flair. —Margaret Allen, Abingdon, Virginia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Greek Stuffed Mini Potatoes
images.description: I love this recipe because you can serve it warm or cold. I usually make these stuffed potatoes ahead and serve them chilled with a tzatziki sauce. —Dee Guelcher, Acworth, Georgia Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Cherry Bounce
images.description: Smooth and with the fragrant flavor of sweet cherries, this homemade libation makes a wonderful holiday gift. For an additional treat, the drained cherries are delicious over vanilla ice cream. —Matt Warren, Mequon, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Jellied Champagne Dessert
images.description: This refreshing dessert looks just like a glass of bubbling champagne.—James Schend, Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Brie Puff Pastry
images.description: My husband was in the Air Force so we've entertained guests in many parts of the world. I acquired this recipe while in California. It's one of my favorite special appetizers. —Sandra Twait, Tampa, Florida Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Berry Mini Cheesecakes
images.description: There's always room for dessert when it's just a bite! —Taste of Home Test Kitchen Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home

images.title: Spiked Pink Lady
images.description: Why reserve lemonade and strawberries for the summertime? They’re just as refreshing during the holiday season. Add two more ingredients to create a crowd-pleasing cocktail. Get Recipe
images.author: Provided by Taste of Home
